original: @14a * // 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i tshul gyi mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa bzhugs //
analyzed: @14a * // 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i tshul gyi mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa bzhugs //
translated: The Commentary on the Ornament of Clear Realization, the Instructional Treatise on the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: @14b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @14b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: panytsa bim sha ti s'a hasvi ka a'arya pra dzny'a p'a ra mi t'a pa de sh'a aa bhi sa ma ya aa lam k'a ra sh'astra s+ya britti /
analyzed: panytsa bim sha ti s'a hasvi ka a'arya pra dzny'a p'a ra mi t'a pa de sh'a aa bhi sa ma ya aa lam k'a ra sh'astra s+ya britti /
translated: Pañcaviṃśatisāhasrikāyārṣāyaṇaprajñāpāramitāpadeśaśāstrābhisamayālaṅkāravyākhyā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol ru phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol ru phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Ornament of Clear Realization, the Instructional Treatise on the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Mother, the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: nyan thos zhi ba tshol rnams kun shes nyid kyis nyer zhir khrid mdzad gang yin dang ; /'gro la phan par byed rnams lam shes nyid kyis 'jig rten don sgrub mdzad pa gang //
analyzed: nyan thos zhi ba tshol rnams kun shes nyid kyis nyer zhir khrid mdzad gang yin dang ; /'gro la phan par byed rnams lam shes nyid kyis 'jig rten don sgrub mdzad pa gang //
translated: The one who guides those of the Śrāvaka vehicle seeking peace by means of the knowledge of all aspects, and the one who accomplishes the aims of the world by means of the knowledge of the path for those who act to benefit transmigrating beings.

original: gang dang yang dag ldan pas thub rnams rnam pa kun ldan sna tshogs 'di gsungs pa //
analyzed: gang dang yang dag ldan pas thub rnams rnam pa kun ldan sna tshogs 'di gsungs pa //
translated: The one endowed with which the Sages have taught this Perfection of Wisdom in all its aspects.

original: nyan thos nang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs bcas sangs rgyas kyi ni yum de la phyag 'tshal /
analyzed: nyan thos nang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs bcas sangs rgyas kyi ni yum de la phyag 'tshal /
translated: I pay homage to that mother of the Buddhas, together with the hosts of Bodhisattvas and Śrāvakas.

original: don gang zhig zhe na /
analyzed: don gang zhig zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du mdzad nas thams cad mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan nye bar dgod pa sngon du 'gro bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi dbang du mdzad nas thams cad mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum gyi thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan nye bar dgod pa sngon du 'gro bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: With respect to all the noble individuals, the homage to the perfection of wisdom is preceded by the presentation of the uncommon qualities of the three types of omniscience.

original: zhes brjod pa 'di ni de'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi man ngag bshad sbyar du bya'o snyam pas rnam par dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa 'di ni de'i mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi man ngag bshad sbyar du bya'o snyam pas rnam par dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: This is the instruction on the Ornament of Clear Realization, I think, so I will explain it.

original: zhes mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi bshad pa 'di sbyar bar dam bca' ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi bshad pa 'di sbyar bar dam bca' ba yin no //
translated: This is the promise to compose the commentary on the Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
translated: The path to omniscience

original: ston pas 'di rnams bshad pa gang //
analyzed: ston pas 'di rnams bshad pa gang //
translated: is taught by the Teacher.

original: gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin de //
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin de //
translated: It is not experienced by others.

original: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid kyi //
translated: It is the nature of the ten Dharma activities.

original: mdo don dran pa la gzhag nas //🔽blo dang ldan pas mthong gyur phyir //
analyzed: mdo don dran pa la gzhag nas // blo dang ldan pas mthong gyur phyir //
translated: Having established the meaning of the sutra in memory,🔽the wise one sees it.🔽Therefore, it is called

original: bde blag tu ni rtogs pa zhes //
analyzed: bde blag tu ni rtogs pa zhes //
translated: easily understood.

original: bya ba brtsam pa'i dgos pa yin //
analyzed: bya ba brtsam pa'i dgos pa yin //
translated: This is the purpose of the composition.

original: zhes de ltar phyag 'tshal ba nye bar bkod pa'i tshigs su bcad pas yang dag par mtshon pa'i don 'di yod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes de ltar phyag 'tshal ba nye bar bkod pa'i tshigs su bcad pas yang dag par mtshon pa'i don 'di yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning indicated by the verse of homage is present here.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: ci mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan rtogs pa'i rgyan 'di gzhi bsdus pas sam /
analyzed: ci mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan rtogs pa'i rgyan 'di gzhi bsdus pas sam /
translated: One should ask: Is this Ornament of Realization an ornament because it summarizes the bases,

original: 'on te gnyen po bsdus pas sam /🔽de ste rnam pa bsdus pas rgyan du byed pa yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya @15a * //
analyzed: 'on te gnyen po bsdus pas sam / de ste rnam pa bsdus pas rgyan du byed pa yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya @15a * //
translated: or because it summarizes the antidotes,

original: ba yin no //
analyzed: ba yin no //
translated: or because it summarizes the aspects?

original: de las kyang cir 'gyur zhen /
analyzed: de las kyang cir 'gyur zhen /
translated: And what would follow from that?

original: phyogs dang po ltar na ni 'bad pa don med pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dang po ltar na ni 'bad pa don med pa yin te /
translated: If it were the first case, then the effort would be pointless,

original: mdo sde 'di las mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos dag las mi smos pa'i gzhi gang yin pa de bshad pa ni med do //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos dag las mi smos pa'i gzhi gang yin pa de bshad pa ni med do //
translated: because there is nothing explained in this sūtra that is not already mentioned in the treatises on the characteristics.

original: gnyis pa ltar na rnam par byang pa'i dngos po bsdus pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po ma bsdus pas 'di gang gi gnyen po yin pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ltar na rnam par byang pa'i dngos po bsdus pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po ma bsdus pas 'di gang gi gnyen po yin pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the second case, then since it would summarize only the things that are purified, it would not summarize the things that are afflictive, and so it would not be understood what its antidote is.

original: gsum pa ltar na yang rnam pa gzhi med pa tsam zhig bsdus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gsum pa ltar na yang rnam pa gzhi med pa tsam zhig bsdus pa'i phyir //
translated: If it were the third case, then since it would summarize only the aspects that are baseless,

original: don rtogs pa med pas cung zad kyang ma bshad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don rtogs pa med pas cung zad kyang ma bshad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: since there would be no understanding of the meaning, nothing would be explained at all.

original: phyogs gsum car gyis kyang bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gsum car gyis kyang bsdus pa yin no //
translated: It is also included in all three.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin thams cad shes pa nyid pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis mngon par rtogs pa mtha' dag bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin thams cad shes pa nyid pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis mngon par rtogs pa mtha' dag bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the complete realizations of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and buddhas are included in the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of all aspects, respectively.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor thams cad shes pa nyid ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor thams cad shes pa nyid ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin no //
translated: As the Bhagavān said, “Su­bhūti, the knowledge of all aspects is that of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: lam shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the path is that of the bodhisattvas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin no //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is that of the tathāgatas, arhats, and samyaksaṃbuddhas.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du thams cad 'tshal ba nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du thams cad 'tshal ba nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lags /
translated: “Lord, why is the knowledge of all phenomena the knowledge of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas?”

original: rab 'byor thams cad ni phyi dang nang gi chos rnams ji snyed pa 'di tsam yin la de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor thams cad ni phyi dang nang gi chos rnams ji snyed pa 'di tsam yin la de dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because there are just so many inner and outer phenomena, and the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas know them,

original: lam thams cad kyis kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: lam thams cad kyis kyang ma yin la /
translated: but not by all the paths,

original: rnam pa thams cad du'ang ma yin pas de'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du'ang ma yin pas de'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: and not in all aspects. Therefore, it is called the knowledge of all phenomena of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du lam gyi rnam pa 'tshal ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du lam gyi rnam pa 'tshal ba nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lags /
translated: “Lord, why is the knowledge of the aspects of the path the knowledge of the bodhisattvas?”

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nyan thos kyi lam gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi la gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam @15b gang yin pa'i lam thams cad bskyed par bya zhing lam thams cad shes par bya la de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par bya zhing de dag gis lam gyi bya ba yang ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nyan thos kyi lam gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi la gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam @15b gang yin pa'i lam thams cad bskyed par bya zhing lam thams cad shes par bya la de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par bya zhing de dag gis lam gyi bya ba yang ste /
translated: Subhūti, for the bodhisattvas, all the paths—whatever the paths of the śrāvakas, whatever the paths of the pratyekabuddhas, and whatever the paths of the buddhas—are to be generated, all the paths are to be known, and they are to be fully completed by them.

original: smon lam yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa dang / sems can rnam yongs su smin par ma byas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs par de dag gis yang dag gis yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi bya'o //
analyzed: smon lam yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa dang / sems can rnam yongs su smin par ma byas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs par de dag gis yang dag gis yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi bya'o //
translated: Without completing the fulfillment of their aspirations, without ripening sentient beings, and without purifying a buddhafield, they should not actualize the reality limit.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the knowledge of path aspects of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi lags /
translated: Bhagavan, why is the knowledge of all aspects the knowledge of all aspects of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Rightly Perfect Buddhas?

original: rab 'byor rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis chos rnam par rab tu mtshon pa'i rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma ded dag de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud de de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis chos rnam par rab tu mtshon pa'i rnam pa de dag dang / rtags de dag dang / mtshan ma ded dag de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud de de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata has understood those aspects, those signs, and those marks by which phenomena are fully revealed. Therefore, the knowledge of all aspects of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Rightly Perfect Buddha is called the knowledge of all aspects.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid ni chos la 'bad pa'i rten can /
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid ni chos la 'bad pa'i rten can /
translated: Among those, the knowledge of all aspects is the basis for striving for the Dharma,

original: 'bras bu bdag tu rmongs pa spangs pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu bdag tu rmongs pa spangs pa can yin no //
translated: and it abandons the result of delusion about the self.

original: lam shes pa nyid ni theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byung ba dang / de kho na nyid mngon du mi byed pa'i rten can /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid ni theg pa ji lta ba bzhin du nges par 'byung ba dang / de kho na nyid mngon du mi byed pa'i rten can /
translated: The knowledge of paths is the result of the vehicle, of the definite emergence in accordance with the vehicle, and of the basis of not actualizing reality.

original: sems can ma bsdus pa sdud pa dang / sems can yongs su ma smin pa yongs su smin par byed pa dang ; sems can yongs su smin pa rnam par grol bar byed pa'i 'bras bu can yin no//
analyzed: sems can ma bsdus pa sdud pa dang / sems can yongs su ma smin pa yongs su smin par byed pa dang ; sems can yongs su smin pa rnam par grol bar byed pa'i 'bras bu can yin no//
translated: It is the result of gathering sentient beings who are not gathered, of bringing to maturity sentient beings who are not mature, and of liberating sentient beings who are mature.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs par sems can gyi don rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pa dang / bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa'i 'bras bu can yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs par sems can gyi don rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pa dang / bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa'i 'bras bu can yin no //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the result of the uninterrupted benefit of sentient beings throughout the realm of space, of the realization of the limit of reality, and of the abandonment of the connection of traces.

original: de lta bas na mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan ni gzhi dang gnyen po dang rnam pa rnams bsdus pas mngon par rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa mtha' dag bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan ni gzhi dang gnyen po dang rnam pa rnams bsdus pas mngon par rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa mtha' dag bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Abhisamayālaṅkāra teaches the complete perfection of realization by condensing the bases, antidotes, and aspects.

original: zhes bya ba 'di 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di 'thad pa yin no //
translated: This should be explained.

original: shes rab kyi @16a * //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa de gang yin zhes bya ba 'di ni brjod par bya'o zhe na /🔽bshad pa / shes rab pha rol phyin pa ni //
analyzed: shes rab kyi @16a * // pha rol tu phyin pa de gang yin zhes bya ba 'di ni brjod par bya'o zhe na / bshad pa / shes rab pha rol phyin pa ni //
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: dngos po brgyad kyis yang dag bshad //
analyzed: dngos po brgyad kyis yang dag bshad //
translated: is explained as having eight topics.

original: rnam kun mkhyen nyid lam shes nyid //
analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen nyid lam shes nyid //
translated: Omniscience, knowledge of the path,

original: de nas thams cad shes pa nyid //
analyzed: de nas thams cad shes pa nyid //
translated: then knowledge of all aspects,🔽complete clear realization of all aspects,

original: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa dang // rtse mor phyin dang mthar gyis pa //
analyzed: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa dang // rtse mor phyin dang mthar gyis pa //
translated: reaching the peak, serial,

original: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //
translated: complete clear realization in one instant,

original: chos kyi sku dang de rnams brgyad //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang de rnams brgyad //
translated: and the dharmakāya—these are the eight.🔽Arousing the mind, instruction,🔽the four aspects of definite emergence,

original: sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag dang // nges 'byang yan lag rnam bzhi dang // sgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang gdams ngag dang // nges 'byang yan lag rnam bzhi dang // sgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
translated: and the support of practice🔽are the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // dmigs pa dag dang ched dang ni //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // dmigs pa dag dang ched dang ni //
translated: The object, purpose,🔽armor, engagement,

original: go cha 'jug pa'i bya ba dang // tshogs ni nges par 'byung bcas rnams //
analyzed: go cha 'jug pa'i bya ba dang // tshogs ni nges par 'byung bcas rnams //
translated: and the accumulations with definite emergence🔽are the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: thub pa'i rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid //🔽mog mog por byed la sogs dang // slob ma bse ru'i lam gang dang// 'di dang gzhan pa'i yon tan gyis //
analyzed: thub pa'i rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid // mog mog por byed la sogs dang // slob ma bse ru'i lam gang dang// 'di dang gzhan pa'i yon tan gyis //
translated: The Omniscience of the Sage

original: phan yon che ba mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: phan yon che ba mthong ba'i lam //
translated: is the path of vision, which is of great benefit,🔽through the dulling of the defilements, etc.,🔽and through the qualities of this and other lives.🔽The path of cultivation is so called🔽because of its performance, its devotedfillment,🔽its praise, its veneration, its glorification,

original: byed pa dang ni mos pa dang // bstod dang bkur dang bsngags pa dang // bsngo dang rjes su yi rang ba //🔽yid la byed pa bla med dag / sgrub dang shin tu dag pa zhes //
analyzed: byed pa dang ni mos pa dang // bstod dang bkur dang bsngags pa dang // bsngo dang rjes su yi rang ba // yid la byed pa bla med dag / sgrub dang shin tu dag pa zhes //
translated: its transference, and its rejoicing.🔽It is also called the path of cultivation

original: bya ba 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam //
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam //
translated: because of its practice and its great purity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas rnams kyis //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas rnams kyis //
translated: The wise Bodhisattvas

original: lam shes nyid ni de 'drar bshad //🔽shes pas srid la mi gnas shing //
analyzed: lam shes nyid ni de 'drar bshad // shes pas srid la mi gnas shing //
translated: have explained the knowledge of the path in this way.🔽Because of their knowledge, they do not dwell in samsara,

original: snying rjes zhi la mi gnas dang // thabs ma yin pas ring ba dang // thabs kyis ring ba ma yin nyid //
analyzed: snying rjes zhi la mi gnas dang // thabs ma yin pas ring ba dang // thabs kyis ring ba ma yin nyid //
translated: and because of their compassion, they do not dwell in nirvana.🔽The path of seeing of the Sravakas and others🔽is distant through lack of skill in means,

original: mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag dang // sbyor dang de yi mnyam nyid dang // nyan thos la sogs mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag dang // sbyor dang de yi mnyam nyid dang // nyan thos la sogs mthong ba'i lam //
translated: but not distant through skill in means.

original: de 'dra kun shes nyid du 'dod //🔽rnam pa sbyor bar bcas rnams dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
analyzed: de 'dra kun shes nyid du 'dod // rnam pa sbyor bar bcas rnams dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
translated: Such is the realization of the omniscience of the Buddha.🔽The path of insight is of two kinds:

original: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob ba phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //🔽srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhing dag bla na med pa ni //🔽rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste //🔽'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin //🔽de yi rtags dang rnam 'phel dang // brtan dang sems kun gnas pa dang // mthong zhes bya dang sgom @16b ba zhes //🔽bya ba'i lam ni so so la //
analyzed: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob ba phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs // srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhing dag bla na med pa ni // rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste // 'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin // de yi rtags dang rnam 'phel dang // brtan dang sems kun gnas pa dang // mthong zhes bya dang sgom @16b ba zhes // bya ba'i lam ni so so la //
translated: the path of insight associated with the stage of added effort and the path of insight associated with the stage of thorough preparation.🔽The path of cultivation is of four kinds:

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //
translated: the path of cultivation of the factors that lead to penetration,🔽the path of cultivation of the training in higher morality,🔽the path of cultivation of the training in higher mind,🔽and the path of cultivation of the training in higher wisdom.🔽The path of no-more-learning is of four kinds:

original: gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
translated: the path of no-more-learning of the sravaka,🔽the path of no-more-learning of the pratyekabuddha,

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: and the path of no-more-learning of the Buddha.🔽The path of insight is of two kinds:🔽the path of insight of the sravaka and the path of insight of the pratyekabuddha.

original: log par sgrub dang bcas pa ni //
analyzed: log par sgrub dang bcas pa ni //
translated: The path of cultivation is of two kinds:

original: rtse mo'i mngon rtogs mthar gyis pa //
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon rtogs mthar gyis pa //
translated: the path of cultivation of the sravaka and the path of cultivation of the pratyekabuddha.🔽The path of no-more-learning is of two kinds:

original: rnam gsum rnam bcu skad cig ma //
analyzed: rnam gsum rnam bcu skad cig ma //
translated: the path of no-more-learning of the sravaka and the path of no-more-learning of the pratyekabuddha.🔽The path of insight is of two kinds:

original: gcig gis mngon rdzogs byang chub pa //
analyzed: gcig gis mngon rdzogs byang chub pa //
translated: the path of insight of the sravaka and the path of insight of the pratyekabuddha.🔽The path of cultivation is of two kinds:🔽the path of cultivation of the sravaka and the path of cultivation of the pratyekabuddha.🔽The path of no-more-learning is of two kinds:🔽the path of no-more-learning of the sravaka and the path of no-more-learning of the pratyekabuddha.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: By nature, it is fourfold.🔽The nature, the perfect enjoyment,

original: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs bcas dang // de bzhin gzhan pa sprul pa ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs bcas dang // de bzhin gzhan pa sprul pa ni //
translated: and likewise the emanation,

original: chos sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa //
analyzed: chos sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa //
translated: the Dharma body, and its activity,

original: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
translated: are rightly said to be fourfold.

original: ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the summary line.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa bco lngas mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa bco lngas mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the Perfection of Wisdom should be understood as summarized in these fifteen verses, which teach it in brief and in detail.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa ni //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa ni //
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: dngos po brgyad kyis yang dag bshad //
analyzed: dngos po brgyad kyis yang dag bshad //
translated: is rightly explained in eight topics.

original: ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba nas /
translated: Up to:

original: chos kyi sku dang de rnams brgyad //
analyzed: chos kyi sku dang de rnams brgyad //
translated: The Dharma body and those are the eight.

original: ces bya ba'i bar gyi tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis po 'di dag gis ni mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i bar gyi tshig le'ur byas pa gnyis po 'di dag gis ni mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: These two verses in summary

original: de la dngos po brgyad ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de la dngos po brgyad ni 'di yin no //
translated: are about the eight topics.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa dang / rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of all things, the realization of all aspects, the peak realization, the sequential realization,

original: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa dang / chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa dang / chos kyi sku'o //
translated: the realization in a single instant, and the dharmakāya.🔽The generation of bodhicitta, the instructions, the four aspects of the factors conducive to penetration,

original: sems bskyed pa dang / gdams ngag dang / nges 'byed yan lag rnam bzhi dang // zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang / gdams ngag dang / nges 'byed yan lag rnam bzhi dang // zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: and so on up to

original: chos sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa //
analyzed: chos sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa //
translated: The dharmakāya together with its activities.

original: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
translated: These are said to be the four aspects.

original: ces bya ba'i bar gyi tshig le'ur byas pa bcu gsum gyis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa don brgyad po de rnams kyi dngos po bsdus te bstan pas rgyas par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i bar gyi tshig le'ur byas pa bcu gsum gyis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa don brgyad po de rnams kyi dngos po bsdus te bstan pas rgyas par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The thirteen verses beginning with “The generation of bodhicitta, the instructions, the four aspects of the factors conducive to penetration” and so on up to “The dharmakāya together with its activities” explain in detail the eight topics such as the knowledge of all aspects by summarizing their topics.

original: de ltar na mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir legs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir legs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is a good explanation because it is concise and extensive.

original: don gyi lus rnam par bzhag pa brjod zin to //🔽'di phan chad ni don gang la khyad par can gyi rnam pa gang gi rab tu dbye ba'i chos gang dag bstan pa de @17a * //
analyzed: don gyi lus rnam par bzhag pa brjod zin to // 'di phan chad ni don gang la khyad par can gyi rnam pa gang gi rab tu dbye ba'i chos gang dag bstan pa de @17a * //
translated: The body of the meaning has been presented.

original: dag gi go rims bsdu ba 'ba' zhig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dag gi go rims bsdu ba 'ba' zhig brjod par bya'o //
translated: From here on, the order of the teachings will be stated only in terms of the meaning, the aspects, and the distinctions.

original: de la re zhig / sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
analyzed: de la re zhig / sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
translated: The generation of the mind is for the sake of others

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
translated: and the desire for perfect enlightenment.

original: 'on te 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na /
translated: But what is this desire?

original: 'di 'dod pa dang de 'dod pas //
analyzed: 'di 'dod pa dang de 'dod pas //
translated: It is the desire for that and the desire for this.

original: byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes mdo nas bshad pa gang dag yin pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes mdo nas bshad pa gang dag yin pa 'di yin no //
translated: The sutra explains that the bodhisattva should strive in the perfection of wisdom.🔽What is the characteristic of that?

original: 'di mtshan nyid ci yin zhes bya ba de nyid mi shes te don de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di mtshan nyid ci yin zhes bya ba de nyid mi shes te don de gang yin zhe na /
translated: One does not know that, so what is the meaning of that?

original: 'di ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa 'di nyid las don du gnyer pa yin no zhes gsungs te 'di ltar sems bskyed pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' ci nas bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
analyzed: 'di ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa 'di nyid las don du gnyer pa yin no zhes gsungs te 'di ltar sems bskyed pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' ci nas bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang
translated: This is the pursuit of the twenty-five thousand verse work.

original: rgya ba dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub par bya'o zhes de ltar don du gnyer bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgya ba dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub par bya'o zhes de ltar don du gnyer bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when generating the enlightenment mind, the bodhisattva pursues the goal of attaining manifest perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment and accomplishing the benefit of others.

original: 'o na ni de sems bskyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de sems bskyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if that is so, then the enlightenment mind would not be generated,

original: sems ni yul so sor rig pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
analyzed: sems ni yul so sor rig pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
translated: because the mind has the defining characteristic of being aware of individual objects,🔽and pursuit is craving.

original: don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni sred pa yin pas so zhe na de ni de ltar bden mod kyi 'on kyang dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i mtshan nyid don du gnyer ba yod na sangs rgyas nyid kyi don du sems skyed par byed pas na 'dir
analyzed: don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni sred pa yin pas so zhe na de ni de ltar bden mod kyi 'on kyang dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'i mtshan nyid don du gnyer ba yod na sangs rgyas nyid kyi don du sems skyed par byed pas na 'dir
translated: That is true, but if there is pursuit with the defining characteristic of aspiration for virtuous qualities, then the enlightenment mind is generated for the sake of buddhahood.

original: rgyu 'bras bus bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu 'bras bus bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the cause is indicated by the result.

original: de ltar na 'dun cing don du gnyer ba'i dge ba'i chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba rjes su mthun par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dun cing don du gnyer ba'i dge ba'i chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba rjes su mthun par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, all virtuous qualities that are desired and pursued increase in accordance with that.

original: yang na don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni smon lam yin no //
analyzed: yang na don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni smon lam yin no //
translated: Or, that which is called “pursued” is a prayer.

original: sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs ni don du gnyer ba gtsor gyur pa yin pas na de dag lhan cig spyod pa'i sems bskyed pa la don du gnyer ba bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs ni don du gnyer ba gtsor gyur pa yin pas na de dag lhan cig spyod pa'i sems bskyed pa la don du gnyer ba bstan pa yin te /
translated: The state of generating the mind is primarily the state of being pursued, so the teaching of being pursued is in the generation of the mind that accompanies those.

original: de lta na yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams smon lam dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'thad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams smon lam dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'thad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Even so, it is tenable to say that bodhisattvas generate the mind that is endowed with prayer.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang gzhan gyi don de yang gang yin zhe na /🔽de dang de ni mdo bzhin du //🔽bsdus dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas brjod //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang gzhan gyi don de yang gang yin zhe na / de dang de ni mdo bzhin du // bsdus dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas brjod //
translated: What is perfect complete enlightenment and what is the benefit of others?🔽That is summarized and expressed

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: in brief and in detail, according to the sūtras.

original: de dang zhes bya ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang de ni zhes bya ba gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang de ni zhes bya ba gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The phrase that enlightenment refers to the object of the bodhisattva's aspiration, and that benefit refers to the benefit of others.

original: @17b de la de'i bsdus te bstan pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: @17b de la de'i bsdus te bstan pa 'di yin te /
translated: The brief teaching on this is as follows:

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to all phenomena in all aspects should exert themselves in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la de'i rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la de'i rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The extensive teaching on this is as follows:

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, by not abiding, abides in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa dang / sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su btang ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su btang ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of generosity should be completed by the method of non-abandonment, because generosity, the object of generosity, and the recipient are not apprehended.

original: de la gzhan gyi don gyis bsdus te bstan pa ni 'di yin te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyogs bcu re re zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang zhig yod pa de dag thams cad phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi don gyis bsdus te bstan pa ni 'di yin te / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyogs bcu re re zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang zhig yod pa de dag thams cad phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya
translated: The teaching that is included in the benefit for others is as follows:

original: ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to lead all sentient beings existing in each of the worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in each of the ten directions to complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without remainder should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la de'i rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la de'i rgyas par bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The extensive teaching on that is as follows:

original: sems can ser sna can rnams ni sbyin pa la /
analyzed: sems can ser sna can rnams ni sbyin pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva who wishes to establish stingy sentient beings in generosity,

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams ni tshul khrims la rab tu dgod par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams ni tshul khrims la rab tu dgod par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: and those with faulty morality in morality, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang ched du bya ba dang bcas pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang ched du bya ba dang bcas pa brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having described the characteristics of generating the mind with reference to the object and purpose,🔽now, with reference to the twenty-two types of its classification,

original: da ni de'i rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: da ni de'i rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad pa ni /
translated: it is said:

original: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
analyzed: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
translated: Earth, gold, moon, fire,

original: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
analyzed: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
translated: treasure, jewel mine, ocean,🔽vajra, mountain, medicine, friend,

original: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
analyzed: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
translated: wish-fulfilling gem, sun, song,

original: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //🔽bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
analyzed: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che // bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
translated: king, treasury, highway,🔽vehicle, flowing river,

original: sgra bsnyen chu bo sprin rnams kyis //
analyzed: sgra bsnyen chu bo sprin rnams kyis //
translated: echo, river, cloud—

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: these are the twenty-two types.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: @18a * // de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa dang po 'dun pa dang ldan pa ni sa lta bu'o //
analyzed: @18a * // de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa dang po 'dun pa dang ldan pa ni sa lta bu'o //
translated: Among them, the first generation of the bodhisattvas' thought, which is endowed with aspiration, is like the earth.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Śāriputra, here, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully and completely awaken to all dharmas in all aspects should strive in the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang de'i tshogs bskyed pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang de'i tshogs bskyed pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wishing to fully and completely awaken to all dharmas in all aspects means wishing to generate all the qualities of a Buddha and the basis for producing their accumulations.

original: gnyis pa bsam pa dang ldan pa ni gser bzang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa bsam pa dang ldan pa ni gser bzang po lta bu'o //
translated: The second, which is endowed with intention, is like excellent gold.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gnas pa med pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gnas pa med pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Śāriputra, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas, abiding in the perfection of wisdom by way of non-abiding,

original: sbyin pa dang gtong ba dang yongs su len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang gtong ba dang yongs su len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: because of not apprehending giving, receiver, and recipient,

original: yongs su btang ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yongs su btang ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: should complete the perfection of generosity by way of not giving anything away, and so on up to

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa ste /
translated: should complete the perfection of wisdom because of not apprehending any phenomena.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdu ba'i phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du gnas pas na bsam pa yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa dang 'di la rnam par 'gyur ba mi bsten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdu ba'i phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du gnas pas na bsam pa yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa dang 'di la rnam par 'gyur ba mi bsten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intention of benefit and happiness that is included in the six perfections is an intention because it abides until the attainment of complete enlightenment, and it is not based on any change in the future or in this life.

original: gsum pa lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni yar ngo'i zla ba tshes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni yar ngo'i zla ba tshes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The third, endowed with superior intention, is like the waxing moon.

original: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He, abiding in the perfection of wisdom, should cultivate the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, up to🔽he should cultivate the nine perceptions of impurity, up to🔽he should cultivate the eight thoughts of a great man, up to

original: mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dgu bsgom par bya ba'i bar dang / skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad bsgom par bya ba'i par dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dgu bsgom par bya ba'i bar dang / skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad bsgom par bya ba'i par dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa ste /
translated: he should cultivate the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur bar bsam pa lhag pa yin pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur bar bsam pa lhag pa yin pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: It is called superior intention because it is the intention for the increase of all wholesome dharmas.

original: bzhi pa sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni me lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni me lta bu'o //
translated: The fourth, endowed with application, is like fire.

original: @18b thams cad shes pa nyid la shes pa dang mthong bas bltas nas 'da' bar 'dod pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'dod pa dang / lam shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: @18b thams cad shes pa nyid la shes pa dang mthong bas bltas nas 'da' bar 'dod pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'dod pa dang / lam shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The great bodhisattva who wishes to see and look with knowledge and vision at the knowledge of all aspects, who wishes to stand on the irreversible stage, who wishes to perfect the knowledge of the path, and who wishes to attain the knowledge of all aspects should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sbyor ba ni mchog tu gyur pa'i sbyor ba rab tu sbyor ba yin pas na bud shing gi khyad par gyis me bzhin du gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sbyor ba ni mchog tu gyur pa'i sbyor ba rab tu sbyor ba yin pas na bud shing gi khyad par gyis me bzhin du gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The application to the three knowledges is the application to the supreme application, because it goes higher and higher, like fire by the difference in fuel.

original: lnga pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni gter chen po lta bu'o //
analyzed: lnga pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni gter chen po lta bu'o //
translated: The fifth, endowed with the perfection of generosity, is like a great treasure.

original: sems can ser sna can rnams sbyin pa la 'jog par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sbyin pa rnams sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can ser sna can rnams sbyin pa la 'jog par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sbyin pa rnams sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The great bodhisattva who wishes to establish stingy sentient beings in generosity, and who wishes to overpower with a single thought of enlightenment the generosity of the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: zang zing gi longs spyod kyis sems can tshad med pa tshim par byed kyang yongs su gtugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zang zing gi longs spyod kyis sems can tshad med pa tshim par byed kyang yongs su gtugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, although he satisfies immeasurable sentient beings with material enjoyments, they are inexhaustible.

original: drug pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: drug pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rin po che'i 'byung gnas lta bu'o //
translated: The sixth, endowed with the perfection of morality, is like a mine of jewels.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams tshul khrims la 'jog par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims rnams rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams tshul khrims la 'jog par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims rnams rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The great bodhisattva who wishes to establish those with faulty morality in morality, and who wishes to surpass with a single thought of the generation of the spirit of enlightenment endowed with rejoicing the morality of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: yon tan rin po che mtha' yas pa thams cad ni de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rin po che mtha' yas pa thams cad ni de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all infinite jewels of virtues come from that.

original: bdun pa bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rgya mtsho chen po lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdun pa bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rgya mtsho chen po lta bu'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is like a great ocean.

original: gnod sems dang ldan pa rnams bzod pa la 'jog par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs @19a * //
analyzed: gnod sems dang ldan pa rnams bzod pa la 'jog par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs @19a * //
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva who wishes to establish those who are malicious in patience, and who wishes to surpass with a single generation of the thought of enlightenment accompanied by rejoicing the patience of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa ste / mi 'dod pa thog tu babs pa thams cad kyis 'khrug par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ste / mi 'dod pa thog tu babs pa thams cad kyis 'khrug par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all misfortunes that befall him are unable to disturb him.

original: brgyad pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rdo rje lta bu'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rdo rje lta bu'o //
translated: The eighth vajra-like is endowed with the perfection of vigor.

original: le lo can dag brtson 'grus la 'jog par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: le lo can dag brtson 'grus la 'jog par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva who wishes to surpass the single generation of the thought of enlightenment of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who wishes to establish the lazy in effort, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni yid brtan pas mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yid brtan pas mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unshakable by faith.

original: dgu pa bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni ri'i rgyal po lta bu'o //
analyzed: dgu pa bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni ri'i rgyal po lta bu'o //
translated: The ninth, endowed with the perfection of meditative absorption, is like the king of mountains.

original: sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams bsam gtan la 'jog bar 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams bsam gtan la 'jog bar 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva who wishes to establish those with distracted minds in meditative concentration, and who wishes to surpass with a single thought of sympathetic joy the meditative concentration of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni dmigs pa'i rnam par g-yeng bas mi bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa'i rnam par g-yeng bas mi bskyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that [thought of sympathetic joy] is unshakable by distraction concerning objects.

original: bcu pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni sman lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcu pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni sman lta bu'o //
translated: The tenth, endowed with the perfection of wisdom, is like medicine.

original: sems can shes rab 'chal pa rnams shes rab la rab tu 'jog par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi shes rab rnams rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can shes rab 'chal pa rnams shes rab la rab tu 'jog par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi shes rab rnams rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig gi zil gyis mnan par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahasattva who wishes to establish beings of faulty wisdom in wisdom, and who wishes to surpass the wisdom of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas with a single thought of generation of the resolve accompanied by rejoicing, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it completely pacifies all the sicknesses of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: bcu gcig pa thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bu'o //
translated: The perfection of skill in means is like a spiritual friend.

original: dge ba'i sems bskyed pa gcig tsam yang thams cad mkhyen par yongs su bsngos pas mi zad par byed par 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir dmyal ba dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal bzod par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems bskyed pa gcig tsam yang thams cad mkhyen par yongs su bsngos pas mi zad par byed par 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir dmyal ba dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal bzod par 'dod pa dang /
translated: He wishes to make even a single virtuous thought inexhaustible by dedicating it to omniscience, and he wishes to endure the sufferings of the hells, animal wombs, and the world of Yama for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: bskal @19b pa brgya stong du yang dag par bsags pa'i tshul khrims kyang sems can la ltos nas 'dor bar 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs su skye bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bskal @19b pa brgya stong du yang dag par bsags pa'i tshul khrims kyang sems can la ltos nas 'dor bar 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs su skye bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: He wishes to give up his morality, which he has accumulated for a hundred thousand eons, in consideration of sentient beings, and he wishes to be born in the lineage of the Buddha.

original: de ni gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he never abandons the welfare of sentient beings in any situation.

original: 'dir kha cig na re bden pa dang gtong ba dang shes rab nye bar zhi ba la brten pa rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dir kha cig na re bden pa dang gtong ba dang shes rab nye bar zhi ba la brten pa rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Here, some say that the lineage of the Buddha is based on truth, generosity, wisdom, and tranquility.

original: gzhan dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pas la 'jug pa'i sems yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pas la 'jug pa'i sems yin te /
translated: Others say that the first is the mind of entry into the lineage, because it is included in the path of insight.🔽Thus, a sutra declares:

original: 'di ltar mdo las gang gi tshe sems bskyed pa dang lhan cig skyes pa na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs su 'gyur ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yin no zhes gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las gang gi tshe sems bskyed pa dang lhan cig skyes pa na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs su 'gyur ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yin no zhes gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: When the mind is generated, it is simultaneously born in the lineage of the bodhisattva, which is the lineage of the Tathagata.

original: gzhan dag ni da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad mngon du phyogs par gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang snying rje chen po gnyis ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad mngon du phyogs par gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang snying rje chen po gnyis ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others believe that the lineage of the buddhas consists of the meditative concentration and great compassion of all the buddhas who are present in the world.

original: la la dag ni sangs rgyas kyis bcas pa'i bslab pa la bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: la la dag ni sangs rgyas kyis bcas pa'i bslab pa la bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Others believe that it consists of the training prescribed by the Buddha.

original: kha cig ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others believe that it consists of the six perfections.

original: gzhan ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yum ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yum ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: Others believe that the mother of the bodhisattvas is the perfection of wisdom,

original: yab ni thabs mkhas pa yin pas /
analyzed: yab ni thabs mkhas pa yin pas /
translated: and the father is skillful means.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: These are the Buddha-gotra.

original: bcu gnyis pa smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu'o //
translated: The perfection of vows is like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su sgrub par 'dod pa dang / phyogs bcu re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par chos ston pas go bar byed par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su sgrub par 'dod pa dang / phyogs bcu re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par chos ston pas go bar byed par 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to accomplish the Buddha-body, who wishes to be understood by teaching the Dharma in each of the ten directions in infinite world-realms, and who wishes for the continuity of the Buddha-family,

original: de ni ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he accomplishes the results just as he wishes.

original: bcu gsum pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni nyi ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni nyi ma lta bu'o //
translated: The perfection of power is like the sun.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva who wishes to fulfill the aspirations of all beings,

original: @20a * // de ni gdul bya'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @20a * // de ni gdul bya'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it brings sentient beings to full maturity.

original: bcu bzhi pa ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa sgra dbyangs snyan pa lta bu'o //🔽stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rdul phra rab kyi tshad shes par 'dod pa dang ; de bzhin du sbyin pa 'di ltar byin pa ni 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ba dang / sbyin pa 'di ltar byin pas ni rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu la sogs par skye ba nas /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa sgra dbyangs snyan pa lta bu'o // stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rdul phra rab kyi tshad shes par 'dod pa dang ; de bzhin du sbyin pa 'di ltar byin pa ni 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ba dang / sbyin pa 'di ltar byin pas ni rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu la sogs par skye ba nas /
translated: The fourteenth is the perfection of wisdom, which is like a melodious sound.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa 'di ltar byin na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes shes par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa 'di ltar byin na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes shes par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The great bodhisattva who wishes to know the number of atoms in the four great elements of the great trichiliocosm, and likewise who wishes to know that such and such a gift will have great results, that by giving such and such a gift one will be born in the great sāla tree-like royal class, and so on, up to who wishes to know that by giving such and such a gift in this way without apprehending anything, one will complete the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni gdul bya 'dun par byed pa'i ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gdul bya 'dun par byed pa'i ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the teacher of those to be trained, because it causes them to be inclined.

original: de la s'a la chen po zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtshon par bya ba'i dbang phyug dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la s'a la chen po zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtshon par bya ba'i dbang phyug dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the great sāla tree is the lord of what is to be manifested.

original: bco lnga pa mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni rgyal po lta bu'o //
analyzed: bco lnga pa mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni rgyal po lta bu'o //
translated: The fifteenth, endowed with the superknowledges, is like a king.

original: sems bskyed pa gcig gis phyogs bcu re rer 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa las yang dag par 'da' bar 'dod pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi chu'i phung po chen po de thams cad lan brgyar skra'i rtse mos thams cad gtor bar 'dod cing yang de na gnas pa'i srog chags rnams la mi gnod par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gcig gis phyogs bcu re rer 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa las yang dag par 'da' bar 'dod pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi chu'i phung po chen po de thams cad lan brgyar skra'i rtse mos thams cad gtor bar 'dod cing yang de na gnas pa'i srog chags rnams la mi gnod par 'dod pa dang /
translated: One who wishes to pass beyond the infinite world systems in each of the ten directions with a single thought of enlightenment, and who wishes to sprinkle with the tip of a hair the entire great mass of water of the trichiliocosm a hundred times, without harming the living beings there.

original: bskal pa sreg pa'i me la kha'i dbugs gcig gis zhi bar bya bar 'dod pa dang / rnam par 'thor ba chen po'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor sor mo gcig gi rtse mos yongs su khebs par bya bar 'dod pa dang / nam mkha'i khams ji tsam pa de thams cad skyi la mo krung gcig gis rgyas par yang dag par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: bskal pa sreg pa'i me la kha'i dbugs gcig gis zhi bar bya bar 'dod pa dang / rnam par 'thor ba chen po'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor sor mo gcig gi rtse mos yongs su khebs par bya bar 'dod pa dang / nam mkha'i khams ji tsam pa de thams cad skyi la mo krung gcig gis rgyas par yang dag par 'dod pa dang /
translated: It is to wish to stretch out one’s legs in space as far as the realm of space extends.

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab la sogs pa'i ri rnams skra nyag ma gcig gis sbams te gyen du bteg nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med par 'phang bar 'dod pa dang / phyogs bcu re re'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lha'i mig gis lta bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab la sogs pa'i ri rnams skra nyag ma gcig gis sbams te gyen du bteg nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med par 'phang bar 'dod pa dang / phyogs bcu re re'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das lha'i mig gis lta bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: It is to wish to carry the king of mountains, Mount Sumeru, and so forth, on a single hair, to raise it up, and to throw it into an innumerable world system. It is to wish to see with the divine eye the blessed buddhas in all the buddha realms in each of the ten directions.

original: de rnams las kyang chos bstan pa @20b lha'i rna bas mnyan par 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa shes par 'dod pa dang / de rnams kyi 'ang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'dod pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pa sgrub par 'dod cing yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du me byed par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams las kyang chos bstan pa @20b lha'i rna bas mnyan par 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa shes par 'dod pa dang / de rnams kyi 'ang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'dod pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pa sgrub par 'dod cing yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du me byed par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Among those, the bodhisattva who wishes to hear the Dharma with the divine ear, who wishes to know the mental activity of all sentient beings, who wishes to recollect their former lives, and who wishes to accomplish the supernormal knowledge of the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements, but does not wish to actualize the limit of reality.

original: de ni mthu thogs pa med par gzhan gyi don sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mthu thogs pa med par gzhan gyi don sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the accomplishment of the welfare of others without obstruction.

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab la sogs pa skra nyag ma gcig gis bcings te 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par 'phen pa la ni ma dad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab la sogs pa skra nyag ma gcig gis bcings te 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par 'phen pa la ni ma dad par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not be faithless in binding Mount Meru, the king of mountains, and so on, with a single strand of hair and throwing it to infinite world systems.

original: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi dbang 'byor pa ston pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi dbang 'byor pa ston pa 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this teaching of the mastery of the contemplatives is an inconceivable phenomenon.

original: bcu drug pa bsod nams dang ye shes dang ldan pa ni bang mdzod lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcu drug pa bsod nams dang ye shes dang ldan pa ni bang mdzod lta bu'o //
translated: The sixteenth, endowed with merit and intuition, is like a treasury.

original: sangs rgyas tshad med pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag thams cad bsod snyoms gcig gis khyed par bya bar 'dod pa dang / bden pa mthong ba rnams rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas tshad med pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag thams cad bsod snyoms gcig gis khyed par bya bar 'dod pa dang / bden pa mthong ba rnams rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas /
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to honor with a single act of charity all the buddhas who exist in the ten directions together with their disciples, and who wishes to establish all the disciples in the result of a Stream-enterer, etc.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la 'jog par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la 'jog par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen pos zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: up to the unsurpassed, complete enlightenment, should generate the will for enlightenment.

original: de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i bang mdzod lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i bang mdzod lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is like a treasury of the great accumulation of merit and intuition.

original: bcu bdun pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dang ldan pa ni lam po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcu bdun pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dang ldan pa ni lam po che lta bu'o //
translated: The seventeenth, endowed with the factors of enlightenment, is like a highway.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad rjes su 'thob par 'dod pa dang / chos 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad rjes su 'thob par 'dod pa dang / chos 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to attain all the qualities of the Buddhas, whether past, future, or present, and who wishes to perfect all conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: de ni 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the vehicle of all the noble persons, and they have gone by it and will go by it.

original: bco brgyad pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni bzhon pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bco brgyad pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni bzhon pa lta bu'o //
translated: 18. Endowed with calm and insight, it is like a vehicle.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bar 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad @21a * //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bar 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad @21a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to go in the van of all the disciples and individual Buddhas, and of all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: kyi nang gi 'khor du 'gyur bar 'dong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor 'thob par 'dod pa dang / yon tan rnam par sbyar bar 'dod pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bya ba dang /
analyzed: kyi nang gi 'khor du 'gyur bar 'dong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor 'thob par 'dod pa dang / yon tan rnam par sbyar bar 'dod pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bya ba dang /
translated: and to become a member of the inner retinue, and to obtain the retinue of great bodhisattvas, and to purify the qualities, and to establish beings in the bases of meritorious action that consist of giving, morality, and meditation,

original: bkur sti dang rdzas las byung ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la sems can rnams dgod par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bkur sti dang rdzas las byung ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la sems can rnams dgod par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: and in the bases of meritorious action that consist of worship and material things, the bodhisattva should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni zung du 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang du 'ang mi ltung bas bde blag tu khyer bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni zung du 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang du 'ang mi ltung bas bde blag tu khyer bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the union, because it easily carries one to the state of non-falling into either cyclic life or the frozenness of nirvana.

original: de la nang gi 'khor zhes bya ba ni gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsang bar 'jug pa'i ye shes phra bar 'jug pa'i ye shes la rjes su zhugs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi 'khor zhes bya ba ni gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsang bar 'jug pa'i ye shes phra bar 'jug pa'i ye shes la rjes su zhugs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Therein, the inner retinue is that which enters into the subtle wisdom of the Lord Buddha's secret and becomes engaged in the wisdom of subtle penetration.

original: bcu dgu pa gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa ni bkod ma'i chu lta bu'o //🔽phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs pa dang gsung bar 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /🔽mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang lung bstan pa nas /
analyzed: bcu dgu pa gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa ni bkod ma'i chu lta bu'o // phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs pa dang gsung bar 'gyur ba 'di lta ste / mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang lung bstan pa nas /
