translated: The nineteenth is endowed with retention and eloquence, like a spring.🔽The bodhisattva who wishes to hear, to retain, to fully understand, to practice,🔽and to teach extensively to others whatever has been taught, is being taught, and will be taught by the Bhagavat Buddhas of the ten directions,

original: shin tu rgyas pa dang rmad du byung ba'i bar gang cung zad bstan pa de thams cad thos par 'dod pa dang / gzung bar 'dod pa dang / yongs su chub par bya bar 'dod pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa dang rmad du byung ba'i bar gang cung zad bstan pa de thams cad thos par 'dod pa dang / gzung bar 'dod pa dang / yongs su chub par bya bar 'dod pa dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub par 'dod pa dang /
translated: that is, the Sutras, the Ge›yas, the Vyakarana, and so on up to the Vyakaraṇas, the Udanas, and the Adbhutadharmas,

original: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher ston par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher ston par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is called a bodhisattva.

original: de ni chu 'dzin pa dang mi zad par 'byin pa dang chos mthun par thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos 'dzin pa dang / bstan pa mthar thug pa med pa 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni chu 'dzin pa dang mi zad par 'byin pa dang chos mthun par thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos 'dzin pa dang / bstan pa mthar thug pa med pa 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is like a spring, retaining what he has heard and giving it out inexhaustibly, retaining the teachings he has heard and giving them out without limit.

original: nyi shu pa chos kyi dga' ston dang ldan pa ni sgra snyan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyi shu pa chos kyi dga' ston dang ldan pa ni sgra snyan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The twentieth is endowed with the feast of Dharma, which is like a pleasant sound.

original: phyogs bcu re re zhing 'jig rten gyi bar yun ring por mun pa mun nag tu gyur pa lus kyi 'od kyis snang bar byas nas der skyes pa'i sems can la sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra thos par bya bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu re re zhing 'jig rten gyi bar yun ring por mun pa mun nag tu gyur pa lus kyi 'od kyis snang bar byas nas der skyes pa'i sems can la sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra thos par bya bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to illuminate with the light of his body the long night of darkness in the intervals between worlds in each of the ten directions and to cause the beings born there to hear the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma and the sound of the Saṅgha

original: de dag yang dag pa'i lta ba la dgod par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag yang dag pa'i lta ba la dgod par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: and who wishes to establish them in the correct view.

original: @21b des ni thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la snyan pa sgrogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @21b des ni thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la snyan pa sgrogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he proclaims what is pleasant to disciples who wish for liberation.

original: chos kyi dga' ston yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ston yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The feast of Dharma is also of four kinds.

original: 'du byed thams mi rtag par so sor rtog pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad sdug bsngal bar so sor rtog pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med par so sor rtog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi bar so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams mi rtag par so sor rtog pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad sdug bsngal bar so sor rtog pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med par so sor rtog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi bar so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The discernment of all conditioned things as impermanent, the discernment of all defiled things as painful, the discernment of all things as empty and insubstantial, and the discernment of nirvana as tranquil.

original: nyi shu gcig pa bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa ni chu bo'i rgyun lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyi shu gcig pa bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa ni chu bo'i rgyun lta bu'o //
translated: The path of the single procedure is like the flow of a river.

original: phyogs bcu re re mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi sems can long ba dang / 'on pa dang / smyon pa dang / gcer bu dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa dang / ngan song du ltung ba rnams sdug bsngal de dang de las thar bar byas te mi'i lus 'thob bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu re re mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi sems can long ba dang / 'on pa dang / smyon pa dang / gcer bu dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa dang / ngan song du ltung ba rnams sdug bsngal de dang de las thar bar byas te mi'i lus 'thob bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with this path, by the power of his vow, delivers from their sufferings all the blind, deaf, insane, naked, hungry, thirsty, and so on, of the infinite world-realms in each of the ten directions, and causes them to obtain a human body.

original: de rnams kyang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po la dgod par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po la dgod par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to establish them in the aggregates of morality, meditative stabilization, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: de ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / bgrod pa gcig pa nyid ni sa der gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan gyi don gyi bya ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / bgrod pa gcig pa nyid ni sa der gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan gyi don gyi bya ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the stage of the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, it is the stage of the single path, because it is entered naturally, and because the bodhisattvas who belong to that stage do not differ in their activities for the sake of others.

original: nyi shu gnyis pa chos kyi sku dang ldan pa ni sprin lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyi shu gnyis pa chos kyi sku dang ldan pa ni sprin lta bu'o //
translated: The twenty-second is like a cloud, endowed with the Dharma body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam bstan par 'dod pa dang / glang po che'i lta stangs kyis lta bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes rgya cher yang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam bstan par 'dod pa dang / glang po che'i lta stangs kyis lta bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes rgya cher yang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes to display the conduct of the Tathagata and who wishes to look with the gaze of an elephant.

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa kun du ston pas sems can gyi don bya ba rnam pa thams cad de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa kun du ston pas sems can gyi don bya ba rnam pa thams cad de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the benefits for sentient beings depend on that, since it is the cause of the first generation of the mind of enlightenment.🔽The third generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the ten stages.🔽The fourth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the tathāgatas.🔽The fifth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the bodhisattvas.

original: sems bskyed pa gsum par mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dgu bsgom par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de ni rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par gang pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes dang /🔽rnam @22a * //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gsum par mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes dgu bsgom par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de ni rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par gang pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes dang / rnam @22a * //
translated: The sixth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the ten faiths.🔽The seventh generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the ten abodes.🔽The eighth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the ten practices.🔽The ninth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the ten dedications.

original: par bsngos pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes dang / rus pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: par bsngos pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par zos pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par 'thor ba'i 'du shes dang / rus pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The tenth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the ten grounds.

original: de la 'tsho ba mthar thun pa'i 'og tu go rims bzhin du sbud pa rlung gis khengs pa ltar mtho bar skrangs shing rbobs  par gyur pa'i phyir rnam par bam pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'tsho ba mthar thun pa'i 'og tu go rims bzhin du sbud pa rlung gis khengs pa ltar mtho bar skrangs shing rbobs  par gyur pa'i phyir rnam par bam pa'o //
translated: The eleventh generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the vajra-like concentration.🔽The twelfth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the Dharma cloud.🔽The thirteenth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the cloud of Dharma.🔽The fourteenth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the tathāgatas.🔽The fifteenth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the bodhisattvas.🔽The sixteenth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the ten faiths.🔽The seventeenth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the ten abodes.🔽The eighteenth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the ten practices.🔽The nineteenth generation of the mind of enlightenment is the generation of the mind of enlightenment in the stage of the ten dedications.

original: rnam par bam pa nyid ni rnam par bam pa pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bam pa nyid ni rnam par bam pa pa'o //
translated: “Very rotten” means very rotten.

original: yang na mi mthun pa'i phyir btsog cing rnam par bam bas na a'a by'a bhy'a ta ka zhes bye brag rtog byed du byung dhma ta k'a te rnam par bam pa pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mi mthun pa'i phyir btsog cing rnam par bam bas na a'a by'a bhy'a ta ka zhes bye brag rtog byed du byung dhma ta k'a te rnam par bam pa pa'o //
translated: Or else, because of the impurity, it is “very rotten” (avabhāṣita) and “very rotten” (avabhāṣataka) because of the impurity.

original: 'di ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can ro'i lus kyi tshig bla dgas yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin can ro'i lus kyi tshig bla dgas yin no //
translated: This is the designation of the body of the nature of food.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du yang bshad pa ni ming la stsogs pa'i don dag la brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du yang bshad pa ni ming la stsogs pa'i don dag la brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, the others should be explained in terms of the meanings of name, etc.

original: de ni dbyibs la chags pa rnams la lus de'i dbyibs kyi rgyud pa ston pa'i phyir 'di bsgom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni dbyibs la chags pa rnams la lus de'i dbyibs kyi rgyud pa ston pa'i phyir 'di bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is to be cultivated in order to show the continuity of the body’s shape to those attached to shape.

original: 'bu rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis nang du bskyod pas na bi dhu bi ba tu ma ka ta k'a zhes bya ba rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa pa ste /
analyzed: 'bu rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis nang du bskyod pas na bi dhu bi ba tu ma ka ta k'a zhes bya ba rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa pa ste /
translated: Because of being shaken by various worms inside, it is called “very worm-infested” (vidhūtavitatamakaṭaka).

original: de ni lus kyi mkhregs pa'i dngos po la chags pa la khong stong gi dngos po nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi mkhregs pa'i dngos po la chags pa la khong stong gi dngos po nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is taught in order to show the hollow nature of the body to those who are attached to the solidity of the body.

original: gnas tha dad pa nas rnag 'dzag pa ni rnam par gang pa pa ste /
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa nas rnag 'dzag pa ni rnam par gang pa pa ste /
translated: The oozing pus is the bloated.

original: de ni phreng ba dang dri la sogs pa'i dbang las byung ba'i lus kyi dri la chags pa rnams la lus kyi rma dang 'brel pa'i dri nga ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phreng ba dang dri la sogs pa'i dbang las byung ba'i lus kyi dri la chags pa rnams la lus kyi rma dang 'brel pa'i dri nga ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is taught in order to show the foul smell associated with the wounds of the body to those who are attached to the smell of the body that arises from the power of garlands, scents, and so on.

original: 'di dang de nas khrag 'gred cing rnam par 'phro la rab tu 'dzag pas na rnam par dmar ba pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dang de nas khrag 'gred cing rnam par 'phro la rab tu 'dzag pas na rnam par dmar ba pa ste /
translated: The blood flowing, spreading, and trickling from it is the livid.

original: de ni rgyan gyis byas pa'i mdzes pa la chags pa la khrag gis sbags pa'i mi mthun pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyan gyis byas pa'i mdzes pa la chags pa la khrag gis sbags pa'i mi mthun pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: That is taught in order to show the repulsiveness of the body smeared with blood to those who are attached to the beauty created by ornaments.

original: rnam par gsal bar sdo bas na rnam par bsngos pa pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par gsal bar sdo bas na rnam par bsngos pa pa ste /
translated: The putrefying and festering is the festering.

original: de ni lus kyi kha dog la chags pa la pags pa'i 'dod chags kyi rgud pa bstan pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi kha dog la chags pa la pags pa'i 'dod chags kyi rgud pa bstan pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: That is taught in order to show the decay of attachment to the skin to those who are attached to the color of the body.

original: khyi dang ce spyang la sogs pas phan tshun du rnam pa sna tshogs par zos pa ni rnam par zos pa pa ste /
analyzed: khyi dang ce spyang la sogs pas phan tshun du rnam pa sna tshogs par zos pa ni rnam par zos pa pa ste /
translated: The scattered is that which is scattered in various ways by dogs, jackals, etc.🔽This is taught in order to show the scattered flesh to one who is attached to the fullness of flesh, such as the breasts.

original: de ni nu ma la sogs pa'i sha rgyas pa la chags ba la sha rgyas pa rnam par bstan pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de ni nu ma la sogs pa'i sha rgyas pa la chags ba la sha rgyas pa rnam par bstan pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: The scattered in parts is that which is scattered in various ways in different places,

original: lag pa gnyis @22b kyang gzhan du /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis @22b kyang gzhan du /
translated: such as the two hands, the two feet, the head, etc.🔽This is taught in order to show the scattered limbs and extremities to one who is attached to the beauty of limbs and extremities.

original: rkang pa gnyis kyang gzhan du /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyang gzhan du /
translated: The scattered in pieces is that which is scattered in various ways in pieces,

original: mgo po yang gzhan du /
analyzed: mgo po yang gzhan du /
translated: such as the bones of the hands, feet, head, etc.🔽This is taught in order to show the inauspiciousness of the body to one who is attached to the beauty of the body.

original: sna tshogs par 'thor bas na rnam par 'thor pa pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs par 'thor bas na rnam par 'thor pa pa ste /
translated: The scattered in fragments is that which is scattered in various ways in fragments,🔽such as the marrow, the sinews, the nails, the teeth, etc.🔽This is taught in order to show the inauspiciousness of the body to one who is attached to the beauty of the body.🔽The scattered in dust is that which is scattered in various ways in dust,🔽such as the bones of the hands, feet, head, etc.

original: de ni yan lag dang nying lag gi sgeg pa la chags pa la yan lag dang nying lag rnam par 'thor bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yan lag dang nying lag gi sgeg pa la chags pa la yan lag dang nying lag rnam par 'thor bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught in order to show the inauspiciousness of the body to one who is attached to the beauty of the body.

original: rus pa nyid ni rus pa pa ste /🔽'di ni rus pa sbrel ma dang rus pa gcig gi'ang tshig bla dags te /
analyzed: rus pa nyid ni rus pa pa ste / 'di ni rus pa sbrel ma dang rus pa gcig gi'ang tshig bla dags te /
translated: The scattered in bones is that which is scattered in various ways in bones,🔽such as the bones of the hands, feet, head, etc.

original: de ni so la sogs pa'i rus pa'i 'byor pa la chags pa la lus kyi rus pa'i mi mthun pa'i dngos po ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni so la sogs pa'i rus pa'i 'byor pa la chags pa la lus kyi rus pa'i mi mthun pa'i dngos po ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught in order to show the inauspiciousness of the body to one who is attached to the beauty of the body.

original: rnam par zhu zhing tshig par rnam par tshig pa pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par zhu zhing tshig par rnam par tshig pa pa ste /
translated: The second is the burning of the body, which is the burning of the body by fire.🔽The third is the burning of the body by the fire of desire, which is the burning of the body by the fire of passion.🔽The fourth is the burning of the body by the fire of hatred.

original: de ni kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa la pags pa dang dbyibs kun du 'khums pa ston pa yin pa'i phyir 'di bsgom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni kha dog dang dbyibs la chags pa la pags pa dang dbyibs kun du 'khums pa ston pa yin pa'i phyir 'di bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: The fifth is the burning of the body by the fire of delusion.🔽The sixth is the burning of the body by the fire of pride.🔽The seventh is the burning of the body by the fire of jealousy.🔽The eighth is the burning of the body by the fire of avarice.🔽These are the eight burnings of the body.

original: skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: One should cultivate the eight thoughts of a great man.

original: chos 'di ni 'dod pa chung ba rnams kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: chos 'di ni 'dod pa chung ba rnams kyi yin gyi /
translated: This Dharma is for those with few desires,

original: 'dod pa che ba rnams ma yin pa dang / chog shes pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa che ba rnams ma yin pa dang / chog shes pa dang / rab tu dben pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
translated: not for those with great desires; for those who are content, secluded, and energetic; for those who have established mindfulness, are concentrated, and possess wisdom;

original: shes rab 'chal pa rnams kyi ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa rnams kyi ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: not for those with faulty wisdom.

original: skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa bdun po 'di dag gis gnas brtan mood gal gyi bu chen po gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa bdun po 'di dag gis gnas brtan mood gal gyi bu chen po gnas par gyur to //
translated: The elder Maha­Maudgalyayana abided by these seven thoughts of a great man.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mood gal gyi bu chen po khyod bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad po 'di dag la yang rnam par rtogs shig / chos 'di ni spros pa med pa spros pa med pa la kun dga' ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mood gal gyi bu chen po khyod bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad po 'di dag la yang rnam par rtogs shig / chos 'di ni spros pa med pa spros pa med pa la kun dga' ba /
translated: This Dharma is free of elaboration, free of elaboration, delighting in the absence of elaboration,

original: spros pa med pa la kun dga' ba'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: spros pa med pa la kun dga' ba'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: delighting in the absence of elaboration, and diligently applied to the absence of elaboration.”

original: de la 'dod pa chung bas chos bzhi spong ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa chung bas chos bzhi spong ste /
translated: Among those, one who has few desires abandons four things:

original: 'di ltar tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong dang / thob kyis 'jal ba'o //
translated: hypocrisy, flattery, hinting, and oppressing others for gain.🔽Here, some, seeking gain, honor, and fame, with a mind full of concern and attachment,

original: de la tshul 'chos zhes bya ba 'di na kha cig rnyed pa don du gnyer zhing snyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa 'dod pa sems ltos pa dang bcas pa dang 'brel pas dgon pa pa'am /
analyzed: de la tshul 'chos zhes bya ba 'di na kha cig rnyed pa don du gnyer zhing snyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa 'dod pa sems ltos pa dang bcas pa dang 'brel pas dgon pa pa'am /
translated: in order to be known as having few desires, go to the wilderness,

original: phyag dar khrod pa'am stan gcig pa nas sbyangs pa'i yon tan @23a * //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa'am stan gcig pa nas sbyangs pa'i yon tan @23a * //
translated: to a charnel ground, or to a solitary place, and practice the ascetic austerities.

original: gzhan gang yang rung ba la nye bar bsten te gnas par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gzhan gang yang rung ba la nye bar bsten te gnas par gyur pa na /
translated: When he is dependent on and abiding with someone else,

original: de 'di snyam du bdag la gzhan dag gis bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag la gzhan dag gis bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: he thinks, “Wouldn’t it be good if others served me,

original: bla mar byed /
analyzed: bla mar byed /
translated: honored me,

original: mchod par byed /
analyzed: mchod par byed /
translated: worshipped me,🔽and revered me?”

original: rjed par byed na ci ma rung bdag gis kyang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa grub par bya na ci ma rung snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: rjed par byed na ci ma rung bdag gis kyang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa grub par bya na ci ma rung snyam du sems shing /
translated: “Wouldn’t it be good if I were to obtain gain, honor, and fame?”

original: de rnyed pa dang bkur sti don du gnyer zhing rnyed pa la sogs pa 'dod pa de tshul de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi spyod lam byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul 'chos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnyed pa dang bkur sti don du gnyer zhing rnyed pa la sogs pa 'dod pa de tshul de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi spyod lam byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul 'chos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conduct that is the nature of that desire for gain and honor is called “dissimulation.”

original: kha gsag ces bya ba ni 'di na kha cig rnyed pa dang bkur sti la ltos pa dang bcas pas gzhan dag la 'di skad du khyod ni bdag gi ma ji lta ba de 'dra ba dang / pha ji lta ba dang / spun zla ji lta ba dang /
analyzed: kha gsag ces bya ba ni 'di na kha cig rnyed pa dang bkur sti la ltos pa dang bcas pas gzhan dag la 'di skad du khyod ni bdag gi ma ji lta ba de 'dra ba dang / pha ji lta ba dang / spun zla ji lta ba dang /
translated: “Flattery” is when someone, with an eye to gain and honor, says to others, “You are like a mother to me,” “You are like a father to me,” “You are like a brother to me,” “You are like a

original: nye du gang yang rung ba dang / sang gi gnyen mtshams ji lta ba de 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: nye du gang yang rung ba dang / sang gi gnyen mtshams ji lta ba de 'dra ba yin te /
translated: They are like relatives and friends of yesterday.🔽“I will give to you and you will give to me.”

original: nga la yang sbyin par bya ste nged kyis kyang khyed la sbyin no //🔽da'i bya ba bgyis te nged kyis kyang khyed kyi bya'o //
analyzed: nga la yang sbyin par bya ste nged kyis kyang khyed la sbyin no // da'i bya ba bgyis te nged kyis kyang khyed kyi bya'o //
translated: “I will do your work and you will do mine.”

original: kho bo ni thag ring po nas kyang khyed kyi thad du 'ong zhing kho bo 'dir gnas pa gang yin pa'ang khyed cag nyid kyi don du yin no zhes smra ste /
analyzed: kho bo ni thag ring po nas kyang khyed kyi thad du 'ong zhing kho bo 'dir gnas pa gang yin pa'ang khyed cag nyid kyi don du yin no zhes smra ste /
translated: “I have come to you from far away. I am staying here for your sake.”

original: de rnams la gces par 'gyur ro //🔽rnyed pa don du gnyer zhing rnyed pa la sogs pa 'dod pa ltos pa dang bcas pa sems 'brel pa de gzhan dag la tshul de lta bur kha gsag kun du smra ba dang / yongs su smra ba dang / don du gnyer ba dang /
analyzed: de rnams la gces par 'gyur ro // rnyed pa don du gnyer zhing rnyed pa la sogs pa 'dod pa ltos pa dang bcas pa sems 'brel pa de gzhan dag la tshul de lta bur kha gsag kun du smra ba dang / yongs su smra ba dang / don du gnyer ba dang /

original: gzhogs slong zhes bya ba ni 'di na kha cig so sor brtags shing rnyed pa la brten nas dngos bo dang de'i rgyu mtshan du las byed pa ste /🔽khyod kyi lhung bzed 'di ni mdzes so zhe 'am /🔽chos gos sam /
analyzed: gzhogs slong zhes bya ba ni 'di na kha cig so sor brtags shing rnyed pa la brten nas dngos bo dang de'i rgyu mtshan du las byed pa ste / khyod kyi lhung bzed 'di ni mdzes so zhe 'am / chos gos sam /
translated: Indirectly hinting is to say something in order to obtain something or to obtain respect, such as, “Your alms bowl is beautiful,” or🔽“Your Dharma robes are beautiful,” or🔽“Your patched robe is beautiful,” or

original: snam sbyar ram /🔽mal stan nam /
analyzed: snam sbyar ram / mal stan nam /
translated: “Your bedding is beautiful,” or

original: lde mig kyog po 'am /
analyzed: lde mig kyog po 'am /
translated: “Your key ring is beautiful,” or

original: khyod kyi yo byad 'di dang 'di ni bzang ngo //
analyzed: khyod kyi yo byad 'di dang 'di ni bzang ngo //
translated: “Your articles are beautiful.”

original: gal te kho bos 'di lta bu zhig rnyed na bcang ba bya ba na /
analyzed: gal te kho bos 'di lta bu zhig rnyed na bcang ba bya ba na /
translated: If I had something like that, I would use it.”

original: sbyin pa po 'ang rnyed pa dka'o zhes bya ba dang / gang yang rung ba'i khyim du 'ang song nas der 'di skad ces kyang smra ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa po 'ang rnyed pa dka'o zhes bya ba dang / gang yang rung ba'i khyim du 'ang song nas der 'di skad ces kyang smra ste /
translated: Or, having gone to someone’s house, one says, “Your rice is good,” or

original: khyed kyi 'bras chan 'di @23b ni bzang po yin no //🔽sran tshod bzang ngo //🔽bla gos bzang ngo //
analyzed: khyed kyi 'bras chan 'di @23b ni bzang po yin no // sran tshod bzang ngo // bla gos bzang ngo //
translated: “Your lentil soup is good,” or🔽“Your upper robe is good,” or

original: gos bzang ngo //🔽khyed kyi bca' bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: gos bzang ngo // khyed kyi bca' bar bya ba'am /
translated: “Your lower robe is good,” or🔽“Your food to be eaten before noon is good,” or

original: bza' bar bya ba 'di ni bzang po yin no //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba 'di ni bzang po yin no //
translated: “Your food to be eaten after noon is good.”

original: sngon chad kyang bdag cag la khyed kyis sbyin par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya bar gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: sngon chad kyang bdag cag la khyed kyis sbyin par bya ba dang bsgrub par bya bar gyur pa yin la /
translated: In the past, you were the ones who gave us things and made us do things.

original: kho bo cag khyed kyis byin pa dang bsgrubs pas dga' bar gyur pa yin na /🔽da ltar ni khyed cag bdag cag la sbyin par bya ba'am /
analyzed: kho bo cag khyed kyis byin pa dang bsgrubs pas dga' bar gyur pa yin na / da ltar ni khyed cag bdag cag la sbyin par bya ba'am /
translated: We were happy when you gave us things and made us do things.

original: bsgrub par bya bar mi sems so zhes smra ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bar mi sems so zhes smra ba lta bu ste /
translated: But now you don’t think of us as the ones who should give you things or do things for you.🔽This is the kind of thing that is said when people are being sarcastic.

original: de'i so sor brtags nas brkam pa las byung ba'i gzhogs slong gi las dngos po de dang de nyed kyi rgyu mtshan du brjod pa gang yin pa 'di ni gzhogs slong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i so sor brtags nas brkam pa las byung ba'i gzhogs slong gi las dngos po de dang de nyed kyi rgyu mtshan du brjod pa gang yin pa 'di ni gzhogs slong zhes bya'o //
translated: The action of sarcasm is the expression of the reasons for the various things that are said in a sarcastic way.

original: nges par ston pa zhes bya ba ni 'di na kha cig rnyed pa don du gnyer ba rnyed pa la sogs pa 'dod pa ltos pa dang bcas pa sems 'brel pas gzhan dag la 'di skad ces khyed kyis ma la yang sbyin par mi bya /
analyzed: nges par ston pa zhes bya ba ni 'di na kha cig rnyed pa don du gnyer ba rnyed pa la sogs pa 'dod pa ltos pa dang bcas pa sems 'brel pas gzhan dag la 'di skad ces khyed kyis ma la yang sbyin par mi bya /
translated: Persuasion is when someone who is seeking gain, who is interested in gain, and so on, with a mind that is attached to such things, says to others, “You should not give to your mother,

original: pha la yang ma yin /
analyzed: pha la yang ma yin /
translated: you should not give to your father,

original: sring mo la yang ma yin /
analyzed: sring mo la yang ma yin /
translated: you should not give to your sister,🔽you should not give to your brother,

original: nye du dang sang gi gnyen mtshams gang yang rung ba gzhan dag la yang sbyin par mi bya bar khyed kyis gang zhig la sbyin par bya ba 'am bya ba bsgrub pa yin zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: nye du dang sang gi gnyen mtshams gang yang rung ba gzhan dag la yang sbyin par mi bya bar khyed kyis gang zhig la sbyin par bya ba 'am bya ba bsgrub pa yin zhes smra zhing /
translated: He does not give to relatives or friends, but says, “You should give to such and such a person, or do such and such a thing.”

original: khyim 'ga' zhig tu song nas der yang 'di skad ces khyed kyi khyim du dgra bcom pa zhugs shing khyed dang dgra bcom pa lhan cig tu phrad pa dang / lhan cig tu 'dug pa dang / gtam smra bar 'gyur ba ni khyed rnyed pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽khyed kyis rnyed pa legs par rnyed do //
analyzed: khyim 'ga' zhig tu song nas der yang 'di skad ces khyed kyi khyim du dgra bcom pa zhugs shing khyed dang dgra bcom pa lhan cig tu phrad pa dang / lhan cig tu 'dug pa dang / gtam smra bar 'gyur ba ni khyed rnyed pa dang ldan pa'o // khyed kyis rnyed pa legs par rnyed do //
translated: He goes to some houses and says, “It is a gain for you that an arhat has entered your house, that you have met the arhat, that you have sat with the arhat, and that you have talked with the arhat.🔽You have gained a good gain.

original: khyed kyis 'byor pa legs par thob bo //
analyzed: khyed kyis 'byor pa legs par thob bo //
translated: You have obtained a good fortune.

original: mir rnyed pa'ang don yod pa yin no zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: mir rnyed pa'ang don yod pa yin no zhes smra zhing /

analyzed: sems bskyed pa bcu gcig par dge ba'i sems bskyed pa gcig kyang mi zad par bya bar 'dod pas zhes gang gsungs pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du yang rgya mtsho chen por chu'i thigs pa gcig bor ba'i dpes
translated: The eleventh generation of the thought, which is the generation of the thought of virtue, is said to be the desire not to exhaust even a single generation of the thought of virtue.

translated: This is because the roots of virtue dedicated to great enlightenment do not become exhausted until perfect complete enlightenment, as illustrated by the example of a single drop of water cast into the great ocean.

translated: The fourteenth generation of the thought, which is the generation of the thought of the Dharma, is said to be the desire to realize the suchness of all dharmas.
