original: chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid rjes su rtogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gang gi rigs zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba de'i chos nyid gang yin pa'o //🔽yang dag pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rjes su rtogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i ye shes thams cad kyi chos nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid rjes su rtogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par gang gi rigs zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba de'i chos nyid gang yin pa'o // yang dag pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rjes su rtogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i ye shes thams cad kyi chos nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who wishes to realize the suchness of the dharma-dhātu refers to the reality nature of that special lineage that will be explained.🔽The phrase one who wishes to realize the suchness of the limit of reality refers to the reality nature of the knowledge of the limit of reality.

original: thams phyin ci log pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams phyin ci log pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who wishes to realize the suchness of all dharmas refers to the reality nature of all dharmas, which are the objects of the knowledge of all.🔽The phrase one who wishes to realize the suchness of all inverted dharmas refers to the reality nature of all inverted dharmas, which are the objects of the knowledge of paths.

original: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pa'i'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pa'i'o //
translated: The phrase one who wishes to realize the suchness of all dharmas refers to the reality nature of all dharmas, which are subsumed within the three knowledges.

original: rjes su rtogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la rjes su smos pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtogs pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la rjes su smos pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtogs pa shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase one who wishes to realize is stated in order to indicate that the realization is in accord with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa tsam sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa tsam sel bar byed do //
translated: Therein, the knowledge of all bases eliminates the mere afflicted ignorance.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyis ni gnyen po ma lus par yang dag par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyis ni gnyen po ma lus par yang dag par 'grub par byed do //
translated: By the knowledge of the path, one accomplishes the antidotes in their entirety.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa spong ba yin no //
translated: Therein, by the knowledge of all modes, one eliminates the non-afflicted nescience.

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa gsum po 'di rnams la spang bar bya ba la brten pa'i bye brag ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa gsum po 'di rnams la spang bar bya ba la brten pa'i bye brag ci zhig mchis /
translated: What is the difference, O Lord, between the elimination of the discards that is based on the three knowledges?

original: rab 'byor gang yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang med mod kyi /
translated: Subhuti: There is no difference at all.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba sbangs pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba sbangs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: But the Tathagata has eliminated the latencies.

original: de ltar na khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: Thus there is a difference.

original: rab 'byor bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba ni nyon mongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba ni nyon mongs pa ma yin no //
translated: Subhuti: The latencies are not afflictions.

original: 'on kyang nyam thos rnams la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug sbangs pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang nyam thos rnams la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug sbangs pa yod mod kyi /
translated: But the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas have eliminated the manifest forms of passion, hatred, and confusion.

original: las dang dag gi rnam par 'gyur ba ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams bzhin du 'phags pa rnams la rab tu shes pa yin na /
analyzed: las dang dag gi rnam par 'gyur ba ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams bzhin du 'phags pa rnams la rab tu shes pa yin na /
translated: The transformation of karma and its result is well known to the noble ones, unlike the case of ordinary people.

original: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la ni mi mnga'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la ni mi mnga'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: But the Tathāgata has none of these.

original: 'dir dgra bcom pa dge slong mchongs pa can dper brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir dgra bcom pa dge slong mchongs pa can dper brjod do //
translated: Here, the arhat Bhikṣu Aṅga is cited as an example.

original: sems bskyed pa bcu bdun par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi pha rol du 'gro bar 'dod pas zhes gsungs pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dus gsum gyis sangs rgyas @26a * //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bcu bdun par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi pha rol du 'gro bar 'dod pas zhes gsungs pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // dus gsum gyis sangs rgyas @26a * //
translated: In the seventeenth generation of the mind, the statement “one who wishes to go beyond conditioned and unconditioned dharmas” means that one realizes the equality of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rjes su rtogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid la khyad par med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rjes su rtogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid la khyad par med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One who wishes to realize the suchness of all buddhas of the three times” means that there is no difference in the characteristic of their dharmakāya.

original: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis par lha'i ris thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen pos yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar nas byang chub kyi snying po gang na ba der 'gro bar bya snyam pa'i byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis par lha'i ris thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen pos yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar nas byang chub kyi snying po gang na ba der 'gro bar bya snyam pa'i byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol
translated: In the twenty-second generation of the Thought, he should think, “I will go to the site of enlightenment surrounded and escorted by the hosts of all the gods and the hosts of all the Bodhisattvas.”

original: tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
translated: The Bodhisattva should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: kun nas bskor ba ni yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas bskor ba ni yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: Here, “surrounded” means “surrounded by.”

original: mchod par bya ba nyid kyis mdun phyogs su byas pa ni mdun du bdar ba'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya ba nyid kyis mdun phyogs su byas pa ni mdun du bdar ba'o //
translated: “Escorting” means “going in front” by reason of the worship.

original: phyogs yongs su chad pa'i mdun du byas pa yin na ni /
analyzed: phyogs yongs su chad pa'i mdun du byas pa yin na ni /
translated: If it were “going in front” in the sense of a limited direction,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the former and the latter would be contradictory.

original: 'di thams cad byas nas te mdor na sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di thams cad byas nas te mdor na sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Having done all this, in brief, there is no virtuous doctrine whatsoever that is not perfected by the Bodhisattva who has generated the Thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris nas 'og min gyi bar gyi lha yod par gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag de ltar sems par byed pa ni 'jig rten skyong ba'i dbang du
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris nas 'og min gyi bar gyi lha yod par gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag de ltar sems par byed pa ni 'jig rten skyong ba'i dbang du
translated: “The world protectors are under our control.

original: byas pas sangs rgyas byung bar gyur na 'jig rten gyi mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa 'thob par bstan pa'i phyir dang / rang gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / yon tan gyi tshogs su lhung bar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: byas pas sangs rgyas byung bar gyur na 'jig rten gyi mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa 'thob par bstan pa'i phyir dang / rang gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / yon tan gyi tshogs su lhung bar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: We should proclaim that when a Buddha appears, the world attains high status and definite goodness, we should proclaim that we wish to complete our own assemblies, and we should proclaim that we have fallen from the assembly of qualities.”

original: de la rgyal chen bzhi'i ris ni lhung bzed kyi dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rgyal chen bzhi'i ris ni lhung bzed kyi dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: The Caturmaharajakayikas are under the control of the begging bowl,

original: de rnams la kham gyi zas mchog tu ro zhim pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa mang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de rnams la kham gyi zas mchog tu ro zhim pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa mang ba'i phyir te /
translated: because they have the best food, which is endowed with the quality of supreme taste.

original: 'dir gzugs can snying pos zhus pa dper brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir gzugs can snying pos zhus pa dper brjod do //
translated: Here the sutra of Visvantara is cited as an example.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa la sogs pa ni rim gro'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa la sogs pa ni rim gro'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: The gods of the Thirty-three and so on are born through the power of service.

original: de rnams sgyu rtsal ma lus pa la mkhas pa ni 'dod pa tsam la rag las pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams sgyu rtsal ma lus pa la mkhas pa ni 'dod pa tsam la rag las pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are skilled in all arts because they engage in them by merely wishing for it.

original: tshangs ris la sogs pa ni gsol ba 'debs pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: tshangs ris la sogs pa ni gsol ba 'debs pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: The Brahmakayika gods and so on are born through the power of supplication.

original: de rnams ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das @26b pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar skal ba mnyam pas gzhan rnams de la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das @26b pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar skal ba mnyam pas gzhan rnams de la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are born there through the delight of others who are of equal status in being free from attachment to the desire realm and to the transcendent path.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those free from attachment to the desire realm are Brahmakayika and so on.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gnas gtsang ma pa rnams so ;
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gnas gtsang ma pa rnams so ;
translated: Those free from attachment to the transcendent path are the Pure Abodes.

original: /'di ni phal che bas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: /'di ni phal che bas bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is taught in terms of the majority,

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'og na yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'og na yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not that there are no beings free from attachment to the transcendent path below the Brahmakayika gods and so on.

original: dbang du byas pa gsum po 'di rtogs pa mngon du byed pa su zhig gis byas she na /
analyzed: dbang du byas pa gsum po 'di rtogs pa mngon du byed pa su zhig gis byas she na /
translated: Who realizes these three masteries?

original: sus kyang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sus kyang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: No one at all.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni dge pa'i rtsa ba yongs su gyur pa'i chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni dge pa'i rtsa ba yongs su gyur pa'i chos nyid yin te /
translated: However, this is the nature of the transformation of the root of the wholesome.

original: rnam par bsgrub pa nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'di rnams kyi bdag po yin 'di rnams kyi bdag po yin pas na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris so //
analyzed: rnam par bsgrub pa nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'di rnams kyi bdag po yin 'di rnams kyi bdag po yin pas na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris so //
translated: The four great kings are the lords of those dharmas characterized by the establishment of the good.

original: legs par spyod pa lhan cig spyad pa sum cu rtsa gsum der skyes pas na sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa lhan cig spyad pa sum cu rtsa gsum der skyes pas na sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The Thirty-three are born there through the practice of the thirty-three good practices.

original: sdug bsngal las spong zhing spang pas na 'thab bral lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las spong zhing spang pas na 'thab bral lo //
translated: The Yāma gods are so called because they are free from suffering and abandon it.

original: dga' ba dang ldan zhing thob par gnas pas dga' ldan te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan zhing thob par gnas pas dga' ldan te /
translated: The Tuṣita gods are so called because they are delighted and live in attainment.

original: mgu pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mgu pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are delighted.

original: rang gis sprul zheng byas pa'i longs spyod rnams kyis dga' zhing rol pas na 'di ni 'phrul dga'o //
analyzed: rang gis sprul zheng byas pa'i longs spyod rnams kyis dga' zhing rol pas na 'di ni 'phrul dga'o //
translated: Since they enjoy and play with the enjoyments they emanate themselves, they are the gods who delight in creation.

original: gzhan gyis sprul pa'i longs spyod rnams la dbang byed pas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sprul pa'i longs spyod rnams la dbang byed pas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed do //
translated: Since they control the enjoyments emanated by others, they are the gods who control others' emanations.

original: tshangs pa chen po'i 'khor yin pas na changs 'khor te /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po'i 'khor yin pas na changs 'khor te /
translated: Since they are the retinue of Mahabrahma, they are the Brahmapurohita gods.

original: tshangs pa chen po de rnams kyis bsnyen bkur ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po de rnams kyis bsnyen bkur ba'o //
translated: They are the retinue of Mahabrahma.

original: gzhan ni 'di'i mdun na 'don gyi gnas na gnas pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don no //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'di'i mdun na 'don gyi gnas na gnas pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don no //
translated: Others are called Brahmapurohita gods because they reside in the presence of Mahabrahma.

original: tshe dang kha dog la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis tshangs pa chen po'i 'khor yin pas tshangs chen no //
analyzed: tshe dang kha dog la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis tshangs pa chen po'i 'khor yin pas tshangs chen no //
translated: Since they are the retinue of Mahabrahma through the distinctions of lifespan, color and so on, they are the Mahabrahma gods.

original: tshangs pa gzhan rnams las 'di 'od chung ba yin pas na 'ong chung ngo //
analyzed: tshangs pa gzhan rnams las 'di 'od chung ba yin pas na 'ong chung ngo //
translated: Since they have less light than other Brahmas, they are Parittashubha gods.

original: 'di la tshad med cing che ba'i 'od yod pas na tshad med 'od do //
analyzed: 'di la tshad med cing che ba'i 'od yod pas na tshad med 'od do //
translated: Since they possess immeasurable and great light, they are Apramanashubha gods.

original: 'di dag gi dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan las grub pa'i phung po'i rgyun las sprin las glog 'byung ba bzhin du 'di dang de nas 'od 'phro zhing @27a * //
analyzed: 'di dag gi dga' ba dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan las grub pa'i phung po'i rgyun las sprin las glog 'byung ba bzhin du 'di dang de nas 'od 'phro zhing @27a * //
translated: The light of these gods shines from here and there, like lightning from a cloud, from the stream of the aggregate of the attainment of concentration accompanied by joy.

original: 'byung bas na a'a bha sva ra ste 'od 'phro'o //
analyzed: 'byung bas na a'a bha sva ra ste 'od 'phro'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called Ābhāsvaras, “those who shine from here and there.”

original: yang na de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis 'od kyis snang bar byed pas na 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: yang na de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis 'od kyis snang bar byed pas na 'od gsal lo //
translated: Or, they are called Ābhāsvaras because they are illuminated by light of that nature.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi 'od gcig tu 'dug cing mi 'gyur ba la bya bar bshad la /
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi 'od gcig tu 'dug cing mi 'gyur ba la bya bar bshad la /
translated: It is explained that “virtuous” refers to the light of the body that is collected into one and does not move.

original: de ni de'i gong gi tshangs pa rnams las 'di 'od chung ba yin pa'i phyir dge chung ngo //
analyzed: de ni de'i gong gi tshangs pa rnams las 'di 'od chung ba yin pa'i phyir dge chung ngo //
translated: They are called Parīttābhās because they are less luminous than the Brahmakāyikas above them.

original: 'di dag gi 'od che zhing tshad med pa'i phyir tshad med dge'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi 'od che zhing tshad med pa'i phyir tshad med dge'o //
translated: They are called Apramāṇābhās because their light is great and immeasurable.

original: 'di dag gi 'od kyi tshogs dge bas rgyas pa'i phyir dge rgyas so //
analyzed: 'di dag gi 'od kyi tshogs dge bas rgyas pa'i phyir dge rgyas so //
translated: They are called Ābhāsvaras because their collection of light is expanded by virtue.

original: rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan las grub pa'i bdag gi lus thams cad bkang nas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan las grub pa'i bdag gi lus thams cad bkang nas gnas pa ste /
translated: “Expanded” means that the light of the body fills and remains in all of one’s body through the attainment of concentration that is free of joy.

original: de rnams ni dper na rin po che'i za ma tog gi nang na gnas pa'i mar me ni rin po che'i 'od dang 'dres pa'i rang gi 'od rnams dang 'od kyi tshogs gcig tu gyur nas gnas pa de bzhin du 'bar ba'i lus kyis rnam par gnas pa
analyzed: de rnams ni dper na rin po che'i za ma tog gi nang na gnas pa'i mar me ni rin po che'i 'od dang 'dres pa'i rang gi 'od rnams dang 'od kyi tshogs gcig tu gyur nas gnas pa de bzhin du 'bar ba'i lus kyis rnam par gnas pa
translated: For example, just as the light of a lamp placed inside a jeweled casket is mixed with the light of the jewels and the light of the lamp becomes a single mass of light, so too, the gods abide with blazing bodies.

original: yin no // 'du shes la 'dod chags dang bral ba bsgoms pas mngon par grub pa'i gzugs kyi phung po tsam yod kyi 'di la 'du shes yod pa ma yin pas na 'du shes med pa'o //
analyzed: yin no // 'du shes la 'dod chags dang bral ba bsgoms pas mngon par grub pa'i gzugs kyi phung po tsam yod kyi 'di la 'du shes yod pa ma yin pas na 'du shes med pa'o //
translated: The gods of the base of neither perception nor non-perception are so called because they are established through the meditation of freedom from attachment to perception and they exist as mere aggregates of form, but they do not have perception.

original: sprin med dang bsod nams skyes ni go bar sla'o //
analyzed: sprin med dang bsod nams skyes ni go bar sla'o //
translated: The gods of the base of the infinity of space and the base of the infinity of consciousness are easy to understand.

original: 'di rnams la bsam gtan gyi mthu las grub pa'i 'bras bu chen po yod pas na 'bras bu che'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la bsam gtan gyi mthu las grub pa'i 'bras bu chen po yod pas na 'bras bu che'o //
translated: The gods of the base of great fruit are so called because they possess the great result established through the power of concentration.

original: so so'i skye bo'i mthar thug par rnam par gnas pa'i phung po lnga dang ldan pas gegs cung zad kyang mi byed la dus cung zad kyi bdag gi gnas spong bar yang mi byed pas aa bhi ha ste mi spong ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i mthar thug par rnam par gnas pa'i phung po lnga dang ldan pas gegs cung zad kyang mi byed la dus cung zad kyi bdag gi gnas spong bar yang mi byed pas aa bhi ha ste mi spong ba'o //
translated: The five aggregates that are the ultimate of ordinary beings do not hinder it in the least, nor does it abandon their status as one's self for even a moment.

original: gzhan dag ni aa smri ha zhes bya ba yin par sems so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni aa smri ha zhes bya ba yin par sems so //
translated: Others think that it is asmrtiha, not mindfulness.

original: de dag gi lugs kyis ni de dag la 'og mar 'dod pa med pas na mi 'dod pa zhes bya bas yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi lugs kyis ni de dag la 'og mar 'dod pa med pas na mi 'dod pa zhes bya bas yin no //
translated: According to their system, it is called asmrtiha, not mindfulness, because it does not desire the lower.

original: su la yang gdung bar mi byed pas mi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: su la yang gdung bar mi byed pas mi gdung ba'o //
translated: It is asmrtiha, not mindfulness, because it does not torment anyone.

original: shin tu yid 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir na tshegs med pa'i bde bar mthong ba'i phyir su dra sha ste legs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: shin tu yid 'phrog par byed pa'i phyir na tshegs med pa'i bde bar mthong ba'i phyir su dra sha ste legs par mthong ngo //
translated: It is sudrstiha, good view, because it is a view that is very captivating and because it is seen to be the bliss of no hardship.

original: gzhan ni su darsha na ste legs par lta zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan ni su darsha na ste legs par lta zhes so //
translated: Others think that it is sudarsana, good to see.

original: de dag gi lugs kyis ni byed pa por blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi lugs kyis ni byed pa por blta bar bya'o //
translated: According to their system, it is to be viewed as the agent.

original: lta ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir mchog tu lta ba'i phyir su darsha ster ba lta'o //
analyzed: lta ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir mchog tu lta ba'i phyir su darsha ster ba lta'o //
translated: It is sudarsana, good to see, because it is the supreme view and because it is the pure view.

original: phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ram @27b 'di rnams 'og ma ma yin pa'i phyir 'og ma yin no zhes bya ba ni btsun ba zangs mdog gi'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ram @27b 'di rnams 'og ma ma yin pa'i phyir 'og ma yin no zhes bya ba ni btsun ba zangs mdog gi'o //
translated: Because it is the supreme perfection, or because it is not inferior, it is called the supreme vehicle.

original: gzhan dag ni sdig mtha' zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sdig mtha' zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that it is called the supreme vehicle because it is the end of evil.

original: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni bsags par gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni bsags par gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Evil means the nature of accumulation.

original: de ni der shin tu bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni der shin tu bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the end of that, because it is the complete destruction of that.

original: sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The generation of the mind is the generation of the mind of enlightenment.

original: sems ni rnam par shes pa ste rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni rnam par shes pa ste rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: Mind means consciousness, which is the awareness of an object.

original: rnam par shes pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is consciousness?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste dkar po'i chos thams cad la dmigs pa ni de la srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste dkar po'i chos thams cad la dmigs pa ni de la srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the mental consciousness, because it is possible for it to have as its object all the virtuous dharmas.

original: bskyed pa zhes smos pas ni ma skyes pa skyed par shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir na sems kyi rtog pa'i chos la dang po'i mtshams kyi dngos po bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa zhes smos pas ni ma skyes pa skyed par shes par byed pa yin pa'i phyir na sems kyi rtog pa'i chos la dang po'i mtshams kyi dngos po bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word generation indicates that it is the generation of what has not yet arisen, in order to demonstrate the nature of the initial limit of the dharmas of the mind.

original: sems bskyed pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bshad zin to //
translated: The generation of the mind has been explained.

original: da ni gdams ngag brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni gdams ngag brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now the instruction is to be stated.

original: 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi zhes gsungs pa las so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi zhes gsungs pa las so //
translated: From the statement, “Blessed One, how should a bodhisattva mahāsattva practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: don ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas sems bskyed par bshad pa'i chos rnams rdzogs par bya ba'i don du ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas sems bskyed par bshad pa'i chos rnams rdzogs par bya ba'i don du ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The meaning is, “Having generated the thought in that way, how should a bodhisattva who has generated the thought practice the teachings explained for the sake of completing them?”

original: skabs kyi mthar yang 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gdams pa ste 'di ni rjes su bstan pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skabs kyi mthar yang 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gdams pa ste 'di ni rjes su bstan pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the end of the chapter, it will be explained, “This is the instruction in the perfection of wisdom for a bodhisattva mahāsattva, this is the teaching.”

original: de la don du gnyer ba'i don thob pa'i bya ba nye bar ston pa ni gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la don du gnyer ba'i don thob pa'i bya ba nye bar ston pa ni gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa yin te /
translated: There, the instruction and teaching are the demonstration of the activity of attaining the goal that is sought.

original: thob zin pa'i yon tan yongs su skyong ba'i don gyis mi nyams par byed pa ni gdams ngag yin la /
analyzed: thob zin pa'i yon tan yongs su skyong ba'i don gyis mi nyams par byed pa ni gdams ngag yin la /
translated: Instruction is for the purpose of maintaining and not degenerating qualities that have been obtained.

original: de'i 'og tu ma thob pa'i yon tan thob par byed pa'i phyir na rjes su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ma thob pa'i yon tan thob par byed pa'i phyir na rjes su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Subsequently, in order to obtain qualities that have not been obtained, there is teaching.

original: gdams ngag de yang rnam pa bcur 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gdams ngag de yang rnam pa bcur 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Instruction is of ten types:

original: de'i phyir / sgrub dang bden ba rnams dang ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sgrub dang bden ba rnams dang ni //
translated: For practice, the truths,

original: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //
translated: the three jewels of the Buddha and so on,🔽nonattachment, nonexhaustion,

original: ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
analyzed: ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
translated: upholding the path, the five eyes,🔽the six qualities of clairvoyance,

original: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // bsgom zhes bya la gdams ngag ni //🔽bcu yi bdag @28a * //
analyzed: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // bsgom zhes bya la gdams ngag ni // bcu yi bdag @28a * //
translated: the path of seeing,🔽and that called meditation.

original: nyid shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid shes par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Instruction should be known to have ten natures.

original: de la sgrub pa la gdams pa ni sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams pa'o //🔽mi dmigs pa'i rnam par sgrub pa nas sgrub pa /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa la gdams pa ni sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams pa'o // mi dmigs pa'i rnam par sgrub pa nas sgrub pa /
translated: The instruction in the practice begins with “Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom does not see a bodhisattva.”

original: de nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis 'dzam bu'i gling 'di dag dge slong sha ra dva ti'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu lta bu sha stag gis 'dam bu'i tshal la sogs pa lta bur yongs su gang ba dper brjod pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis 'dzam bu'i gling 'di dag dge slong sha ra dva ti'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu lta bu sha stag gis 'dam bu'i tshal la sogs pa lta bur yongs su gang ba dper brjod pa nas brtsams te /
translated: The establishment of nonapprehending begins with the example, “If all the beings in a four-continent world system were like Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, and they were to fill up this Jambudvīpa world system like a thicket of reeds, and so on.”

original: phyogs bcu re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed des yongs su gang ba'i dge slong rnams kyi shes rab pas /
analyzed: phyogs bcu re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed des yongs su gang ba'i dge slong rnams kyi shes rab pas /
translated: The wisdom of those bhikṣus who fill up world systems in the ten directions equal to the sands of the Ganges river is not equal to a hundredth of the wisdom of a single bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab nyi ma gcig tu bsgoms pa khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab nyi ma gcig tu bsgoms pa khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa ni /
translated: The superiority of the bodhisattva's cultivation of the sun of wisdom is taught.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gal te 'dzam bu'i gling 'di dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu sha stag gis 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gal te 'dzam bu'i gling 'di dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu sha stag gis 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Śāriputra, if this Jambudvīpa were completely filled with śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas like Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, like

original: 'dam bu'i tshal lam /🔽'od ma'i tshal lam /🔽bu ram shing gi tshal lam /
analyzed: 'dam bu'i tshal lam / 'od ma'i tshal lam / bu ram shing gi tshal lam /
translated: a grove of reeds,🔽a grove of bamboo,

original: smyig ma'i tshal lam /
analyzed: smyig ma'i tshal lam /
translated: a grove of sugar cane,

original: 'bras kyi tshal lam /
analyzed: 'bras kyi tshal lam /
translated: a grove of rice,

original: til gyi tshal ltar yongs su gang bar gyur kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: til gyi tshal ltar yongs su gang bar gyur kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: or a grove of sesame, and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir shes rab tha mi dad pa ma yin nam snyam pas de khyad par med par zhus pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir shes rab tha mi dad pa ma yin nam snyam pas de khyad par med par zhus pa ni /
translated: Since all noble persons are distinguished by the unconditioned, aren't their wisdoms undifferentiated? Thinking this, he asks about their lack of distinction:

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyun du zhugs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyun du zhugs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Bhagavān, what if there were stream-enterers... and so on.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Śāriputra, what do you think?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab nyin gcig tu bsgoms pa 'bras bu gang gi don du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab nyin gcig tu bsgoms pa 'bras bu gang gi don du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The wisdom of the bodhisattva, when cultivated for a single day, is for the sake of what result?

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / chos kyi sku thob pa'i mtshan nyid ched du bya ba dang sbyor ba dang rtogs pa rnams yang dag par thob pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang ; pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / chos kyi sku thob pa'i mtshan nyid ched du bya ba dang sbyor ba dang rtogs pa rnams yang dag par thob pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang /
translated: Beginning from here, the text explains the purpose, application, and realization of the ten virtuous actions, and so on, in order to bring all sentient beings to complete nirvana, to perfect the six perfections, and to attain the dharmakaya.

original: rgyal rigs s'a la chen po lta bu la sogs pa dang / lha'i ris thams @28b cad dang / rgyun tu zhugs ba la sogs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi shes rab byang chub sems dpa' med na mi 'byung bar bstan pas sbyin gnas su gyur pa sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par ldan pa'i don gyis lan btab ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyal rigs s'a la chen po lta bu la sogs pa dang / lha'i ris thams @28b cad dang / rgyun tu zhugs ba la sogs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi shes rab byang chub sems dpa' med na mi 'byung bar bstan pas sbyin gnas su gyur pa sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par ldan pa'i don gyis lan btab ba yin no //
translated: By attaining the virtuous actions of the ten paths, the great sāla tree of the kṣatriya caste, and so on, all the god realms, the stream-enterer, and so on, and the wisdom of the perfect buddha, it is shown that without the bodhisattva, they would not arise. Thus, the reply is given by the meaning of the special possession of establishing the object of worship.

original: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po rnams dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la go rims bzhin du 'dam bu ltar las dang nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa chung du mi bzod pa dang / 'od ma la me dang mtshon dag gis bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa drag po'i gnod byed dang phrad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba mi 'chad pa dang bu ram shing dang 'dra bar gnas skabs gzhan thob kyang ngan song chad ba'i phyir bde 'gro'i skye ba rnams
analyzed: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po rnams dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la go rims bzhin du 'dam bu ltar las dang nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa chung du mi bzod pa dang / 'od ma la me dang mtshon dag gis bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa drag po'i gnod byed dang phrad kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba mi 'chad pa dang bu ram shing dang 'dra bar gnas skabs gzhan thob kyang ngan song chad ba'i phyir bde 'gro'i skye ba rnams
translated: Like sugarcane, they are born in the upper realms in order to sever the lower realms, but they do not sever the root of virtue.

original: su rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sbyor bas chos sgom pa'i mngar ba las mi 'da' ba nyid dang / smyig ma dang 'dra bar myur du mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam rtogs par byed pa nyid dang / 'bras dang 'dra bar 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams kyi rtogs pa'i 'bras bu mchog nyid yin pa dang /🔽ji ltar mthong ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i phyir til dang 'dra bar me tog la sogs ba'i dngos po tha mi dad du zin kyang /
analyzed: su rgyun mi 'chad pa'i sbyor bas chos sgom pa'i mngar ba las mi 'da' ba nyid dang / smyig ma dang 'dra bar myur du mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam rtogs par byed pa nyid dang / 'bras dang 'dra bar 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams kyi rtogs pa'i 'bras bu mchog nyid yin pa dang / ji ltar mthong ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i phyir til dang 'dra bar me tog la sogs ba'i dngos po tha mi dad du zin kyang /
translated: It is the path of seeing because it is the realization of the truth, it is the path of meditation because it is the repeated meditation on the truth, it is the uninterrupted path because it is the uninterrupted preparation for the meditation on the truth, it is the path of liberation because it is the liberation from the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, it is the distinctive path because it is the distinctive preparation for the path of meditation, it is the path of advancement because it is the advancement to the result of the path of meditation and it is the path of no further learning because it is the result of the path of meditation.🔽The path of meditation is the repeated meditation on the truth.🔽The path of no further learning is the result of the path of meditation.🔽The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.🔽The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.🔽The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.

original: dus gzhan du bsgom pa la spangs pa'i khyad par mthong ba'i dbang du byas nas dpe drug po rnams yin par shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan du bsgom pa la spangs pa'i khyad par mthong ba'i dbang du byas nas dpe drug po rnams yin par shes bar bya'o //
translated: The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.🔽The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.🔽The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.🔽The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.🔽The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.🔽The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.🔽The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.🔽The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.

original: tshal smos pa'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshal smos pa'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: The path of seeing is the realization of the truth.

original: gang zag gi khyad par rnams kyi dbang po'i khyad bar la sogs pa tha dad pa yin yang dro bar gyur ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rigs tha mi dad par shes par bya ba'i don du yin te /
analyzed: gang zag gi khyad par rnams kyi dbang po'i khyad bar la sogs pa tha dad pa yin yang dro bar gyur ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rigs tha mi dad par shes par bya ba'i don du yin te /
translated: The word “like” is used to indicate that the faculties, etc., of the different persons are not the same, but that the types of heat, etc., are not different.

original: don mang po brtag pa na yang dpe gcig gis chog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don mang po brtag pa na yang dpe gcig gis chog par 'gyur ro //
translated: And when many things are being examined, one example is sufficient.

original: re zhig lam zhes bya ba'i sgras snga ma snga ma smos pa dpe phyi ma phyi ma drang bar bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: re zhig lam zhes bya ba'i sgras snga ma snga ma smos pa dpe phyi ma phyi ma drang bar bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The word “path” in the first two examples is used to indicate the path that is being gone on, and the word “gone” in the last example is used to indicate the path that has been gone on.

original: 'on te tha mar lam smos pa 'di ci'i don du yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tha mar lam smos pa 'di ci'i don du yin zhe na /
translated: But why is the word “path” used in the last example?

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag de rnams kyi mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa shes par byed pa'i dpe gzhan drang bar bya ba'i don du yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag de rnams kyi mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa shes par byed pa'i dpe gzhan drang bar bya ba'i don du yin no //
translated: It is used to indicate that the example is to be applied to the knowledge of the happiness in this life of those noble persons.

original: 'o na dpe gzhan ci ste ma brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na dpe gzhan ci ste ma brjod ce na /
translated: Why is another example not given for the happiness in this life?

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa rnams ni rang bzhin sna @29a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa rnams ni rang bzhin sna @29a * //
translated: The happiness in this life of the noble persons is naturally understood from the previous examples.

original: tshogs pa nyid kyis rigs bsdus pa'i ngo bo shes par bya ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid kyis rigs bsdus pa'i ngo bo shes par bya ba'i don yin te /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “the nature of the assembly of the lineage” is to be understood as the nature of the assembly itself.

original: so sor dper brjod pa btags na ni dpe ji snyed cig brjod par bya zhing nye bar bshad pa la mi mkhas pa nyid du 'gyur te 'dir ngag gi don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: so sor dper brjod pa btags na ni dpe ji snyed cig brjod par bya zhing nye bar bshad pa la mi mkhas pa nyid du 'gyur te 'dir ngag gi don ni 'di yin no //
translated: If one were to give an example for each of these, one would have to give as many examples as there are things, and one would not be skilled in the use of etymologies.

original: dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu dang 'dra bar sha stag gis zhes gang gsungs pa 'dis ni ji skad gsungs pa'i rtogs pa dang mthun pa rnams kyi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu dang 'dra bar sha stag gis zhes gang gsungs pa 'dis ni ji skad gsungs pa'i rtogs pa dang mthun pa rnams kyi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of the passage is as follows: “The phrase ‘all of them were arhats’ is to be applied to the phrase ‘those who have the realization described above.’🔽The phrase ‘not even approaching a hundredth part’ and so on is to be applied to the phrase ‘those who have the realization described above.’

original: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa'i don ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the passage that begins with the words ‘not even approaching a hundredth part’?

original: 'dis ni nyin gcig bsgoms pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi grangs kyi khyad par dang / mthu'i khyad par dang / rigs kyi khyad par dang / rgyu'i khyad par dang / dpe las 'das pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyin gcig bsgoms pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi grangs kyi khyad par dang / mthu'i khyad par dang / rigs kyi khyad par dang / rgyu'i khyad par dang / dpe las 'das pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the difference in the number of the bodhisattva's wisdoms, the difference in their power, the difference in their lineage, the difference in their cause, and their transcendence of all examples.

original: de la brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba nas grangs dang zhes bya ba'i bar ni grangs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de la brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba nas grangs dang zhes bya ba'i bar ni grangs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in their number is from not approaching even a hundredth part up to not approaching even a hundred thousand one hundred millionth part.

original: khyad par med par grangs gzung ba ni de las gzhan pa'i grangs gzung bar shes par bya ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: khyad par med par grangs gzung ba ni de las gzhan pa'i grangs gzung bar shes par bya ba'i don du ste /
translated: The number is mentioned without distinction in order to understand the number that is different from that.

original: brgya la sogs pa smos pa khyad par can du gyur pa na khyad par med par grangs smos pa ni grangs khong du chud pa'i rgyu'i khyad par tsam yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: brgya la sogs pa smos pa khyad par can du gyur pa na khyad par med par grangs smos pa ni grangs khong du chud pa'i rgyu'i khyad par tsam yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: When the special number hundred and so on is mentioned, the number is mentioned without distinction in order to understand that it is merely a special cause for understanding the number.

original: bye la la sogs pa smos pa ni shes rab mang po'i go rims shes par bya ba'i don du yin no //
analyzed: bye la la sogs pa smos pa ni shes rab mang po'i go rims shes par bya ba'i don du yin no //
translated: The mention of koṭi and so on is for the purpose of understanding the order of many wisdoms.

original: char yang zhes bya ba ni mthu'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: char yang zhes bya ba ni mthu'i khyad par ro //
translated: “Even” refers to the excellence of power.

original: bgrang bar yang zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: bgrang bar yang zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi khyad par te /
translated: “Even” refers to the excellence of lineage.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi rigs la de bgrang du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi rigs la de bgrang du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lineage of the bodhisattva’s wisdom is not even counted.

original: rgyur yang zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: rgyur yang zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i khyad par te /
translated: “Even” refers to the excellence of action.

original: shes rab de ni 'di'i rgyu tsam du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab de ni 'di'i rgyu tsam du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That wisdom is not even the cause of that.

original: dper yang nye bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni dpe las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dper yang nye bar mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni dpe las 'das pa'o //
translated: “Even” refers to the excellence of example.

original: yang 'dir byang chub sems dpa' gang gi dbang du byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'dir byang chub sems dpa' gang gi dbang du byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, in this context, with respect to which bodhisattva is this?

original: gang gi shes rab nyin gcig tu bsgoms pa la 'di lta bur yon tan yod pa de'i'o //
analyzed: gang gi shes rab nyin gcig tu bsgoms pa la 'di lta bur yon tan yod pa de'i'o //
translated: It is with respect to one whose wisdom, cultivated for one day, has such qualities.

original: ci dang po sems bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: ci dang po sems bskyed pa'am /
translated: Is it with respect to one who has generated the initial thought of enlightenment?

original: spyod pa la zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: spyod pa la zhugs pa'am /
translated: Or one who has entered the practice?

original: phyir mi ldog pa'am /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'am /
translated: Or one who is irreversible?

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa yin /
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa yin /
translated: Or one who is separated from awakening by one birth?

original: re zhig bzhi pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig bzhi pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not with respect to the fourth.

original: sa bcu pa la ni de bzhin gshegs @29b pa nyid yin zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ni de bzhin gshegs @29b pa nyid yin zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and on the tenth level, he is a tathagata.

original: don ci zhig yin zhe na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pas nye bar gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don ci zhig yin zhe na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pas nye bar gnas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: He is called a tathagata because he is present with the deeds of a tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs su chud pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs su chud pas ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not called a tathagata because he has realized the tathagata state.

original: gsum pa yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: gsum pa yang ma yin te ;
translated: He is not the third,

original: sa brgyad pa la ni dgongs pa can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa bkag pas nyan thos thams cad las shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir te /🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras khyed mos par bya /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la ni dgongs pa can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa bkag pas nyan thos thams cad las shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir te / kye rgyal ba'i sras khyed mos par bya /
translated: because on the eighth level, he is superior in knowledge to all the sravakas because he has blocked the nirvar:ia that is intended for the sravakas.

original: khyed khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: khyed khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: O son of the conquerors, you should believe and understand this.

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo la bcug par ma gyur pa na ni /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo la bcug par ma gyur pa na ni /
translated: If the bhagavat buddhas had not caused that bodhisattva to enter the door of accomplishment,

original: 'di de'i tshe nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di de'i tshe nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He will enter into complete nirvana at that time.

original: yang de'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhig yin /
analyzed: yang de'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhig yin /
translated: What kind of nirvana is this?

original: gal te nyan thos kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te nyan thos kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin na /
translated: If it is the nirvana of the sravakas,

original: de ni re zhig mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni re zhig mi rigs te /
translated: that is not reasonable,

original: nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa'i yid la byed pa ni sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te ring du yongs su sbangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa'i yid la byed pa ni sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te ring du yongs su sbangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mental attention of the sravakas to the desire realm is long cultivated, beginning from the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa yin na bsgom pas spang ba de yang mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa yin na bsgom pas spang ba de yang mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: If it is the nirvana of the Buddhas, that is also unreasonable, because it is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'di brjed bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di brjed bar bya'o //
translated: This should be refuted.

original: bstan pa 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa mang po rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa mang po rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: In this teaching, many kinds of nirvana are established.

original: 'di ltar rtse mo thob pa rnams kyi ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'chad pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtse mo thob pa rnams kyi ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'chad pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Thus, for those who have attained the summit, nirvana is the severence of the roots of virtue.

original: bzod pa thob pa rnams ni ngan 'gro yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa thob pa rnams ni ngan 'gro yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Those who have attained the stage of patience have completely transcended the miserable realms.

original: bsam gtan thob pa rnams kyi ni de'i yan lag dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan thob pa rnams kyi ni de'i yan lag dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Those who have attained the dhyānas have completely transcended the branches of those dhyānas.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyi ni srid pa brgyad pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyi ni srid pa brgyad pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Those who are stream enterers have completely transcended the eighth existence.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba rnams kyi ni 'dir srid pa gnyis pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin //🔽phyir mi 'ong ba rnams kyi ni 'dod pa'i khams yong su mya ngan 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba rnams kyi ni 'dir srid pa gnyis pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin // phyir mi 'ong ba rnams kyi ni 'dod pa'i khams yong su mya ngan 'das pa yin no //
translated: Those who are once returners have completely transcended the second existence here.🔽Those who are nonreturners have completely transcended the desire realm.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //🔽'dir yang dam pa'i @30a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no // 'dir yang dam pa'i @30a * //
translated: Those who are arhats have completely transcended the nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: chos padma dkar po'i mdo tshad mar byas nas /
analyzed: chos padma dkar po'i mdo tshad mar byas nas /
translated: Here, too, the Lotus Sūtra is authoritative.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la nyan thos kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa de bzhin du dgongs pa can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa yin par shes par bya
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la nyan thos kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa de bzhin du dgongs pa can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa yin par shes par bya
translated: Just as the nirvana of the sravakas is taught to the great bodhisattvas such as the noble Sariputra, so too should one understand that it is a nirvana with a remainder of aggregates,

original: ste / dus de srid du 'gro ba'i don rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ste / dus de srid du 'gro ba'i don rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the benefit of beings is interrupted for that period of time.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi bya ba rgyun bcad pa'i phyir de nyid 'di'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi bya ba rgyun bcad pa'i phyir de nyid 'di'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore it is said that this is his nirvana because the activities of all sentient beings are interrupted.

original: gnyis pa yang ma yin te /🔽de yang de rnams las rtogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang ma yin te / de yang de rnams las rtogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not the second,🔽because the realization of the bodhisattva is superior to that of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ltar yang rgyan du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang spangs pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang rgyan du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang spangs pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus it is said that the knowledge and abandonment of those from the stage of engagement through firm conviction up to the pratyekabuddha is the forbearance of the bodhisattva.

original: de bas na yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can brda las byung ba'i sems kyis dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skabs dang por sems bskyed par bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir mngon par bzhed par mngon no //
analyzed: de bas na yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can brda las byung ba'i sems kyis dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skabs dang por sems bskyed par bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir mngon par bzhed par mngon no //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that the one who is not subject to complete degeneration, the bodhisattva who has the mind that arises from the sign, who generates the thought of awakening for the first time, who generates the thought of awakening in the first stage, is the one who is intended here.

original: gal te de ltar yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i nyin gcig bsgoms pa'i shes rab 'bras bu gang gi don du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ji snyam du sems / byang chub sems dpa'i nyin gcig bsgoms pa'i shes rab 'bras bu gang gi don du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Śāriputra, what do you think?

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa dang / chos kyi sku thob pas bsdus pa ched du bya ba dang sbyor ba dang rtogs pa rnams yang dag par thob pas zhes bya ba 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa dang / chos kyi sku thob pas bsdus pa ched du bya ba dang sbyor ba dang rtogs pa rnams yang dag par thob pas zhes bya ba 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: The passage beginning with “The wisdom of the bodhisattva who meditates for one day is the result that abides for the sake of what” and ending with “the attainment of the dharmakāya” would not be correct.

original: 'di dag ni nyin gcig bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyi 'bras bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyin gcig bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyi 'bras bu ma yin gyi /
translated: This is because these are not the results of the wisdom of one who meditates for one day.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa mang po'i shes rab kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa mang po'i shes rab kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
translated: because it is the result of the wisdom of many immeasurable eons.

original: 'dir yang mar me'i snying po tshig pa'i dpes sems bskyed pa dang po dang phyir ma'i 'bras bu yin pa ni lam yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mar me'i snying po tshig pa'i dpes sems bskyed pa dang po dang phyir ma'i 'bras bu yin pa ni lam yin no //
translated: Here, the generation of the first thought and its result are the path, as illustrated by the example of the burning wick of a lamp.

original: sgrub pa la gdams pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: sgrub pa la gdams pa bshad zin to /
translated: The instruction on practice has been explained.

original: // / bden pa la gdams pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / bden pa la gdams pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the instruction on the truths?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la gdams pa gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la gdams pa gang yin ba'o //
translated: It is the instruction on the four noble truths.

original: @30b de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: @30b de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to that, with regard to the truth of suffering,

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is said, Śāriputra, here, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva is diligent in the emptiness of form, he is said to be diligent.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the truth of origination,

original: gal te gzugs skye ba'i chos can nam 'gag pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: gal te gzugs skye ba'i chos can nam 'gag pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: if one does not see form as a phenomenon of arising or ceasing,

original: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam rnam par byad ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽gzugs ni tshor bar yang dag par 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam rnam par byad ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / gzugs ni tshor bar yang dag par 'du ba yin no //
translated: He does not see form as a thing that is defiled or purified.🔽He does not see form as being included in feeling.

original: zhes bya bar yang dag par rdzas su mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: zhes bya bar yang dag par rdzas su mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: He does not see form as being real in the sense of being substantially existent.🔽And so on up to:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Śāriputra, the emptiness of form is not form.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And so on up to: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar gzugs gzhan ma yin la stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar gzugs gzhan ma yin la stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Śāriputra, it is not that form is one thing and emptiness another.

original: gzugs stong pa nyid yin la stong pa nyid ni gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid yin la stong pa nyid ni gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Form is emptiness and emptiness is form.

original: 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis sel bar byed do //
translated: This passage eliminates the two extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to the truth of cessation, it says:

original: sh'a ri'i bu stong pa nyid de ni mi skye mi 'gag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /🔽rnam par byang bam yin /🔽'grib bam yin 'phel bam yin /🔽'das pa yang ma yin /🔽ma 'ongs ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu stong pa nyid de ni mi skye mi 'gag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin / rnam par byang bam yin / 'grib bam yin 'phel bam yin / 'das pa yang ma yin / ma 'ongs ba yang ma yin /
translated: Śāriputra, that emptiness does not arise or cease, is not defiled or purified,🔽does not decrease or increase,🔽is not past, future, or present,🔽is not internal or external,

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin no //🔽gang yang 'di 'dra bde la ni gzugs med do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin no // gang yang 'di 'dra bde la ni gzugs med do //
translated: is not something to be attained or not attained.🔽It is not form, not feeling, not perception, not volitional factors, not consciousness.🔽It is not the eyes, not the ears, not the nose, not the tongue, not the body, not the mind.

original: tshor ba med do zhes bya ba nas ma rig ba skye ba med do //
analyzed: tshor ba med do zhes bya ba nas ma rig ba skye ba med do //
translated: It is not form, not sound, not smell, not taste, not texture, not mental objects.🔽It is not the eye constituent, not the form constituent, not the eye consciousness constituent, and so on up to: not the mind constituent, not the mental object constituent, not the mind consciousness constituent.🔽It is not the earth constituent, not the water constituent, not the fire constituent, not the wind constituent, not the space constituent, not the consciousness constituent.🔽It is not the constituent of the perfection of giving, not the constituent of the perfection of morality, not the constituent of the perfection of patience, not the constituent of the perfection of perseverance, not the constituent of the perfection of concentration, not the constituent of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ma rig pa 'gag pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar dang / rgyun du zhugs pa med do //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gag pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar dang / rgyun du zhugs pa med do //
translated: It is not the constituent of inner emptiness, not the constituent of outer emptiness, not the constituent of outer and inner emptiness, and so on up to: it is not the constituent of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu med do zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas med do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu med do zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas med do //
translated: It is not the applications of mindfulness, not the right efforts, not the legs of miraculous power, not the faculties, not the powers, not the seven aspects of enlightenment, not the noble eightfold path, not the three gateways to liberation, not the ten powers of a tathāgata, not the four fearlessnesses, not the four detailed and thorough knowledges, not the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' med do zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //🔽lam gyi bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' med do zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //🔽lam gyi bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is not the perfection of giving, not the perfection of morality, not the perfection of patience, not the perfection of perseverance, not the perfection of concentration, not the perfection of wisdom.🔽It is not the emptiness of emptiness, not the emptiness of great extent, not the emptiness of ultimate reality, not the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, not the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, not the emptiness of the unlimited, not the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, not the emptiness of nonrepudiation, not the emptiness of inherent existence, not the emptiness of all things

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na bdag nyid la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya 'am mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi @31a * //🔽mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na bdag nyid la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya 'am mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi @31a * // mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom, he does not consider whether he is striving or not striving in the perfection of giving, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la lam du grags pa yin pa'i phyir lam yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la lam du grags pa yin pa'i phyir lam yin no //
translated: The path is the six perfections, because they are renowned as the path.

original: yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i rnam par rnams la lam yin no //🔽zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: yang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i rnam par rnams la lam yin no // zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The path is the various aspects, because they are subsumed in the three doors of liberation.🔽The three doors of liberation are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid kyis sbyor bar mi byed de //
analyzed: de stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid kyis sbyor bar mi byed de //
translated: He does not practice emptiness by means of emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor lam yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor lam yin no //
translated: because the yoga of emptiness is the path.

original: mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma med pas sbyor bar mi byed de /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma med pas sbyor bar mi byed de /
translated: He does not practice signlessness by means of signlessness,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor la ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor la ma yin no //
translated: because the yoga of signlessness is not the path.

original: smom pa med pa la smon pas sbyor bar mi byed de //
analyzed: smom pa med pa la smon pas sbyor bar mi byed de //
translated: He does not practice wishlessness by means of wishlessness,🔽because the yoga of wishlessness is not the path.

original: smon pa med pa'i rnal 'byor la ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i rnal 'byor la ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: It is not in the yoga of wishlessness.

original: 'dis ni lam gyi bden pa rnam par mi rtog pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lam gyi bden pa rnam par mi rtog pa yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the truth of the path is non-conceptual.

original: de la gzugs la sngon gyi mthas sbyor bar mi byed de //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sngon gyi mthas sbyor bar mi byed de //
translated: Therein, it is said, “He does not apply form to the prior limit,” and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas sngon gyi mtha' nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas //🔽de sngon gyi mthong ngo bya ba nas /🔽de sngon gyi mtha' la phyir ma'i mthas sbyor bar mi byed de //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas sngon gyi mtha' nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas // de sngon gyi mthong ngo bya ba nas / de sngon gyi mtha' la phyir ma'i mthas sbyor bar mi byed de //
translated: Śāriputra, it is because the bodhisattva does not see the prior limit itself.🔽He does not apply the prior limit to the future limit.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' la sngon gyi mthas sbyor bar mi byed do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' la sngon gyi mthas sbyor bar mi byed do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He does not apply the future limit to the prior limit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because the three times are the same.

original: 'dis ni lam gyi nges par 'byin pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni lam gyi nges par 'byin pa ston par byed do //
translated: This shows the definite emergence of the path.

original: nges par 'byung bar bya ba yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar bya ba yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the definite emergence?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /🔽gang gi phyir de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las 'das pas sbyor bar mi byed de //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de / gang gi phyir de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las 'das pas sbyor bar mi byed de //
translated: It is the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Because he does not engage in the knowledge of all aspects,

original: 'di ltar 'das pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: since he does not see even the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bden pa la gdams pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bden pa la gdams pa bshad zin to /
translated: The instruction on the truths has been explained.

original: // / dkon mchog gsum la gdams pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: // / dkon mchog gsum la gdams pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the instruction on the Three Jewels?

original: de ni dkon mchog gsum la gdams pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dkon mchog gsum la gdams pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the instruction on the Three Jewels.

original: de la sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas te /
translated: Therein, the dharmas that make one a Buddha are the Buddha.

original: de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yang dag par bsdus pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis yang dag par bsdus pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: And it is said that that is subsumed in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la rnam @31b pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis sbyor bar mi byed de //
analyzed: gzugs la rnam @31b pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis sbyor bar mi byed de //
translated: He does not apply the knowledge of all aspects to form.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid /
translated: Why is that?🔽Form itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
translated: Emptiness itself is form.

original: zhes bya bas chos rnams dang / de'i stong pa nyid phan tshun gyi rang bzhin gcig tu 'dod pas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas chos rnams dang / de'i stong pa nyid phan tshun gyi rang bzhin gcig tu 'dod pas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he teaches that phenomena and their emptiness are one and the same nature.

original: de la sngags ni rtag pa'i mtha' bkag la cig shos kyis ni chad pa'i mtha' bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sngags ni rtag pa'i mtha' bkag la cig shos kyis ni chad pa'i mtha' bkag pa yin no //
translated: Here, the mantra refutes the extreme of permanence, while the other refutes the extreme of annihilation.🔽With regard to the four noble truths, the distinctive object of observation that is not a location in the context of the truth of suffering is as follows:

original: bden pa bzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i skabs su gnas pa med pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i skabs su gnas pa med pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, Bhagavan, when bodhisattva mahasattva are practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: des gzugs la mi rtag ces gnas mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: des gzugs la mi rtag ces gnas mi bgyi'o //
translated: they should not abide in the notion that form is impermanent.

original: zhes bya ba nas gzugs la zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas gzugs la zhi ba'o //
translated: From form is peaceful.

original: zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: “I am practicing the perfection of wisdom.”

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par te /
translated: And so on at length.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gzugs mi rtag ba ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gzugs mi rtag ba ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: Blessed One, impermanence of form is empty of impermanence of form.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la gnas pa ni dngos po la dmigs pa'i sems kyi rten pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni dngos po la dmigs pa'i sems kyi rten pa'o //
translated: Here, abiding is the support of the mind that takes a real thing as its object.

original: 'dir spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir spyad par bya ste /
translated: Here, one should practice as follows:

original: gal te re zhig gnas pa med pa tsam gnas par mi bya ba yin na ni med pa'i phyir gnyen po mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te re zhig gnas pa med pa tsam gnas par mi bya ba yin na ni med pa'i phyir gnyen po mi rigs so //
translated: If, on the one hand, one should not abide in the mere absence of abiding, then, because it does not exist, the antidote is not tenable.

original: 'on te gang gnas pa yin pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gang gnas pa yin pa ma yin na /
translated: But if one should not abide in what is abiding,

original: de lta na ni thal ches pa yin no zhe na /🔽mngon par zhen //
analyzed: de lta na ni thal ches pa yin no zhe na / mngon par zhen //
translated: then it is too much.🔽One should not settle down on it.🔽One should not settle down on it.🔽One should not settle down on it.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de'ang mi rtag pa nyid ma lags pa nyid las gud na yang stong pa nyid ma mchis te zhes bya bas mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams dang / de'i stong pa nyid phan tshun de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'i khyad par can dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de'ang mi rtag pa nyid ma lags pa nyid las gud na yang stong pa nyid ma mchis te zhes bya bas mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams dang / de'i stong pa nyid phan tshun de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'i khyad par can dang /
