original: de ni 'di ltar sangs rgyas nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sangs rgyas nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: because he does not see even Buddhahood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa /🔽rnam pa @32a * //🔽thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa / rnam pa @32a * // thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: Buddhahood is the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is Buddhahood.

original: byang chub nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: byang chub nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: Awakening is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang byang chub po zhes bya ba ste /🔽'dis ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa po mnyam pa nyid kyi yi shes ni sangs rgyas yin no zhes yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang byang chub po zhes bya ba ste / 'dis ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs pa po mnyam pa nyid kyi yi shes ni sangs rgyas yin no zhes yongs su bstan to //
translated: And the knowledge of all modes is the enlightenment.🔽This shows that the Buddha is the knowledge of the sameness of the objective support and the subject.🔽The passage that begins with “Subhuti, furthermore, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom” and ends with “he does not review even the knowledge of all modes as a reality” shows the Dharma Jewel.

original: chos dkon mchog gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: chos dkon mchog gi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni //
translated: The passage that begins with “Subhuti, furthermore, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom” and ends with “he does not review even the knowledge of all modes as a reality” shows the Dharma Jewel.

original: / gzugs rtag ces bya ba dang mi rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: / gzugs rtag ces bya ba dang mi rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro // zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The passage that begins with “Subhuti, furthermore, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom” and ends with “he does not review even the knowledge of all modes as a reality” shows the Dharma Jewel.🔽The passage that begins with “Subhuti, furthermore, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom” and ends with “he does not review even the knowledge of all modes as a reality” shows the Dharma Jewel.🔽The passage that begins with “Subhuti, furthermore, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom” and ends with “he does not review even the knowledge of all modes as a reality” shows the Dharma Jewel.🔽The passage that begins with “Subhuti, furthermore, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom” and ends with “he does not review even the knowledge of all modes as a reality” shows the Dharma Jewel.

original: chos ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir thams cad du 'dod chags pa dang bral ba yin par bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir thams cad du 'dod chags pa dang bral ba yin par bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The passage that begins with “Subhuti, furthermore, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of wisdom” and ends with “he does not review even the knowledge of all modes as a reality” shows the Dharma Jewel.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba nas btsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba nas btsams te /
translated: The bodhisattva does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the perfection of giving, and so on up to🔽he does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of all the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa bkag pa dang / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i don dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa bkag pa dang / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i don dang /
translated: Similarly, he does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the irreversible stage, for the sake of maturing beings, for the sake of purifying a buddhafield,

original: stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / las so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang /
analyzed: stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / las so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang /
translated: for the sake of the powers, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, and unentangled qualities of a buddha, for the sake of the emptinesses from inner emptiness up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / lha'i mig yul dang bcas pa dang / de'i yul phyogs bcu re re zhing gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams na sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba lha'i mig gis mthong bar bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / lha'i mig yul dang bcas pa dang / de'i yul phyogs bcu re re zhing gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams na sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba lha'i mig gis mthong bar bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the reality of the ultimate element, the reality of the ultimate element, the limit of reality, the sphere of the divine eye together with its object, and the objects of the divine eye in each of the ten directions, as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Ganges River, seeing the deaths and rebirths of sentient beings.

original: lha'i rna ba yul dang bcas cas dang / de'i yul ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems can gyi sgras bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba yul dang bcas cas dang / de'i yul ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems can gyi sgras bsdus pa'o //
translated: The divine ear together with its object, and its object is included in the sounds of sentient beings just explained.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa yul dang bcas pa dang / de'i yul ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems @32b kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa yul dang bcas pa dang / de'i yul ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems @32b kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of others' minds together with its object, and its object is included in the minds of sentient beings just explained.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang bcas pa de'i yul ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi gnas kyas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang bcas pa de'i yul ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi gnas kyas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The recollection of past lives together with its object, and its object is included in the past lives of sentient beings just explained.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa yul dang bcas pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa bkag pa ste ;
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa yul dang bcas pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa bkag pa ste ;
translated: The wisdom paramita is the practice that is the object of the knowledge of the domain of supernatural powers together with its object.

original: de'i yul ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems can rnams kyi gzhi'i yul du 'gro bas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems can rnams kyi gzhi'i yul du 'gro bas yang dag par bsdus pa'o //
translated: The domain of that is the domain of the basis of sentient beings, which is just explained, and is included in the perfect.

original: de ltar spyod pa ni sems can gyi khams gzhal du med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa bsal pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su so rnams su da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas lha'i rigs rnams srung bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa ni sems can gyi khams gzhal du med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / bdud kyis glags mi rnyed pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa bsal pa dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su so rnams su da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas lha'i rigs rnams srung bar byed pa dang /
translated: Thus, the practice is the complete nirvana of the immeasurable realm of sentient beings, the non-discovery of the opportunity of Mara, the removal of the afflictions of the world, and the protection of the families of gods, the Buddhas, the Sravakas, and the Pratyekabuddhas in the worlds of the ten directions.

original: mthong ba'i chos nyid la byams pa'i rgyu can gyis las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / tshegs chung dus gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mngon du gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du skye ba thams cad du sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed pa dang /🔽chos thams cad nye bar mi dmigs pas phrad pa dang bral ba bkag pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rjes su mi dmigs pa'i phyir de dag gis myur du mngon par byang chub pa bkag pa dang / sna tshogs par byed pa mi byed pa'i phyir rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs pa po'i chos nye bar mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos nyid la byams pa'i rgyu can gyis las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / tshegs chung dus gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mngon du gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du skye ba thams cad du sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / chos thams cad nye bar mi dmigs pas phrad pa dang bral ba bkag pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rjes su mi dmigs pa'i phyir de dag gis myur du mngon par byang chub pa bkag pa dang / sna tshogs par byed pa mi byed pa'i phyir rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs pa po'i chos nye bar mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: The cause of love is the purification of obscurations related to karma through the Dharma of seeing, the actualization of the doors of retention and concentration with little difficulty, pleasing the buddhas in all one's lives up to the essence of enlightenment and the attainment of the result of the Dharma of seeing.

original: chos kyi dbyings la stong pa dang mi stong par sbyor ba bkag pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i khams bco brgyad la stong pa nyid kyis sam //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la stong pa dang mi stong par sbyor ba bkag pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i khams bco brgyad la stong pa nyid kyis sam //

original: de la de dag gis sbyor ba bkag pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'da' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor mchog tu brjod pa dang /🔽rtogs pa thams cad la nga rgyal bkag pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor la gnas nas snying rje chen po dang byams pa chen po mngon par @33a * //
analyzed: de la de dag gis sbyor ba bkag pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'da' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor mchog tu brjod pa dang / rtogs pa thams cad la nga rgyal bkag pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor la gnas nas snying rje chen po dang byams pa chen po mngon par @33a * //
translated: The reason for this is that it is the cause for the prevention of their application, for the transcendence of the levels of the śrāvakas, etc., for the purification of the buddhaverse, for the development of living beings, and for the swift attainment of unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment.

original: bsgrub pa dang ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i sems mi skyed pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i sems mi skyed pas zhes bya'o //
translated: The reason for this is that it is the cause for the prevention of their pride in all their realizations, for the accomplishment of great compassion and great loving kindness while abiding in the yoga of emptiness, and for the non-arising of the mental states of stinginess, etc., which are the counteragents to the six perfections.

original: 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa bsal ba dang zhes brjod pa de la 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa bsal ba dang zhes brjod pa de la 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pas bsdus pa ste /
translated: The phrase “in order to eliminate the afflictions of the world” means that the afflictions of the world are included within ignorance, the views, and the impurities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag rtsa ba nas shin tu gzhol ba'i phyir rnal 'byor rtsom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag rtsa ba nas shin tu gzhol ba'i phyir rnal 'byor rtsom par byed pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, however, is one who engages in spiritual practice in order to eliminate those afflictions from their very root.

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa yongs su shes bzhin du yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsams bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba len par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa yongs su shes bzhin du yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bsams bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba len par byed do //
translated: Even though he has thoroughly understood the impurity of desire, he takes birth in the desire realm through his freedom of choice in order to develop living beings.

original: srid pa'i zag pa yongs su shes bzhin du bsams bzhin du srid pa'i zag pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa yongs su shes bzhin du bsams bzhin du srid pa'i zag pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: Even though he has thoroughly understood the impurity of existence, he takes hold of the impurity of existence through his freedom of choice.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa med par brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ni nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa med par brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva should not be described as either afflicted or unafflicted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kun du mi spyod pas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod par mi bya la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kun du mi spyod pas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod par mi bya la /
translated: Because they do not indulge in the afflictions, they should not be called “those with afflictions.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mngon par 'dod pa dang bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mngon par 'dod pa dang bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Because they desire the transcendent wisdom of the tathāgatas and have not completed their intentions, they should not be called “those without afflictions.”

original: de la dge 'dun dkon mchog ni 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge 'dun dkon mchog ni 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The jewel of the Saṅgha here should be understood as the Saṅgha of irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: de dag kyang zhugs pa dang 'bras bu la gnas pa'i dbye bas skyes bu zung bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhugs pa dang 'bras bu la gnas pa'i dbye bas skyes bu zung bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: They are also the four pairs of individuals, distinguished as those who have entered the result and those who abide in the result.

original: de bsdus pa yang gang zag brgyad pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bsdus pa yang gang zag brgyad pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Those who are included in that are the eight kinds of individuals and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir brgyad pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa'i 'dis gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gang nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa lags /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brgyad pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas pa'i 'dis gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gang nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa lags /
translated: Bhagavan, when a bodhisattva who dwells in this dwelling of the perfection of wisdom dies here, where are they born?

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas ni dbang po rnon po gang du skye bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas ni dbang po rnon po gang du skye bar 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: When they die here, where are those of sharp faculty born?

original: de la gang lam shes pa nyid la mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug 'chad par 'gyur ba gang gi yin pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug po de rnams la byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul por gyur pa gang yin pa de ni dad pas rjes🔽su 'brang ba zhes @33b brjod de /
analyzed: de la gang lam shes pa nyid la mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug 'chad par 'gyur ba gang gi yin pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug po de rnams la byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rtul por gyur pa gang yin pa de ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes @33b brjod de /
translated: In this context, those of dull faculty who have the sixteen moments of the path of seeing that are explained in the knowledge of the path are called followers of faith.

original: dad pas lam de'i rdo rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dbang po rnon po gang yin pa de ni chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: dad pas lam de'i rdo rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dbang po rnon po gang yin pa de ni chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: They are called followers of faith because they follow that path through faith. Those of sharp faculty are followers of reality.

original: shes rab kyis lam de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis lam de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because wisdom follows that path.

original: gang gi phyir dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni //
translated: The path of the one who has faith and is a follower through belief is stated with reference to the one who has faith and is a follower through belief.

original: de la sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid du skyes pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ma gtogs par dbang po rtul po yin🔽te // zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid du skyes pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ma gtogs par dbang po rtul po yin te // zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Śāriputra, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who dies among humans and is reborn among humans, except for the irreversible bodhisattva-mahāsattva, is of dull faculties.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bkol ba ni dbang po rnon po'i lam gyis sa de thos de thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bkol ba ni dbang po rnon po'i lam gyis sa de thos de thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The irreversible bodhisattva is of sharp faculties, because he attains that stage by the path of the one who has faith and is a follower through belief.

original: chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsung pa ni sh'a ri'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' chen po sa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan nam /
analyzed: chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsung pa ni sh'a ri'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa' chen po sa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan nam /
translated: The path of the one who follows the Dharma is stated with reference to the one who follows the Dharma. Śāriputra, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who dies in a buddha-field and is reborn in another buddha-field, except for the irreversible bodhisattva-mahāsattva, is of dull faculties.

original: dga' ldan gyi ris nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa de ni dbang po rnon por 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi ris nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa de ni dbang po rnon por 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: One who dies from the Abode of Joy and is born here has sharp faculties.

original: de la lam shes pa nyid las dgu po rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po la sogs pa spang ba'i don du chung du'i chung du la sogs pa'i dbye bas sgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgu 'chad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de las dad pa
analyzed: de la lam shes pa nyid las dgu po rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po la sogs pa spang ba'i don du chung du'i chung du la sogs pa'i dbye bas sgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgu 'chad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de las dad pa
translated: The nine stages of the path of meditation that will be explained for the purpose of abandoning the great of the great afflictions and so on of the nine stages of the knowledge of the path are classified as the small of the small and so on.

original: dang chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa'i gang zag dag gis gal te rnam pa drug pa'am /
analyzed: dang chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa'i gang zag dag gis gal te rnam pa drug pa'am /
translated: If those persons who are followers of faith and followers of reality abandon the sixth,

original: bdun pa dang brgyad pa sngar spangs par gyur na ni de las de dag 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdun pa dang brgyad pa sngar spangs par gyur na ni de las de dag 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: seventh and eighth stages, they enter the second result.

original: gal te rnam pa dgu yang spang ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams sam gong ma ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na ni de las 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa dgu yang spang ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams sam gong ma ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na ni de las 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: If one becomes free from attachment to the desire realm or to any level up to the base of nothingness by abandoning even nine stages, one enters the third result.

original: skad cig ma bcu drug pa la ni de gnyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug pa la ni de gnyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: On the sixteenth moment, one becomes an abider in the result of nonreturn.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not become an abider in the result of an arhat.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba mi spong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba mi spong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the path of seeing does not abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: sngar yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i tshe yang sngar dbang po rtul po dad pas rjes su @34a * //
analyzed: sngar yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro // de'i tshe yang sngar dbang po rtul po dad pas rjes su @34a * //
translated: It is also impossible that one previously became free from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: 'brang ba gang yin pa de ni dad pas lhag par mos ba zhes brjod de //
analyzed: 'brang ba gang yin pa de ni dad pas lhag par mos ba zhes brjod de //
translated: At that time, one who was previously a person of dull faculty who was a follower of faith is called a follower by faith who has attained view.

original: dad pa lhag pa nyid kyis na lhag par mos pas rab tu mos pa rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa lhag pa nyid kyis na lhag par mos pas rab tu mos pa rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the predominance of faith, they are distinguished by their superior aspiration.

original: dbang po rnon po sngar chos kyis rjes su 'brang bar gyur pa gang pa gang yin pa de ni mthong bas thob pa zhes brjod de //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po sngar chos kyis rjes su 'brang bar gyur pa gang pa gang yin pa de ni mthong bas thob pa zhes brjod de //
translated: Those who previously were followers of reality with sharp faculties are called “those who attain through seeing.”

original: shes rab lhag pa nyid kyis na mthong bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab lhag pa nyid kyis na mthong bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are distinguished by their superior wisdom.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu gnyis pa dang gsum pa la zhugs pa dad pas lhag par mos pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu gnyis pa dang gsum pa la zhugs pa dad pas lhag par mos pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, with regard to those who have entered the second and third fruits, it is said with reference to those who are predominant in faith:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mi mkhas pa gang dag bsams gtan bzhi po rnams sgrub par byed //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mi mkhas pa gang dag bsams gtan bzhi po rnams sgrub par byed //
translated: “Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who are not skilled in means. They accomplish the four concentrations

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang la yang spyod par byed cing bsam gtan thob pa des kyang lha tshe ring po'i gnas su skyes te //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang la yang spyod par byed cing bsam gtan thob pa des kyang lha tshe ring po'i gnas su skyes te //
translated: and practice the six perfections. Through attaining concentration, they are born in the long-lived gods’ realm.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas de gal te 'dod pa'i khams su lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye na de dag gi dbang po rnams rtul por 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas de gal te 'dod pa'i khams su lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye na de dag gi dbang po rnams rtul por 'gyur ba dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, after death, if they are born among gods and humans of the desire realm, their faculties are dull.

original: 'bras bu gnyis pa dang gsum pa la zhugs pa'i mthong bas thob pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu gnyis pa dang gsum pa la zhugs pa'i mthong bas thob pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of those who attain the second and third results through seeing.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' thams la mkhas pa gang dag bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyom par 'jug pa rnams la snyom par zhugs shing byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams la yang snyoms par 'jug la //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' thams la mkhas pa gang dag bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyom par 'jug pa rnams la snyom par zhugs shing byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams la yang snyoms par 'jug la //
translated: Śāriputra, there are skilled bodhisattvas who enter meditative attainment in the concentrations and formless absorptions and also enter meditative attainment in the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not enter meditative attainment through the power of the concentrations and so on.

original: 'on kyang thabs la mkhas pas gang dag gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyes par byed pa de dang de dag tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba dag yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang thabs la mkhas pas gang dag gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyes par byed pa de dang de dag tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba dag yod de /
translated: However, through skill in means, they are born in those places where they can please the blessed buddhas.

original: de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor dang ma bral bas bsam pa bzang po 'di nyid la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor dang ma bral bas bsam pa bzang po 'di nyid la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: They are not separated from the yoga of the perfection of wisdom, and they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening with this very good thought.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to the once-returner, it is said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang dag thabs la mkhas pas bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa @34b zhes bya ba nas rgya cher dga' ldan gyi gnas su ji srid kyi bar du gnas
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang dag thabs la mkhas pas bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa @34b zhes bya ba nas rgya cher dga' ldan gyi gnas su ji srid kyi bar du gnas
translated: Śāriputra, those bodhisattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom with skill in means enter the concentrations and formless absorptions, and so on at length up to they are born in the Tuṣita heaven, and so on up to they are born here.

original: nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skye ba yang dag par bstan te /
analyzed: nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skye ba yang dag par bstan te /
translated: They demonstrate the path to the gods, and so on up to they demonstrate the path to humans.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyab yang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgyab yang yod do zhes bya ba'i bar te /
translated: There are those who attain manifest complete buddhahood in the various buddha fields and become perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: de rnams ni 'jig rten 'dir lan cig 'ongs te gzhan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni 'jig rten 'dir lan cig 'ongs te gzhan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called “once-returners” because they come to this world once and then pass into parinirvāṇa elsewhere.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to non-returners, it says:

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa drug po thob pa gang dag 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams su mi skye //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa drug po thob pa gang dag 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams su mi skye //
translated: Śāriputra, there are also bodhisattvas who attain the six superknowledges and are not reborn in the desire realm, the form realm, or the formless realm.

original: 'ong kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'dong ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'ong kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'dong ba nas brtsams te /
translated: They go from buddha field to buddha field.

original: gang dag gang na rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs pa de dang der skyes bar 'gyur bar byed pa dang kyang yod do zhes bya ba yin bo//
analyzed: gang dag gang na rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs pa de dang der skyes bar 'gyur bar byed pa dang kyang yod do zhes bya ba yin bo//
translated: They are born in the place where the buddhas reside and where the Mahayana is widespread.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni nam yang mched de nyid du skye ba gnyis pa mngon par sgrub par mi byed de khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni nam yang mched de nyid du skye ba gnyis pa mngon par sgrub par mi byed de khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonreturners never establish a second birth in that very place of rebirth, because they proceed to a distinctive state.

original: de ltar 'di phyir mi 'ong ba nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'di phyir mi 'ong ba nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Thus, nonreturners complete their nonreturn.

original: gang dag gang du skyes pa de dang der gtan mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag gang du skyes pa de dang der gtan mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they never return to the place where they were born.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i zhes pa'i bshad pa gang yin pa rigs nas rigs su skye ba de nyid rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa'i zhes pa'i bshad pa gang yin pa rigs nas rigs su skye ba de nyid rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of stream enterers born in the same class should be understood as twofold:

original: mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba'o //
translated: born in the same class of humans and born in the same class of gods.

original: de la dang po ni /
analyzed: de la dang po ni /
translated: The first🔽is born in the same class of humans.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bsam gtan bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed nas thabs la mkhas pas mi rigs rnams su rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /🔽bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bsam gtan bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed nas thabs la mkhas pas mi rigs rnams su rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am / bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'am /
translated: Sariputra, there are bodhisattvas who, having generated the dhyanas and formless absorptions, are born in the families of the khattiyas,

original: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ba dag yod do zhes gang gsungs pa ste /🔽de ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum dang bzhi pa spangs pa dang / de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa dang / skye ba gnyis sam gsum lhag pas na rgyun tu zhugs pa @35a * //🔽las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ba dag yod do zhes gang gsungs pa ste / de ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum dang bzhi pa spangs pa dang / de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa dang / skye ba gnyis sam gsum lhag pas na rgyun tu zhugs pa @35a * // las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the brahmins, or the householders who are like great shala trees, through their skill in means.

original: gnyis pa la ni //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni //
translated: This is because they are superior to the stream enterer who has abandoned three or four types of affliction and obtained the uncontaminated faculties that are their antidote, and who has two or three births remaining.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la sogs pa thob pa gang dag thabs la mkhas pas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lhag rnams kyi bar du skyes te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la sogs pa thob pa gang dag thabs la mkhas pas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lhag rnams kyi bar du skyes te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who attain the meditative stabilizations and so forth, and through their skill in means are born among the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika gods up to the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods.

original: der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mnyes par byed pa dag yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: der sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mnyes par byed pa dag yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There they please the Blessed Buddhas.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes gang gsungs pa de nyid bar chad gcig pa yin pa ni//
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes gang gsungs pa de nyid bar chad gcig pa yin pa ni//
translated: Those who are called “once-returners” are “those with one interval.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bsam gtan bzhi nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bar du thob kyang de dag mngon du mi byed pa dag yod de//
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bsam gtan bzhi nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bar du thob kyang de dag mngon du mi byed pa dag yod de//
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who attain the four meditative stabilizations and the four noble truths, but do not actualize them.

original: de dag ni tshe gcig gis thogs par shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni tshe gcig gis thogs par shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: You should know that they are impeded by only one lifetime.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs shing de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa dang skye ba'i lhag ma gcig lus pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir bar chad gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs shing de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa dang skye ba'i lhag ma gcig lus pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir bar chad gcig pa'o //
translated: It is the single interruption because it is superior to the once-returner who has abandoned seven or eight afflictions and obtained the uncontaminated faculties that are their antidotes, and has only one birth remaining.

original: nyon mongs pa dgu spangs pa'i phyir na phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa lngar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dgu spangs pa'i phyir na phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa lngar shes par bya'o //
translated: The stage of non-returner, which is explained as abandoning nine afflictions, should be understood in five ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
translated: Parinirvana in the intermediate state.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la sogs pa thob pa gang dag thabs la mkhas pas tshangs ris kyi lha rnams nas 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi bar du skye bar 'gyur ba dag yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la sogs pa thob pa gang dag thabs la mkhas pas tshangs ris kyi lha rnams nas 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi bar du skye bar 'gyur ba dag yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who attain dhyāna and so forth. Through skillful means, they are reborn among the Brahmakāyika gods up to the Akaniṣṭha gods. Those who are reborn there... and so forth.

original: te / de ni tshangs ris nas brtsams te 'og min gyi bar gyi lha'i ris gang yang rung bar mngon par sangs rgyas nas 'dir mngon par byang chub la sogs pa ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / de ni tshangs ris nas brtsams te 'og min gyi bar gyi lha'i ris gang yang rung bar mngon par sangs rgyas nas 'dir mngon par byang chub la sogs pa ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is born in any of the celestial realms, from the Brahmakayika gods up to the Akanistha gods, and then manifests perfect enlightenment and so on here in this world.🔽Those who attain nirvana after birth are mentioned in the sutras:

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni// sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag dang po sems bskyed pa nyid kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya zhing zhes bya ba nas /🔽de dag yongs mya ngan las 'das nas dam pa'i chos bskal pa'am /
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni// sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag dang po sems bskyed pa nyid kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya zhing zhes bya ba nas / de dag yongs mya ngan las 'das nas dam pa'i chos bskal pa'am /
translated: “Shariputra, there are bodhisattvas who, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment, are irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bskal pa las lhag par @35b gnas pa dang yod ces gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bskal pa las lhag par @35b gnas pa dang yod ces gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: They attain nirvana after birth, and the holy Dharma remains for an eon or more than an eon.

original: de ni mngon par brtson pas lam la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mngon par brtson pas lam la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are those who enter the path through great effort.

original: mngon par 'du byas pas mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byas pas mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
translated: Those who attain nirvana through application are mentioned in the sutras:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa gang dag 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'dong zhing de dag sems can rnams kyi don la rtag tu btson te zhes bya ba nas bskal pa grangs med tshad
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa gang dag 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'dong zhing de dag sems can rnams kyi don la rtag tu btson te zhes bya ba nas bskal pa grangs med tshad
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who practice the six perfections and go from world system to world system, always striving for the welfare of sentient beings, and so on up to:

original: med pa rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do zhes bya ba'i bar gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do zhes bya ba'i bar gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood in incalculable, immeasurable eons.

original: de ni mngon par brtson pas lam la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mngon par brtson pas lam la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they enter the path through striving.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni //
translated: Nirvāṇa without exertion is as follows:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag dang po sems bskyed pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa las 'da' zhing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag dang po sems bskyed pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa las 'da' zhing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Śāriputra, there are bodhisattvas who, from the very first arousal of the mind, transcend the bodhisattva stage of faultlessness, and so on up to:

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dang gzhan du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dang gzhan du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do //
translated: There are others who attain supreme awakening in other buddha-fields.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par lam du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par lam du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they enter the path without exertion.

original: gong du 'pho ba ni lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ni lnga pa yin te /
translated: The fifth is the one who goes upstream.

original: gang zhig gong du 'gro'i //
analyzed: gang zhig gong du 'gro'i //
translated: He goes upstream.

original: gang du skyes pa de nyid du ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: gang du skyes pa de nyid du ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba ste /
translated: He does not attain nirvana in that very rebirth.🔽Going means going to the summit of existence.

original: 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to// de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'og min gyi mthar thug pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to// de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'og min gyi mthar thug pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: That is of two kinds: going to the peak of non-pervasion and going to the peak of existence.

original: de la 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ni //
analyzed: de la 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba ni //
translated: Among them, going to the peak of non-pervasion is as follows:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa gang dag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur nas sems can rnams la bde ba'i yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub cing zas 'dod pa rnams la zas zhes bya ba nas btsams
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa gang dag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur nas sems can rnams la bde ba'i yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub cing zas 'dod pa rnams la zas zhes bya ba nas btsams
translated: Śāriputra, those bodhisattvas who practice the six perfections and become universal monarchs who provide all the necessities of happiness to sentient beings, giving food to those who want food,🔽and so on up to giving servants to those who want servants,

original: te / sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bzhag nas tshang ris kyi lha rnams nas 'og min gyi bar du skyes te /
analyzed: te / sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bzhag nas tshang ris kyi lha rnams nas 'og min gyi bar du skyes te /
translated: and who establish sentient beings in the ten virtuous actions and then are born among the Śuddhāvāsa class of gods up to Akaniṣṭha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du gang @36a * //🔽gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du gang @36a * // gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and who fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in various buddhafields.

original: 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i gong du 'gro ba gang yin pa 'di ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i gong du 'gro ba gang yin pa 'di ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: This going higher that goes up to Akaniṣṭha becomes three types.

original: 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba'o //🔽de la 'phar ba zhes pa ni bsam gtan gsum las yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa de bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te tshangs ris su skyes nas sngar goms pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan bzhi pa dang spel te de las shi 'phos nas 'og min gyi lha
analyzed: 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dang gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba'o // de la 'phar ba zhes pa ni bsam gtan gsum las yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa de bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te tshangs ris su skyes nas sngar goms pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan bzhi pa dang spel te de las shi 'phos nas 'og min gyi lha
translated: They are those who leap over, those who leap over half, and those who die in all abodes.🔽Those who leap over are those who fully degenerate from the three absorptions, who then establish the first absorption and are born in Brahmakayika.🔽Through the power of former training, they cultivate the fourth absorption and increase it.

original: rnams su skye ba ste /
analyzed: rnams su skye ba ste /
translated: They die from there and are born among the Akanistha gods.

original: de ni bar ma dor ba yin pas na 'phar ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni bar ma dor ba yin pas na 'phar ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Since they are intermediate beings, they are called leapers.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po gang dag bsam gtan bzhi rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po gang dag bsam gtan bzhi rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: “Śāriputra, those great bodhisattvas who complete the four absorptions

original: bsam gtan las yongs su nyams nas bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te tshangs ris kyi lha rnams su skye zhing de dag yang bsam gtan bsgrubs nas 'og min gyi lha rnams su skyes te sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su bla na med pa yang dag🔽par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan las yongs su nyams nas bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te tshangs ris kyi lha rnams su skye zhing de dag yang bsam gtan bsgrubs nas 'og min gyi lha rnams su skyes te sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dag yod do zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They fully degenerate from meditative attainment and accomplish the first absorption, taking rebirth as Brahmakayika gods. They again accomplish the absorptions and take rebirth as Akanistha gods and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood in various buddha realms.

original: phyed du 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni gang dag tshangs ris nas shi 'phos te gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes nas bar gyi gnas gzhan gcig las kyang brgal te 'og min du skyes nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su zhes bya ba la sogs🔽pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyed du 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni gang dag tshangs ris nas shi 'phos te gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes nas bar gyi gnas gzhan gcig las kyang brgal te 'og min du skyes nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs pa rnams su zhes bya ba la sogs🔽pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those who rise to the middle are those who die from Brahmakayika and are reborn in the Suddhavasa realms, then they rise to Akanistha, bypassing one intermediate stage, and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood in various buddha realms.

original: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gnas gzhan thams cad du brgyus nas 'og min du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gnas gzhan thams cad du brgyus nas 'og min du 'jug pa ste /
translated: Transference to all abodes refers to one who transmigrates to all other abodes and enters Akaniṣṭha.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As the sutra states:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po gang dag dga' ldan gyi gnas sbyangs nas tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du skyes te thabs mkhas pas dmyal ba pa dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang ; gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston par byed pa dag phyogs bcu rnams su sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po gang dag dga' ldan gyi gnas sbyangs nas tshangs ris nas 'og min gyi bar du skyes te thabs mkhas pas dmyal ba pa dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang ; gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams la chos ston par byed pa dag phyogs bcu rnams su sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang /
translated: Śāriputra, those great bodhisattvas who train in the abode of Tuṣita and are born in Brahmakāyika and so on up to Akaniṣṭha, through skill in means teach the Dharma to sentient beings in the hells, animal worlds and worlds of Yama and they go from buddhafield to buddhafield in the ten directions, serving the lord buddhas,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin @36b par byed pa dang / bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyang yongs su sgrub cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin @36b par byed pa dang / bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyang yongs su sgrub cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: they bring sentient beings to full maturity and they establish unsurpassed buddhafields.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par gzhan rnams sgrub par byed cing gnas gzhan thams cad du skyes nas gnas gtsang mar ma zhugs pa kho nar gzugs med par rim gyis skye bas srid pa'i rtse mor song nas sangs

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa 'di dag gang la yod pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa 'di dag gang la yod pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin par shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Śāriputra, you should know that this is the irreversible bodhisattva who possesses the realizations of the qualities of the buddhas.

original: rtogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two bases for all the qualities of realization:

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong ba dang dge ba'i chos rnams kyang yang dag par len pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong ba dang dge ba'i chos rnams kyang yang dag par len pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of nonvirtuous phenomena and the taking up of virtuous phenomena.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' @38b chen pos lus dang ngag dang yid kyi lus kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i go skabs dbye bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' @38b chen pos lus dang ngag dang yid kyi lus kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i go skabs dbye bar mi bya zhing /
translated: Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not open the door to the reproachable in body, speech, and mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam par dag pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽phir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo las kyang byang chub sems dpa' dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam par dag pa la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // phir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo las kyang byang chub sems dpa' dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba nas brtsams te /
translated: He should train in the pure actions of body, speech, and mind.🔽In the Sūtra of the Wheel of Non-returning, the Bhagavān himself taught the very contradictory meaning of the classifications of persons, beginning with the bodhisattva who follows faith,🔽up to the bodhisattva pratyekabuddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ches 'gal bar bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs pa yin pas der blta bar bya'i /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ches 'gal bar bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs pa yin pas der blta bar bya'i /
translated: Therefore, that should be consulted.

original: 'di ni kho bo cag gis nye bar dgod par ma byas te /
analyzed: 'di ni kho bo cag gis nye bar dgod par ma byas te /
translated: We have not set it forth here.

original: btags zin pa 'thag pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: btags zin pa 'thag pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of weaving what has already been woven?

original: dkon mchog gsum la gdams pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la gdams pa bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the instruction on the Three Jewels.

original: // / ma zhen pa la gdams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: // / ma zhen pa la gdams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to the instruction on non-attachment, it says:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Bhagavan, the physical activity of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva that is accompanied by a sense of shame and...🔽...up to...

original: lus la sogs pa mi dmigs pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i sems ma bskyed pas lus la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam nyid yin par gsungs so ;
analyzed: lus la sogs pa mi dmigs pas pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i sems ma bskyed pas lus la sogs pa mi dmigs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam nyid yin par gsungs so ;
translated: ...the non-apprehension of the body and so forth is the bodhisattva's path itself.

original: / yongs su mi ngal ba la gdams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: / yongs su mi ngal ba la gdams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the instruction on being indefatigable, it says:

original: gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la rlom sems med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la rlom sems med pa ste /
translated: The absence of conceit regarding form, and the absence of conceit regarding feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, up to the absence of conceit regarding complete perfect enlightenment.

original: de ltar spyod na smad par 'gyur ba'i lus yongs su zin par mi 'gyur te zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar spyod na smad par 'gyur ba'i lus yongs su zin par mi 'gyur te zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: If one practices in that way, one does not grasp a body that is despised.

original: rlom sems par gyur na yongs su skyo bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlom sems par gyur na yongs su skyo bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if one becomes conceited, one becomes completely weary.🔽With regard to the instruction on fully grasping the path,

original: lam yongs su zin pa la gdams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: lam yongs su zin pa la gdams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: the sutra says:🔽“Śāriputra, a bodhisattva great being who has the following knowledge sees tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas equal to the sands of the Ganges river in world systems to the east equal to the sands of the Ganges river.🔽He hears the teachings of those buddhas and🔽he sees the bodhisattvas in those buddha fields.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po ye shes gang dang ldan pas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag kyang🔽mthong ngo // de rnams las chos bstan pa yang nyan thos to //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po ye shes gang dang ldan pas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag kyang mthong ngo // de rnams las chos bstan pa yang nyan thos to //
translated: He sees the world systems, the arrangement of the world systems, the formation of the world systems, the destruction of the world systems, and the arrangement of the world systems after their destruction.

original: bzhin du lho dang nub dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //🔽de la ma zhen pas ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin du lho dang nub dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //🔽de la ma zhen pas ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He sees the various forms of life, the various forms of birth, the various forms of happiness

original: ming la bas ni bgrod par bya ba ji srid par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming la bas ni bgrod par bya ba ji srid par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One goes as far as one wants to go by means of the name.

original: ye shes yongs su gzung bas ni lam gzhan du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes yongs su gzung bas ni lam gzhan du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not go by another path by means of the retention of knowledge.

original: spyan lnga la gdams pa la /
analyzed: spyan lnga la gdams pa la /
translated: The five eyes are taught.

original: sha'i spyan gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sha'i spyan gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the flesh eye,

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig gis dpag tshad brgya mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig gis dpag tshad brgya mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: it is said, “Śāriputra, there are great bodhisattvas who see with their flesh eye for a hundred leagues.”

original: gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said, “There are those who see the world systems of a billion-world universe.”

original: de ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba nyid kyis yul so sor nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba nyid kyis yul so sor nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: That is because it is restricted to its own object by being a maturational result.

original: sha'i mig ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'i yul can yin la /
analyzed: sha'i mig ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'i yul can yin la /
translated: The flesh eye has an object that is a dominant result.

original: de yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is included in the world systems of a billion-world universe.

original: lha'i spyan ni /
analyzed: lha'i spyan ni /
translated: With regard to the divine eye,

original: sh'a ri'i bu rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris nas 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes kyi /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris nas 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes kyi /
translated: Sariputra, the divine eye of the gods from the Heaven of the Four Great Kings up to the Highest Heaven is known by the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris nas 'og min gyi lha rnams kyis mi shes so zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris nas 'og min gyi lha rnams kyis mi shes so zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: But the divine eye of the bodhisattva-mahasattva is not known by the gods from the Heaven of the Four Great Kings up to the Highest Heaven.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig gi yul ni phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig gi yul ni phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of the bodhisattva's divine eye is the death and rebirth of all sentient beings in the ten directions.

original: shes rab kyi spyan ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi mig gang dang ldan pas 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas kyi chos ci yang mi shes pa med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyan ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi mig gang dang ldan pas 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas kyi chos ci yang mi shes pa med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: As for the eye of wisdom, it is as stated: The eye of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahasattva, possessing which he does not know any conditioned or unconditioned phenomena.

original: shes rab kyi spyan ni chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyan ni chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye of wisdom is free from conceptualization with regard to all phenomena.

original: chos kyi spyan ni /
analyzed: chos kyi spyan ni /
translated: The Dharma eye is as follows:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig gis gang zag 'di ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig gis gang zag 'di ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: Śāriputra, the Dharma eye of a great bodhisattva sees that this person is a follower of faith,

original: gang zag 'di ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: this person is a follower of the Dharma,

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and so on up to

original: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs @39b rgyas kyi bar du phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs @39b rgyas kyi bar du phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: this person will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos kyi spyan gyi yul ni 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi spyan gyi yul ni 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the Dharma eye is the realization of all noble persons.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to the eye of a buddha, it is said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po sems bskyed pa'i rjes la rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag nas sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa gang yin pa
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po sems bskyed pa'i rjes la rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag nas sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa gang yin pa
translated: Śāriputra, after a bodhisattva great being has given rise to the mind, they rest in equipoise in the vajra-like meditative stabilization and with the wisdom that is possessed of a single instant they cause the knowledge of all aspects to be attained.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyi yul ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyi yul ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The domain of the eye of a buddha is the complete and true enlightenment with respect to all aspects of all phenomena.

original: spyan lnga la gdams pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: spyan lnga la gdams pa bshad zin to /
translated: The instruction on the five eyes has been explained.🔽The instruction on the six superknowledges.

original: // / mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa las rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: // / mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa las rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With respect to the superknowledge of magical power, it says,

original: de ni sa chen po 'di yang rab tu g-yo bar byed do //
analyzed: de ni sa chen po 'di yang rab tu g-yo bar byed do //
translated: “They cause this great earth to quake.”

original: gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They become one and then become many.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the supernormal power of transformation is the knowledge that accomplishes the superknowledge of the supernormal power of transformation.

original: lha'i rna ba ni de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas lha dang mi gnyis ka'i sgra thos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni des sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba ni de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas lha dang mi gnyis ka'i sgra thos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no // gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni des sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the divine ear is the knowledge that, by means of the divine ear element, which is purified and surpasses the human, hears both kinds of sounds, the divine and the human, those that are natural and those that are produced.🔽The knowledge of the minds of others is the knowledge that, as it truly is, understands the minds of other beings and persons, which are possessed of passion, free from passion, and so on, as they truly are.🔽The knowledge of the recollection of former lives is the knowledge that, as it truly is, recollects one’s own and others’ former existences, births, and so on, as they truly are.

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the termination of the outflows is the knowledge that, as it truly is, understands the termination of the outflows, and so on, as they truly are.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pas skye ba gcig kyang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pas skye ba gcig kyang rjes su dran no //
translated: The superknowledge of the recollection of past lives is the recollection of one’s own past lives, such as one birth,

original: skye ba brgya'i par du yang rjes su dran no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa ni de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can gyi 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ji lta ba bzhin @40a * //
analyzed: skye ba brgya'i par du yang rjes su dran no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no // lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa ni de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sems can gyi 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ji lta ba bzhin @40a * //
translated: or up to a hundred thousand births.

original: du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: du rab tu shes te /
translated: The superknowledge of the divine eye is the knowledge of the deaths and rebirths of sentient beings by means of the divine eye that is purified and surpasses the human.

original: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi ngan du spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is the knowledge of the deaths and rebirths of sentient beings, such as, “These sentient beings are of bad bodily,🔽verbal, and mental conduct.”

original: mig 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mig 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference between these two eyes is as follows.

original: spyan ldas bsdus pa'i lha'i spyan gang yin pa ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba 'di yin la /
analyzed: spyan ldas bsdus pa'i lha'i spyan gang yin pa ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba 'di yin la /
translated: The divine eye that is included in the eye faculty is the divine eye that arises from karmic ripening.

original: mngon par shes pas bsdus pa 'di ni bsam gtan mngon par 'dus byas pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pas bsdus pa 'di ni bsam gtan mngon par 'dus byas pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: This one included in the superknowledges arises from the cultivation of the dhyānas.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the superknowledge of the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities,

original: skye ba mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrubs kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrubs kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ngo //
translated: he accomplishes the knowledge of the superknowledge of the manifestation of birth, but he does not fall into the level of the śrāvaka or the level of the pratyekabuddha.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rab tu ldan pa'i yid la byed pa nyid kyis de la dmigs pa'i slo ma sems thams cad bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rab tu ldan pa'i yid la byed pa nyid kyis de la dmigs pa'i slo ma sems thams cad bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, because of the mental attention associated with the knowledge of all modes, he stops all the other thoughts which have that as their object.

original: yang rgyu ci'i phyir mngon par shes pa la gdams par mdzad snyam na /
analyzed: yang rgyu ci'i phyir mngon par shes pa la gdams par mdzad snyam na /
translated: Why is he instructed in the superknowledges?

original: sh'a ri'i bu mngon par shes pa yongs su dag pas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gtong par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas skabs re re zhing mngon par shes pas yongs su zin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam sbyong bar byed pa nyid yin pas dang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu mngon par shes pa yongs su dag pas ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gtong par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas skabs re re zhing mngon par shes pas yongs su zin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam sbyong bar byed pa nyid yin pas dang /
translated: And, in each stage of the perfections, being supported by superknowledge, one trains in the path to omniscience.

original: sbyin pa na /
analyzed: sbyin pa na /
translated: When one gives,

original: byin gnyen po'i phyogs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal ba'i don du rab tu bzhag pa yin pas dang / de lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yon tan thams cad 'thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byin gnyen po'i phyogs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal ba'i don du rab tu bzhag pa yin pas dang / de lta bu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yon tan thams cad 'thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: the antidote is established for the sake of eliminating the opposing side, and thus such perfection of wisdom is the cause for attaining all good qualities.

original: mngon par shes pa'i phan yon gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i phan yon gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the benefits of superknowledge,

original: sems can rnams chos mnyam pa nyid la rab tu dgod pa dang / 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad byams pa nyid dang ; yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po dang phrad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni lha'i ris thams cad kyis phyag bya bar 'os pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams chos mnyam pa nyid la rab tu dgod pa dang / 'phags pa'i skye bo thams cad byams pa nyid dang ; yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po dang phrad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni lha'i ris thams cad kyis phyag bya bar 'os pa nyid dang /
translated: It is to establish all beings in the sameness of phenomena. It is to be loved by all noble beings. It is to encounter pleasant objects. It is to be worthy of homage by all the gods.

original: kun dga' bo dge slong sum brgya po 'di rnams zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong sum brgya po 'di rnams zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Ānanda, these three hundred monks, starting from here,

original: dge slong mang po zhig @40b sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa dang / phyogs bcu re re zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar mdzad pa'i ljags kyi dbang po bkram pa'i mtshan mas yang dag par bskul ba 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang ldan pa'i tshogs
analyzed: dge slong mang po zhig @40b sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa dang / phyogs bcu re re zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar mdzad pa'i ljags kyi dbang po bkram pa'i mtshan mas yang dag par bskul ba 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang ldan pa'i tshogs
translated: have been prophesied to become buddhas, and the assembly of bodhisattvas who have come from other world systems have been inspired by the sign of the tongue that illuminates world systems equal to the sands of the Ganges in each of the ten directions.

original: thams cad dang bcas pa lung bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad dang bcas pa lung bstan pa ni /
translated: The prophecy of the assembly of bodhisattvas who have come from other world systems is as follows:

original: de'i dus su bstan pa'i gdams ngag gi 'bras bu dus gzhan du thob par bstan pa'i don gyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dus su bstan pa'i gdams ngag gi 'bras bu dus gzhan du thob par bstan pa'i don gyis gsungs pa yin no //
