translated: The meaning of the statement is that the result of the instruction of the teaching is obtained at another time.

original: mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa bshad zin to /
translated: The instruction in the six superknowledges has been explained.

original: // / mthong ba'i lam la gdams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: // / mthong ba'i lam la gdams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the instruction in the path of seeing,🔽it says in the sutra:

original: rab 'byor khyod byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te spobs pa skyed cig ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsams te spobs pa skyed cig ces bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, you should generate eloquence with respect to the perfection of wisdom for the great bodhisattvas.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs kyis ston pa yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs kyis ston pa yin te /
translated: Shariputra, this is the way the Tathagata himself teaches the perfection of wisdom to the great bodhisattvas through skillful means.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the perfection of wisdom is not the domain of all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi kha nas ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi kha nas ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why does the Lord teach through the mouths of others?

original: gzhan dag kyang don de thog par mdzad spyod pa nyid kyis na bdag nyid la gzung bar 'os pa ma yin pa nyid kyis nyes pa spang bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang don de thog par mdzad spyod pa nyid kyis na bdag nyid la gzung bar 'os pa ma yin pa nyid kyis nyes pa spang bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to avoid the fault of being considered by others to be a teacher who is not to be trusted, because he is a teacher who is not independent.

original: ci'i phyir nyan thos kyi kha nas ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyan thos kyi kha nas ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why does he teach through the mouths of the disciples?

original: byin gyis brlabs pa la mnga' brnyes pa shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa la mnga' brnyes pa shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to show that he has attained mastery over the consecration of the disciples.

original: ci'i phyir gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi kha nyid nas ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi kha nyid nas ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why does he teach through the mouth of the elder Subhuti?

original: de ni nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa'i mchog tu gyur pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i skal ba mnyam pa lhag pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam dang rjes su mthun pa'i stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa'i mchog tu gyur pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i skal ba mnyam pa lhag pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam dang rjes su mthun pa'i stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the foremost of those who dwell in the absence of the afflictions, and because he is the foremost of those who are free from the afflictions, and because he is the foremost of those who are in accord with the path of seeing.

original: de ltar byas na tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor legs so legs so //
analyzed: de ltar byas na tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor legs so legs so //
translated: Well said, well said, venerable Subhuti!

original: nyan thos nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te bstan pa 'di yang de'i tshul dang 'dra'o zhes @41a * //
analyzed: nyan thos nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te bstan pa 'di yang de'i tshul dang 'dra'o zhes @41a * //
translated: The Lord has said that the Sravaka who abides in the absence of defilement is the best, and this teaching is similar to that.

original: 'og nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'og nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated below.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug las sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug las sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With regard to the path of seeing, which has sixteen moments, it is said with reference to the moment of the receptivity to the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering:

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de'i ming du bya ba de dag ni btags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de'i ming du bya ba de dag ni btags pa tsam mo //
translated: the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, and the designation of that are mere designations.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:

original: sems can sems can zhes bya bar ming du btags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: sems can sems can zhes bya bar ming du btags pa tsam ste /
translated: sentient beings, sentient beings, is merely a designation.

original: btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: For a phenomenon that is a mere designation, apart from being a conventional designation by name and symbol, there is no arising or cessation.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma rtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med do zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma rtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med do zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering is the production of the knowledge that does not understand the mere name and symbol of any designated factor, saying: “It is not produced or stopped.”

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of the subsequent with regard to suffering is🔽Subhūti, the great bodhisattva practicing the perfection of wisdom does not see form as permanent or impermanent, and so on up to: does not see saṃsāra or nirvāṇa

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas 'khor ba zhes bya ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa🔽zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas 'khor ba zhes bya ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: as existent or nonexistent.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the subsequent with regard to suffering is

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po de ni chos de dag thams cad la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po de ni chos de dag thams cad la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is because that bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not conceptualize or discriminate any of those phenomena.

original: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: The acceptance of the knowledge of phenomena with regard to the origin is:

original: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa yin te /
translated: That thorough understanding of the characteristics of phenomena by that one who practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽kun 'byung la chos shes pa ni des ming dang brda las byung ba'i chos btags par khong du chud pas gzugs la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin no // kun 'byung la chos shes pa ni des ming dang brda las byung ba'i chos btags par khong du chud pas gzugs la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: The characteristics of phenomena are neither defiled nor purified.🔽The knowledge of phenomena with regard to the origin is: That non-fixation on form,

original: tshor ba la mngon par zhes par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang @41b gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la mngon par zhes par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang @41b gsungs pa yin no //
translated: non-fixation on feeling, and so forth, by that one who has understood that phenomena are imputed from names and symbols.

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: The forbearance of subsequent knowledge with regard to the truth of origination is the non-adherence to the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang zhes bya ba nas thabs la mkhas pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang zhes bya ba nas thabs la mkhas pa la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: It is also the non-adherence to the perfection of morality, and so on up to the non-adherence to the skill in means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar gang mngon par zhen pa'am gang gis mngon par zhen pa 'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar gang mngon par zhen pa'am gang gis mngon par zhen pa 'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because those dharmas which would adhere, by which one would adhere,

original: gang la mngon par zhen pa'i chos de rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //🔽kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni de ltar spyod pa de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la yang dag par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs
analyzed: gang la mngon par zhen pa'i chos de rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no // kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa ni de ltar spyod pa de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la yang dag par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs
translated: and to which one would adhere do not exist.

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: The subsequent knowledge with regard to the truth of origination is the increase of that practice through the perfection of generosity, and so on up to the entry into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni de ltar spyod pa de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa non par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni de ltar spyod pa de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa non par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The forbearance of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to cessation is the statement, “Thus, that practice is the stage of irreversibility.”

original: de byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That should be known as the eighth bodhisattva stage.

original: 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'gog pa la chos shes pa ni de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: The knowledge of the dharma with regard to cessation is the statement, “Thus, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like that perfects the superknowledges.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la mchod pa dang / de dag gi thad du 'gro ba dang de dag las chos kyang thos par 'gyur te zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la mchod pa dang / de dag gi thad du 'gro ba dang de dag las chos kyang thos par 'gyur te zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He makes offerings to those lord buddhas, he goes into their presence, and he hears the Dharma from them.”

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: The forbearance of the subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation is the statement, “Subhūti, what do you think?🔽Is the so-called bodhisattva the form?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang brjod pa de gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes gang brjod pa de gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is it something other than form?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam /🔽gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam / gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the bodhisattva exists in form?🔽Do you think that form exists in the bodhisattva?

original: gzugs med pa byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the bodhisattva exists in the absence of form?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rnam grangs gzhan las mi len pas na gzugs la sogs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa'i dngos po yin pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan las mi len pas na gzugs la sogs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa'i dngos po yin pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not accepted in another enumeration, form and so on are refuted as being the entity of the bodhisattva.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam @42a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam @42a * //
translated: Regarding subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation, Subhūti, what do you think?

original: du sems / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: du sems / gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that the suchness of form is the bodhisattva?

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that something other than the suchness of form is the bodhisattva?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is as stated in the previous passage.

original: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Regarding perseverance for knowledge of the dharma of the truth of the path, Subhūti, what do you think?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di gzugs kyi tshig bla dgas yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di gzugs kyi tshig bla dgas yin snyam mam /
translated: Is the word bodhisattva a designation for form?

original: de bzhin du gzugs rtag pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / gzugs bde ba nyid dang / gzugs sdug bsngal ba nyid dang zhes bya ba nas byang chub dpa' zhes bya ba 'di gzugs smon pa nyid dang gzugs smon pa med pa nyid kyi tshig bla dgas yin snyam mam zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs rtag pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / gzugs bde ba nyid dang / gzugs sdug bsngal ba nyid dang zhes bya ba nas byang chub dpa' zhes bya ba 'di gzugs smon pa nyid dang gzugs smon pa med pa nyid kyi tshig bla dgas yin snyam mam zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, is the word bodhisattva a designation for form as permanent or impermanent, as blissful or not blissful, as a self or not a self, as empty or not empty, as with signs or signless, as having wishes or wishless, as compounded or uncompounded, as arising or ceasing, as being polluted or purified, as deficient or complete?

original: lam la chos shes pa ni rab 'byor chos kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa ni rab 'byor chos kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The knowledge of dharmas with regard to the path is as follows: Subhuti, the Dharma does not see the Dharma-element.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma-element does not see the Dharma.

original: de la dang po ni sgrub pa'i chos te lam mo //
analyzed: de la dang po ni sgrub pa'i chos te lam mo //
translated: Here, the first is the Dharma of practice, which is the path.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu'i chos te mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu'i chos te mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The second is the Dharma of the result, which is nirvana.

original: de gnyis kyang gcig gis gcig mthong ba bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang gcig gis gcig mthong ba bkag pa yin te /
translated: Also, it is the seeing of one by the other that is refuted,

original: rang bzhin gyis bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are intrinsically inanimate.🔽The forbearance of subsequent knowledge with regard to the truth of the path is as follows:

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni rab 'byor gzugs kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni rab 'byor gzugs kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhuti, the realm of form does not see the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis gzugs kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis gzugs kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The realm of phenomena does not see the realm of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba'i dbyings dang chos kyi dbyings nas rnam par shes pa'i dbyings dang chos kyi dbyings dag gi bar dang / de bzhin du mig gi dbyings dang chos kyi dbyings nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba'i dbyings dang chos kyi dbyings nas rnam par shes pa'i dbyings dang chos kyi dbyings dag gi bar dang / de bzhin du mig gi dbyings dang chos kyi dbyings nas /
translated: Similarly, the realm of feeling and the realm of phenomena, up to the realm of consciousness and the realm of phenomena, and similarly, the realm of the eyes and the realm of phenomena,

original: yid kyi dbyings dang chos kyi dbyings dag phan tshun mthong ba bkag pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi dbyings dang chos kyi dbyings dag phan tshun mthong ba bkag pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to the realm of the mental faculty and the realm of phenomena, the seeing of one by the other is refuted.

original: snga ma ni sgrub pa'i mdor bsdus pa brjod par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: snga ma ni sgrub pa'i mdor bsdus pa brjod par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: The former is stated in order to summarize the practice.

original: da lta ni so so ba yin no //
analyzed: da lta ni so so ba yin no //
translated: Now, they are individual.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni rab 'byor 'dus byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni rab 'byor 'dus byas kyi dbyings kyis 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhuti, the unconditioned realm does not see the conditioned realm.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi dbyings kyis @42b 'dus byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi dbyings kyis @42b 'dus byas kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The conditioned realm does not see the unconditioned realm.

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par bshad pa dag gcig gis gcig mthong ba dag bkag pa lam la rjes su shes pa 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid kyi yul can du ston🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par bshad pa dag gcig gis gcig mthong ba dag bkag pa lam la rjes su shes pa 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid kyi yul can du ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the conditioned and unconditioned realms, which are explained as samsara and nirvana, are negated as seeing each other. This is taught to be the subject, the equality of samsara and nirvana, which is subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gdams pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gdams pa bshad zin to /
translated: The instruction on the path of seeing has been explained.

original: // / sgom pa'i lam la gdams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: // / sgom pa'i lam la gdams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the instruction on the path of meditation,

original: rab 'byor 'dus byas kyi dbyings med par 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'dus byas kyi dbyings med par 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings gdags par mi nus so //
translated: Subhuti, the unconditioned realm cannot be designated in the absence of the conditioned realm.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings med par yang 'dus byas kyi dbyings gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings med par yang 'dus byas kyi dbyings gdags par mi nus so //
translated: And without the unconditioned realm, the conditioned realm cannot be designated.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: de la 'dus byas ni lam mo //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas ni lam mo //
translated: Here, the conditioned is the path.

original: 'dus ma byas ni spangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni spangs pa ste /
translated: The unconditioned is the abandonment.

original: de gnyis phan tshun tha dad par gdags par mi nus pa nyid kyis na sgom pa'i lam rnam par gzhag pa ni btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun tha dad par gdags par mi nus pa nyid kyis na sgom pa'i lam rnam par gzhag pa ni btags pa yin gyi /
translated: Since those two cannot be designated as mutually distinct, the presentation of the path of cultivation is a designation.

original: mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the actual path,

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i dngos po la mngon par phyogs par byed pas dngos po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i dngos po la mngon par phyogs par byed pas dngos po tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: because the entities that are the objects of engagement are not distinct, as they are seen.

original: de ltar byas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa gang yin pa mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs pa gang yin pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rten gang yin pa skyabs gsum dang / khyad par du 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa ma chags pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar byas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa gang yin pa mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs pa gang yin pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rten gang yin pa skyabs gsum dang / khyad par du 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa ma chags pa dang /
translated: When this is done, the perfection of wisdom is the aspect of non-apprehension that is the practice, the four noble truths are the objects of apprehension, the three refuges are the basis, and non-attachment is the cause of progress.

original: mi ldog par 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa yongs su mi ngal ba dang / theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa lam yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gro pa'i rgyu gang yin pa spyan lnga dang /
analyzed: mi ldog par 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa yongs su mi ngal ba dang / theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba'i rgyu gang yin pa lam yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gro pa'i rgyu gang yin pa spyan lnga dang /
translated: The basis of instruction is all the causes of irreversibility, the causes of not going by another vehicle, the causes of not going by another path, the causes of going without relying on another, the causes of the five eyes,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa mngon par shes pa drug dang / sgrub pa mthar thug pa'i rgyu gang yin pa mthong pa dang sgom pa'i lam dag ste de dag thams cad gdams ngag gi gnas su bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa mngon par shes pa drug dang / sgrub pa mthar thug pa'i rgyu gang yin pa mthong pa dang sgom pa'i lam dag ste de dag thams cad gdams ngag gi gnas su bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: the causes of the six clairvoyances, the causes of the perfection of omniscience, and the causes of the culmination of practice, which are the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: de nas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gdams pa ste /
analyzed: de nas 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gdams pa ste /
translated: Then, this is the instruction in the perfection of wisdom for a great bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni rjes su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rjes su bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: zhes gsungs pa @43a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa @43a * //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: yin no // gdams ngag bshad zin to /
analyzed: yin no // gdams ngag bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of instruction is finished.

original: // / nges par 'byed pa'i cha ngang mthun pa rnams brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / nges par 'byed pa'i cha ngang mthun pa rnams brjod par bya'o //
translated: The factors that contribute to enlightenment should be mentioned.

original: 'di dag la brjod par bya ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di dag la brjod par bya ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is there to say about them?🔽Four kinds of superiority are to be mentioned, in comparison with the disciples and others.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par rnam pa bzhi brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par rnam pa bzhi brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: The superiority of objective support, the superiority of aspects, the superiority of cause, and the superiority of possession.🔽The superiority of objective support is to be understood as the objective support of the path of vision, which is the four investigations and the four authentic realizations.🔽The superiority of aspects is to be understood as the sixteen aspects of the four noble truths.🔽The superiority of cause is to be understood as the four forms of correct abandonment.🔽The superiority of possession is to be understood as the four bases of supernormal power.🔽The four investigations and the four authentic realizations are the objective support of the path of vision.🔽The four investigations are:🔽the investigation of meaning,🔽the investigation of the teaching,🔽the investigation of phenomena, and🔽the investigation of the investigation itself.🔽The four authentic realizations are:🔽the authentic realization of meaning,🔽the authentic realization of the teaching,🔽the authentic realization of phenomena, and

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par dang / rnam pa'i khyad par dang / rgyu'i khyad par dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par dang / rnam pa'i khyad par dang / rgyu'i khyad par dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: the authentic realization of the authentic realization itself.🔽The four investigations are the objective support of the path of vision.🔽The four authentic realizations are the objective support of the path of cultivation.🔽The sixteen aspects of the four noble truths are the aspects of the path of vision.🔽The four forms of correct abandonment are the cause of the path of vision.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa mthong pa'i lam gyi spang bar bya ba bzhi rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag par lhag pa yang brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa mthong pa'i lam gyi spang bar bya ba bzhi rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag par lhag pa yang brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: The four bases of supernormal power are the cause of the path of cultivation.🔽The four bases of supernormal power are the possession of the path of cultivation.🔽The four investigations and the four authentic realizations are the objective support of the path of vision.🔽The four investigations are:🔽the investigation of meaning,🔽the investigation of the teaching,🔽the investigation of phenomena, and

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gang la rnam par rtog pa gang rnam par gzhan par bya ba dang / 'di dag gi chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye ba yang so sor brjod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gang la rnam par rtog pa gang rnam par gzhan par bya ba dang / 'di dag gi chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye ba yang so sor brjod dgos so zhe na /
translated: the investigation of the investigation itself.🔽The four authentic realizations are:🔽the authentic realization of meaning,🔽the authentic realization of the teaching,🔽the authentic realization of phenomena, and🔽the authentic realization of the authentic realization itself.🔽The four investigations are the objective support of the path of vision.🔽The four authentic realizations are the objective support of the path of cultivation.🔽The sixteen aspects of the four noble truths are the aspects of the path of vision.🔽The four forms of correct abandonment are the cause of the path of vision.🔽The four bases of supernormal power are the cause of the path

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di nye bar bkod de ;
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po 'di nye bar bkod de ;
translated: Therefore, these two verses are presented:

original: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa yis //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa yis //
translated: By object, aspect, cause, and complete acceptance,

original: byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yi //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yi //
translated: the bodhisattva🔽is superior to the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: drod sogs bdag nyid ji bzhin du //
analyzed: drod sogs bdag nyid ji bzhin du //
translated: Like heat and so on in the production of a vase,

original: rnam rtog bzhi po ldan bsten pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog bzhi po ldan bsten pa //
translated: the bodhisattva

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
translated: is superior to the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽The bodhisattva

original: nyan thos bse ru lta bu dang / bcas pa dag las khyad par 'phags //🔽zhes bya ba'o //🔽de ltar gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i thos pa dang bsam pa goms pas dag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba phul du phyin pa thob pa las dro bar gyur pa zhes bya
analyzed: nyan thos bse ru lta bu dang / bcas pa dag las khyad par 'phags // zhes bya ba'o // de ltar gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i thos pa dang bsam pa goms pas dag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba phul du phyin pa thob pa las dro bar gyur pa zhes bya
translated: is superior to the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ba las byung ba nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ste /
analyzed: ba las byung ba nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ste /
translated: Thus, through the practice of instructions and follow up teachings, by cultivating listening and contemplation, one obtains the highest roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation, such as those that are pure and so on. From that, the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrative insight arise.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i me'i sngon du 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dro bar gyur pa dang 'dra bas dro bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i me'i sngon du 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dro bar gyur pa dang 'dra bas dro bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the nature that precedes the fire of non-discrimination, it is like heat, thus it is heat.

original: de las ni rtse mor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de las ni rtse mor gyur pa'o //
translated: From that, there is the peak.

original: de las ni bzod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de las ni bzod par gyur pa'o //
translated: From that, there is acceptance.

original: de las ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: de las ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog go //
translated: From that, there is the supreme mundane state.

original: gang gi phyir dro bar gyur pa chung du'i dbang du mdzad nas dmigs pa'i khyad par ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dro bar gyur pa chung du'i dbang du mdzad nas dmigs pa'i khyad par ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is from the perspective of lesser heat that the distinction of object is made, since it focuses on the four noble truths in aspects such as impermanence.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par ni sdug @43b bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa gang gi mngon par ma zhen pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par ni sdug @43b bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa gang gi mngon par ma zhen pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of aspect is that it has the aspects of non-attachment and so on to the truths of suffering and origin.

original: 'di'i mdo ni /
analyzed: 'di'i mdo ni /
translated: The sūtra on this is as follows.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i gzugs mi rtag ces bya ba dang / gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / gzugs stong zhes bya ba dang / gzugs bdag med ces bya ba dang / yang gzugs stong zhes bya ba dang / gzugs smon pa med ces bya bar mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i gzugs mi rtag ces bya ba dang / gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / gzugs stong zhes bya ba dang / gzugs bdag med ces bya ba dang / yang gzugs stong zhes bya ba dang / gzugs smon pa med ces bya bar mngon par zhen pa dang /
translated: Śāriputra, the great bodhisattva’s fixation on the words “form is impermanent,” “form is suffering,” “form is empty,” “form is selfless,” and also “form is empty,” “form is wishless,”

original: lhag par gnas pa dang / kun shes pa 'di ni /
analyzed: lhag par gnas pa dang / kun shes pa 'di ni /
translated: and his abiding in and full understanding of this

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i chos la sred pas te skyon du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i mthun pa'i chos la sred pas te skyon du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is a fault for the great bodhisattva, Śāriputra, due to craving for concordant dharmas.”

original: 'di ni re zhig sdug bsngal gyi bden par gtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig sdug bsngal gyi bden par gtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: This is the distinction of the object and aspect included in the truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung gi bden par gtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden par gtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The distinction of the object and aspect included in the truth of origin is as follows.

original: de bzhin du gzugs 'di spang bar bya'o zhes 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o zhes mngon par zhen pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs 'di spang bar bya'o zhes 'dis gzugs spang bar bya'o zhes mngon par zhen pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, “this form should be abandoned” is the manifest clinging to “form should be abandoned.”

original: de la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du dmigs shing mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par byed do //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du dmigs shing mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par byed do //
translated: Therein, the aspects of impermanence, etc., in regard to the truths of suffering and origination are the modifications of those who are without manifest clinging to the observation of impermanence, etc.

original: ci zhig brjod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig brjod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is said?

original: nyan thos rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dngos po la dmigs shing mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis dngos po la dmigs shing mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur te /
translated: The śrāvakas observe things as having the characteristics of form, etc., and they are modified by impermanence, etc.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the antidote to the view of self.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po la dmigs shing de'i mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po la dmigs shing de'i mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattvas observe things as having the characteristics of impermanence, etc., and they are modified by the absence of manifest clinging to those, etc.

original: chos su lta ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos su lta ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the antidote to the view of dharmas.

original: 'dir mtshan ma med pa ma smos pa ni 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas bden pa gnyis brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir mtshan ma med pa ma smos pa ni 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas bden pa gnyis brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The signless is not mentioned here because it is intended to speak of the two truths from the point of view of engagement.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i theg pa chen po la 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir te /🔽mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa dang / lam gang gis rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan @44a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i theg pa chen po la 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir te / mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa dang / lam gang gis rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan @44a * //
translated: The signless is the aspect of the truths of cessation and path in the Mahayana,

original: ma sel ba zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: ma sel ba zhes bya bas so //
translated: because it is said, “The signless is that by which the signs of conceptualization are eliminated through that path.”

original: zhi ba'i rnam pa rnams kyis mtshan ma med pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de dngos po'i mtshan ma dang rjes su 'brel ba nyan thos kyi lam gyi dbang du byas pa yin pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam pa rnams kyis mtshan ma med pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de dngos po'i mtshan ma dang rjes su 'brel ba nyan thos kyi lam gyi dbang du byas pa yin pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: The statement, “The signless is by way of the aspects of peace,” is from the point of view of the śrāvaka path that is related to the sign of things, and therefore it is not contradictory to that.

original: rnam pa mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin /
analyzed: rnam pa mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin /
translated: The aspects are nonapprehending and so on.

original: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: gal te re zhig mngon par zhen pa med pa tsam mngon par zhen pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig mngon par zhen pa med pa tsam mngon par zhen pa med pa yin na /
translated: If non-attachment is just the absence of attachment,

original: de lta ni med pa'i phyir gnyen por mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta ni med pa'i phyir gnyen por mi rigs so //
translated: then it is not reasonable that it is an antidote, because it does not exist.

original: 'on te gang mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa yin na ni mig la sogs pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽ji ltar mi mthun pa yin pa de ltar ni mngon par zhen pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te gang mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa yin na ni mig la sogs pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na / ji ltar mi mthun pa yin pa de ltar ni mngon par zhen pa yin la /
translated: But if it is that which is not attached, then it follows that the eye, etc. are non-attachment.🔽It is attachment in the sense of being contrary,

original: ji ltar gnyen po yin pa de ltar ni mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gnyen po yin pa de ltar ni mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: and it is non-attachment in the sense of being an antidote.

original: yang ji ltar na mi mthun pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na mi mthun pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it contrary?

original: ji ltar mi bden pa'i rtog pas kun du bslang pa'i yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mi bden pa'i rtog pas kun du bslang pa'i yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the apprehension of existence and non-existence, which is aroused by false imagination.

original: ji ltar na gnyen po yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnyen po yin zhe na /
translated: How is it an antidote?

original: ji ltar de dag med pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de dag med pa'o //
translated: It is the non-existence of those two.

original: yang ji ltar na de dag med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de dag med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the non-existence of those two?

original: ji ltar de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ba bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ba bzhin te /
translated: It is as will be explained immediately below.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gal te sems med pa de la yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid med pa'am mi dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gal te sems med pa de la yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid med pa'am mi dmigs pa yin na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, if that non-existence of mind does not exist as existent or non-existent, or is not apprehended,

original: 'o na sems med pa'i sems gang yin pa de yod dam zhes brgal ba de rigs 'gyur ram zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na sems med pa'i sems gang yin pa de yod dam zhes brgal ba de rigs 'gyur ram zhes bya'o //
translated: then is that non-existent mind existent or not?

original: 'dis ni lhag par mi gnas pa dang kun du me shes pa zhes bya ba la yang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhag par mi gnas pa dang kun du me shes pa zhes bya ba la yang brjod pa yin no //
translated: This also expresses the meaning of not abiding in excess and not cognizing.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag gi dbang du byas nas dro bar gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag gi dbang du byas te gsungs pa ni 'gog pa 'di ltar mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag gi dbang du byas nas dro bar gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag gi dbang du byas te gsungs pa ni 'gog pa 'di ltar mngon du bya'o //
translated: With regard to the truths of cessation and path, it is said with reference to the distinctive objects and aspects of the heat stage: This cessation should be realized thus.

original: 'dis 'gog pa mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'gog pa mngon du bya'o //
translated: By this, cessation should be realized.

original: lam 'di ltar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lam 'di ltar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This path should be cultivated thus.

original: zhes mngon par zhen pa med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes mngon par zhen pa med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Without attachment and so on.

original: de la 'di ltar zhes bya bas ni bden pa bzhi la de'i rnam pa bzhi bzhi gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar zhes bya bas ni bden pa bzhi la de'i rnam pa bzhi bzhi gsungs pa yin la /
translated: Therein, thus indicates the four aspects of each of the four truths.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni de'i tshogs su gyur pa byang chub kyi phyogs rnams gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni de'i tshogs su gyur pa byang chub kyi phyogs rnams gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This refers to the factors of enlightenment, which are the collection of those.

original: 'dir 'gog pa @44b dang lam dag ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yin par brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir 'gog pa @44b dang lam dag ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yin par brjod de /
translated: Here, cessation and the path are described as the signless gate of liberation.

original: mtshan ma rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of signs:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la brten par bya ba dang / brten par bya ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan ma dang / spyad par bya ba dang spyad par bya ba ma yin pa rnams la slob pa dang mi slob pa'i gzhi lhag par gnas pa'i mtshan ma dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la brten par bya ba dang / brten par bya ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan ma dang / spyad par bya ba dang spyad par bya ba ma yin pa rnams la slob pa dang mi slob pa'i gzhi lhag par gnas pa'i mtshan ma dang /
translated: the sign of the basis of the afflicted and purified phenomena that are to be relied upon and not to be relied upon, the sign of the basis of the training and non-training in what is to be practiced and not to be practiced,

original: spyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / de pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams la thabs la mkhas pa dang thabs la mkhas pa ma yin pa kun shes pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: spyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / de pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams la thabs la mkhas pa dang thabs la mkhas pa ma yin pa kun shes pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: and the sign of understanding skillful means and lack of skillful means in the perfections such as generosity and their opposites.

original: 'di dag las bzlog pa mtshan ma med pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di dag las bzlog pa mtshan ma med pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The opposite of these is taught for the purpose of teaching the signless.

original: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: This is defilement.

original: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: This is purification.

original: chos 'di dag ni bsten par bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni bsten par bya ba'o //
translated: These dharmas are to be relied upon.🔽These dharmas are not to be relied upon.

original: chos 'di dag ni bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: This is skill in means.

original: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not skill in means.

original: zhes mngon par zhen pa dang lhag par gnas pa dang kun shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar yin no //🔽rjes su mthun pa nyid rtogs pa'i chos la sred pa yin no /
analyzed: zhes mngon par zhen pa dang lhag par gnas pa dang kun shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos la sred pa ste skyon du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar yin no // rjes su mthun pa nyid rtogs pa'i chos la sred pa yin no /
translated: This is the great bodhisattva's craving for the Dharma that accords with the faults, up to this is a fault.🔽Craving for the Dharma that is realized as being in accordance with.

original: rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba lugs su 'jug pa'i chos la srid pa'o /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba lugs su 'jug pa'i chos la srid pa'o /
translated: In accordance with means craving for the Dharma that proceeds in an orderly manner.

original: skyon zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyon zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Fault means what is called affliction.

original: rtogs pa'i chos rjes su mthun pa'i sred pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtse mo'i skyon chen po yin par brjod de /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos rjes su mthun pa'i sred pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtse mo'i skyon chen po yin par brjod de /
translated: The craving for the Dharma of realization is said to be a great fault of the peak.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to that,🔽the noble Avalokiteśvara said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po thabs mi mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la brten nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' chen po thabs mi mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la brten nas /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, a bodhisattva great being who practices the six perfections without skill in means, who relies on the three doors of liberation,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung la byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la yang mi 'jug pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtse mo'i skyon chen po yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi ltung la byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la yang mi 'jug pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtse mo'i skyon chen po yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: does not fall to the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha levels, but also does not enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva—this is a great fault of the peak of the bodhisattva.”

original: yang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa gang yin snyam na /🔽phyi stong pa nyid la nang stong pa @45a * //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa gang yin snyam na / phyi stong pa nyid la nang stong pa @45a * //
translated: Moreover, what is the faultlessness of the bodhisattva?

original: nyid du mi mthong zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: nyid du mi mthong zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: It is said, “One does not see inner emptiness as outer emptiness,” and so on.

original: de rnams so so la stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad du mthong ba phan tshun bkag pas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnams so so la stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad du mthong ba phan tshun bkag pas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The emptiness of each of these is seen in all aspects, and they are mutually negated.

original: 'dis ni rang gi ngo bo mtshan ma nub pa'i phyir 'gog pa mtshan ma med par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi ngo bo mtshan ma nub pa'i phyir 'gog pa mtshan ma med par ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows that cessation is signless because the signs of intrinsic reality have disappeared.

original: 'dir lam yang mtshan ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir lam yang mtshan ma med pa yin no //
translated: Here, the path is also signless.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni de ltar slob pas ni gzugs shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni de ltar slob pas ni gzugs shes par bya ste /
translated: The statement “One should know form by training in this way,

original: des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: but one should not become conceited about it,”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dras pa bco brgyad shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dras pa bco brgyad shes par bya ste /
translated: up to “One should know the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha,

original: des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang byang chub kyi sems shes bar bya ste /
analyzed: des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang byang chub kyi sems shes bar bya ste /
translated: but one should not become conceited about them,” and “One should know the thought of awakening,

original: des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: but one should not become conceited about it,”

original: 'dis ni rlom pa'i mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma med pa'i lam yin no zhes lam gyi bden pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rlom pa'i mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma med pa'i lam yin no zhes lam gyi bden pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the path of signlessness is the truth of the path, since it is the absence of the signs of conceit.

original: gzings lta bu yin pa'i phyir de yang dor bar bya ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gzings lta bu yin pa'i phyir de yang dor bar bya ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't that also to be rejected, because it is like a raft?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar sems de ni sems ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems de ni sems ma yin te /
translated: Because that mind is not mind,

original: sems kyi rang bzhin no 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yon no //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin no 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yon no //
translated: because the nature of mind is clear light.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba 'di gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba 'di gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this clear light nature of mind?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems gang 'dod chags dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems gang 'dod chags dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Venerable Sariputra said, The mind that is not associated with greed, hatred, and delusion...

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang ldan pa dang bral ba ma yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang ldan pa dang bral ba ma yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to ...not associated with the thought of a sravaka or pratyekabuddha, that is the clear light nature of mind.

original: yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel bar bsams nas smras pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel bar bsams nas smras pa ni /
translated: Thinking that it is connected with mere existence, he said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems gang zhig sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sems de yod dam zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems gang zhig sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sems de yod dam zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The Venerable Subhuti said, Is there such a thing as a mind that is not mind?

original: yod pa tsam du btags pa'ang mi bzod pas smras pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa tsam du btags pa'ang mi bzod pas smras pa ni /
translated: Since even the designation as mere existence is not accepted, he said,🔽No, Venerable Sariputra.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems med pa gang yin pa de la yod pa nyid dam /🔽med pa nyid yod pa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems med pa gang yin pa de la yod pa nyid dam / med pa nyid yod pa'am /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for that which is mindless, is there existence or nonexistence,

original: dmigs bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ste /
translated: or is there something that exists or is apprehended?

original: de'i brgal ba mi rigs pa yid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i brgal ba mi rigs pa yid kyis so //
translated: Thus, his objection is unreasonable.

original: 'o na sems med pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sems med pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: Well, what is that which is mindless?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems med pa ni 'gyur ba med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsam te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems med pa ni 'gyur ba med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba nas brtsam te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, that which is mindless is changeless and nonconceptual.

original: chos thams cad 'gyur ba med pa @45b rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyis sems med pa'i chos nyid rnam grangs bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gyur ba med pa @45b rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyis sems med pa'i chos nyid rnam grangs bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: From the beginning, this is stated in order to teach the meaning of the enumeration of the reality of the mindlessness of all phenomena through their changelessness and nonconceptuality.

original: bden pa bzhi dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par bshad zin to /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par bshad zin to /
translated: The distinctive objects and aspects of the four truths have been explained.

original: // / drod kyi rgyu'i khyad par gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: // / drod kyi rgyu'i khyad par gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Now, from the perspective of the distinctive causes of heat,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: it is said, “Why is that?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ” and so forth.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan yid can gyi dro bar gyur pa gang gi rgyur gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan yid can gyi dro bar gyur pa gang gi rgyur gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the heat that has such a name?

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las gang la byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bslab par bya ba'i theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan to zhes bya bas de lta bu'i mtshan yid can gyi drod theg pa gsum ka rtogs pa'i rgyu yin par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las gang la byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bslab par bya ba'i theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan to zhes bya bas de lta bu'i mtshan yid can gyi drod theg pa gsum ka rtogs pa'i rgyu yin par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that the heat that has such a name is the cause of realizing all three vehicles, since it is said that the perfection of wisdom extensively teaches the three vehicles, in which the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas and the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas should always and uninterruptedly train.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni thabs mkhas pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni thabs mkhas pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The difference in possession is characterized by skillful means and spiritual friends.

original: rnam par rtogs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtogs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: Possession endowed with realization will be explained later.

original: 'di ni re zhig dro bar gyur pa chung du yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig dro bar gyur pa chung du yin no //
translated: This is the lesser heat for now.

original: 'bring ni bcom ldan 'das bdag gis gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'bring ni bcom ldan 'das bdag gis gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: “I, O Lord, do not apprehend and do not see the increase and decrease of form, etc.🔽up to: I do not apprehend and do not see the increase and decrease of the reality of all Buddhas and all dharmas.”

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dmigs pa'i khyad par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dmigs pa'i khyad par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The special object is stated.

original: ming thams cad med pa nyid kyis gnas nyid dang gnas pa dang bral ba med pas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: ming thams cad med pa nyid kyis gnas nyid dang gnas pa dang bral ba med pas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: “Because of the non-existence of all names, there is no abiding, no separation from abiding.” This is the special mode.

original: de la nyon mongs pa dang bral bas rnam par bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa dang bral bas rnam par bden pa'o //
translated: Therein, it is “pure” because of being free from defilement.

original: dngos po 'gag pas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'gag pas na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is “peaceful” because of the cessation of entities.

original: rang nyid ma skyes pa nyid kyis na skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ma skyes pa nyid kyis na skye ba med pa'o //
translated: It is “non-arisen” because of being unborn itself.

original: pha rol gyi mu med pa nyid kyis na rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi mu med pa nyid kyis na rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: It is “non-originated” because of being difficult to understand due to the absence of a far shore.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams kyi sngon ldan par gyur pa'i ma byang chub ba dang bral ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams kyi sngon ldan par gyur pa'i ma byang chub ba dang bral ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without affliction because it is free from the former non-enlightenment of the noble persons.

original: sems can dmigs su med pas na rnam par byang ba med pa'o //🔽'phags pa'i chos rnam @46a * //
analyzed: sems can dmigs su med pas na rnam par byang ba med pa'o // 'phags pa'i chos rnam @46a * //
translated: It is without purification because sentient beings are not apprehended.

original: kyi rgyur gyur pas chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: kyi rgyur gyur pas chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: It is the dharma-element because it is the cause of the noble dharmas.

original: gzhan du 'gyur pa nyid med pas de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur pa nyid med pas de bzhin nyid de /
translated: It is thusness because it is without any otherness.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i mthar thug pas na yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i mthar thug pas na yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: It is the limit of reality because it is the ultimate without error.

original: 'phags pa thams cad kyis ma mdzad pas na chos gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad kyis ma mdzad pas na chos gnas pa nyid de /
translated: It is the establishment of the dharma because it is not made by any noble one.

original: de rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib ba'o //
translated: It is the increase and decrease of those.

original: de la 'phel ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'phel ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Therein, increase is arising.

original: 'grib pa ni 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: 'grib pa ni 'gag pa'o //
translated: Decrease is cessation.

original: mi dmigs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis ni dmigs su med pa'i rnam par bsgom pa lhag par mos pa dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa dang / de kho na nyid mthong ba'i nyid la byed pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis ni dmigs su med pa'i rnam par bsgom pa lhag par mos pa dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa dang / de kho na nyid mthong ba'i nyid la byed pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The two phrases “not observed” and “not seen” should be understood as referring to the attention of mental activity that has the object of the superior understanding of the meditation on the non-apprehension of objects.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das de'i ming de'ang gnas pa ma mchis /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das de'i ming de'ang gnas pa ma mchis /
translated: “Bhagavān, that name also does not stand,

original: gnas pa dang bral ba ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: gnas pa dang bral ba ma mchis lags so //
translated: nor is it without standing.”

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming de ma mchis pas zhes bya ba de la gnas pa ni rgyun 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: ming de ma mchis pas zhes bya ba de la gnas pa ni rgyun 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Because that name does not exist.” Standing there is continuity.

original: gnas pa dang bral ba ni rgyun mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dang bral ba ni rgyun mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: Without standing is not continuity.

original: chen po bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chen po bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: “Bhagavān, it is thus.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes chos kyi brdar btags pa dang / chos su gdags pa gang lags pa de'ang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes chos kyi brdar btags pa dang / chos su gdags pa gang lags pa de'ang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That designation of a dharma, that designation of a bodhisattva, up to that designation of a tathāgata, that name also does not stand, nor is it without standing.”

original: rgya cher sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba'i ming dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bgyi ba'i ming de yang dge ba'am mi dge ba 'am zhes pa pa nas dngos po 'am dngos po med pa gang gis kyang brjod du ma mchis so //
analyzed: rgya cher sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba'i ming dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bgyi ba'i ming de yang dge ba'am mi dge ba 'am zhes pa pa nas dngos po 'am dngos po med pa gang gis kyang brjod du ma mchis so //
translated: The name ‘enlightenment’ and the name ‘qualities of the Buddha’ are not described by anything, whether wholesome or unwholesome, and so on up to whether they are entities or non-entities.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:🔽The name ‘dream’ and so on up to ‘magical illusion’ are not described by anything.

original: dper na / rmi lam zhes bgyi ba nas sprul pa zhes bgyi ba'i bar gyi ming ni gang gis kyang brjod du ma mchi so zhes bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni sems zhum par mi 'gyur 'gyod pa ma mchis la /
analyzed: dper na / rmi lam zhes bgyi ba nas sprul pa zhes bgyi ba'i bar gyi ming ni gang gis kyang brjod du ma mchi so zhes bya ba nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni sems zhum par mi 'gyur 'gyod pa ma mchis la /
translated: The great bodhisattva who practices like this does not have a low opinion of himself, does not have regrets,

original: mi 'jigs mi dang ba skrag par mi 'gyur na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba lags so zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs mi dang ba skrag par mi 'gyur na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba lags so zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is not frightened, is not terrified, and is not overcome by fear. He will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: thar pa'i chad dang mthun pa las 'di khyad ci yod ce na /
analyzed: thar pa'i chad dang mthun pa las 'di khyad ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between this and the section on the factors that contribute to enlightenment?

original: bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam dang shin tu nye ba nyid do //
analyzed: bar chad med na mthong ba'i lam dang shin tu nye ba nyid do //
translated: If there is no obstacle, it is very close to the path of insight.

original: dro bar gyur ba zhes gyur ba brjod pa ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i rigs shes par bya ba'i don nam /
analyzed: dro bar gyur ba zhes gyur ba brjod pa ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i rigs shes par bya ba'i don nam /
translated: The expression “heat” is used to indicate the small, middling, and great stages of the root of the wholesome;

original: yang na dbang po rtul po @46b la sogs pa'i gang zag gi dbye ba yang 'di'i dmigs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par shes par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na dbang po rtul po @46b la sogs pa'i gang zag gi dbye ba yang 'di'i dmigs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par shes par bya ba'i don to //
translated: or else, it is used to indicate the distinction of the object, etc. of this root of the wholesome, according to whether the person is of weak faculties, etc.

original: rtse mor gyur pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same holds for the summit.

original: dro bar gyur pa ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Heat is associated with the sixteen aspects of the four noble truths.

original: drod las ni rtse mor yin zhing de dag kyang de 'dra bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: drod las ni rtse mor yin zhing de dag kyang de 'dra bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How can one say that the summit is like heat?

original: do shal gtsug lag khang dang mtshan nyid 'dra 'am 'di ni 'jug pa gzhan kho na yin no //
analyzed: do shal gtsug lag khang dang mtshan nyid 'dra 'am 'di ni 'jug pa gzhan kho na yin no //
translated: Is the summit like a necklace or a temple?

original: dro bar gyur pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa bshad zin to /
translated: The state of heat has been explained.

original: // / rtse mo bshad par bya ste ;
analyzed: // / rtse mo bshad par bya ste ;
translated: The peak should be explained.

original: de rnams kyi rgyu nyid dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par dang / rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag par ldan pa yang snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyu nyid dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par dang / rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag par ldan pa yang snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The cause of those should be understood as before, and the distinction of the possession and the association with discrimination.

original: rtse mo rnams la ji lta ba de bzhin du bzod pa rnams dang 'jigs rten pa'i cos kyi mchog rnams la la yang yin no //
analyzed: rtse mo rnams la ji lta ba de bzhin du bzod pa rnams dang 'jigs rten pa'i cos kyi mchog rnams la la yang yin no //
translated: Just as with the peaks, so it is with the acceptances and the supreme mundane qualities.

original: de la rtse mo'i dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la rtse mo'i dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to that, the Lord, taking the distinction of the object of the peaks as the main point,🔽says,

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, when the bodhisattva-mahasattva is practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: des gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: des gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: he should not stand in form, and so on up to

original: chos thams cad la gnas pa bkag pa dang / de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad la gnas pa bkag pa dang / de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: the prohibition of standing in all dharmas, and the reason for that.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The Lord has said that the emptiness of form, etc.

original: chos rnams kyi de'i dngos po bkag pas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de'i dngos po bkag pas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is the negation of the reality of those phenomena.🔽From the point of view of the distinction of aspects, he has said that the emptiness of form, etc.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par gyi dbang du mdzad nas gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de yang gzugs ma lags /
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par gyi dbang du mdzad nas gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de yang gzugs ma lags /
translated: is not form, etc., and that form, etc. is not other than emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid las gzhan na'ang gzugs ma mchis zhes bya ba chos rnams dang de'i stong ba nyid phan tshun de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'i khyad par can dang / de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gzhan na'ang gzugs ma mchis zhes bya ba chos rnams dang de'i stong ba nyid phan tshun de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'i khyad par can dang / de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: He has said that phenomena and their emptiness are distinguished by the aspect of mutual identity, and that🔽form is emptiness and emptiness is form.

original: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya pas chos rnams dang de'i stong pa nyid phan tshun gyi rang bzhin du 'dod pas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya pas chos rnams dang de'i stong pa nyid phan tshun gyi rang bzhin du 'dod pas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: He has said that phenomena and their emptiness are accepted as having the nature of mutual identity.

original: de la snga mas ni rtag pa'i mtha' bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: de la snga mas ni rtag pa'i mtha' bkag pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, the former refutes the extreme of eternalism,

original: cig shos kyis ni chad pa'i mtha' bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni chad pa'i mtha' bkag pa yin no //
translated: and the latter refutes the extreme of nihilism.

original: bden pa bzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i @47a * //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'i dbang du mdzad nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i @47a * //
translated: In terms of the four noble truths, the truth of suffering is as follows.🔽

original: skabs su gnas pa med pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: skabs su gnas pa med pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: In terms of the four noble truths, in the context of the truth of suffering, the distinctive object of observation of non-abiding is as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Bhagavan, moreover, when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: des gzugs la min rtag ces bgyi bar gnas par min bgyi'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: des gzugs la min rtag ces bgyi bar gnas par min bgyi'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: he should not abide in the notion that “form is impermanent,” up to

original: gzugs la zhi ba'o zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par te /
analyzed: gzugs la zhi ba'o zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par te /
translated: he should not abide in the notion that “form is peace.”

original: de ci'i slad du zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gzugs mi rtag pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyis stong ste zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar gzugs mi rtag pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyis stong ste zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Bhagavan, it is because impermanent form is empty of impermanent form.

original: de la gnas pa ni dngos po la dmigs pa'i sems kyis brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni dngos po la dmigs pa'i sems kyis brten pa'o //
translated: Abiding in that is the mind that observes entities.

original: 'dir spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir spyad par bya ste /
translated: Here one should practice as follows:

original: gal te re zhig gnas med pa tsam gnas par mi bya ba yin na ni med pa yin na pa'i phyir gnyen por mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te re zhig gnas med pa tsam gnas par mi bya ba yin na ni med pa yin na pa'i phyir gnyen por mi rigs so //
translated: If, on the other hand, it is the mere non-existence of a location that is not made to be a location, then it is not tenable as an antidote because it is non-existent.

original: 'on te gang gnas ma yin pa yin na de lta ni thal ches pa yin no zhe na /
