analyzed: 'on te gang gnas ma yin pa yin na de lta ni thal ches pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is a non-location, then that is too extreme a consequence.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa la tshul ji ltar bshad pa de ltar 'di yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa la tshul ji ltar bshad pa de ltar 'di yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should view this as explained above in the absence of manifest clinging.🔽The distinctive feature of the mode is as follows:

original: rnam pa'i khyad par ni bcom ldan 'das mi rtag pa'i nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de'ang mi rtag pa nyid ma lags /
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par ni bcom ldan 'das mi rtag pa'i nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de'ang mi rtag pa nyid ma lags /
translated: The emptiness of the Lord’s impermanence is not impermanence,

original: mi rtag pa las gud na yang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa las gud na yang stong pa nyid ma mchis te /
translated: and emptiness does not exist apart from impermanence.🔽Thus, impermanence and so forth and their emptiness are distinctive in the mode of being of mutual identity.

original: zhes bya bas mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams dang de'i stong pa nyid phan tshun de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'i khyad par can dang / de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya bas mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams dang de'i stong pa nyid phan tshun de'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa'i khyad par can dang / de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyang mi rtog pa nyid zhes bya bas de dag phan tshun rang bzhin gcig 'dod pas gang gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyang mi rtog pa nyid zhes bya bas de dag phan tshun rang bzhin gcig 'dod pas gang gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: The Lord has said that impermanence is emptiness, and emptiness is impermanence, and so on, because he accepts that they are mutually the same nature.

original: / de la mi rtag pa'i don ni med pa'i don dang sdug ba'i don dang sdug bsngal ba'i don ni ma skyes pa'i don yin pa des na mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid stong pa nyid ni phan tshun gyi rang bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: / de la mi rtag pa'i don ni med pa'i don dang sdug ba'i don dang sdug bsngal ba'i don ni ma skyes pa'i don yin pa des na mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid stong pa nyid ni phan tshun gyi rang bzhin can yin no //
translated: The meaning of impermanent is the meaning of non-existent, and the meaning of suffering is the meaning of non-arisen. Therefore, impermanence and suffering are emptiness, and they are mutually the same nature.

original: de lta ma yin ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin ni /
translated: If that were not so,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la /
translated: the general characteristic of conditioned phenomena would be impermanence,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa spyi'i mtshan nyid ni sdu bsngal ba nyid yin pa des na chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid de gnyis dang stong pa nyid phan tshun khyab par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa spyi'i mtshan nyid ni sdu bsngal ba nyid yin pa des na chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid de gnyis dang stong pa nyid phan tshun khyab par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the general characteristic of the contaminated would be suffering. Therefore, the two general characteristics of all phenomena and emptiness would be mutually pervasive.

original: yang na mi rtag pa nyid kun brtags pa'i dngos po ni mi rtag pa kho na yin la @47b sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang sdug bsngal ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na mi rtag pa nyid kun brtags pa'i dngos po ni mi rtag pa kho na yin la @47b sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang sdug bsngal ba kho na yin te /
translated: Or else, impermanence is only impermanent with respect to an imagined thing, and suffering is only suffering with respect to a suffering thing.

original: dngos po dang stong ba nyid gnyis kyang phan tshun khyab par 'dod pa nyid yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po dang stong ba nyid gnyis kyang phan tshun khyab par 'dod pa nyid yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: And emptiness and a thing are mutually inclusive, so there is no fault.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung gi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas de'i rnam ba rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen la brten pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag brjod par bya'o //🔽'gog pa'i bden pa'i dbang du byas nas dmigs pa'i khyad par de bzhin nyid la sogs pa la mi gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des de bzhin nyid la gnas par mi bgyi ste zhes bya ba nas yang dag pa'i
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung gi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas de'i rnam ba rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen la brten pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag brjod par bya'o // 'gog pa'i bden pa'i dbang du byas nas dmigs pa'i khyad par de bzhin nyid la sogs pa la mi gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des de bzhin nyid la gnas par mi bgyi ste zhes bya ba nas yang dag pa'i
translated: Similarly, with respect to the truth of origination, the aspects of cause, origination, strong production, and condition should be explained as the distinctions of object and aspect.

original: mtha' la gnas par mi bgyi ste /
analyzed: mtha' la gnas par mi bgyi ste /
translated: With respect to the truth of cessation, the distinction of object is not dwelling in suchness, etc. The bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom should not dwell in suchness, up to should not dwell in the reality limit.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because, Blessed One, suchness is empty of the essence of suchness.

original: de la dngos po dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid la bsams nas ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dngos po dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid la bsams nas ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therein, one should understand that it is empty of an intrinsic reality, considering suchness devoid of entities,

original: dngos po yod na der btags pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam pa'i khyad par ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de'ang de bzhin nyid ma lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po yod na der btags pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa'i khyad par ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de'ang de bzhin nyid ma lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: because if there were an entity, it would be designated as such.🔽The distinctive aspect is stated in the passage beginning with “Blessed One, that emptiness of suchness is not suchness,” and so on. Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin nyid stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because, Blessed One, suchness is emptiness and emptiness is suchness.

original: de la de bzhin nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pan de ni de bzhin nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i de bzhin nyid ni brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pan de ni de bzhin nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i de bzhin nyid ni brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is the emptiness of suchness is not suchness. This is because the suchness of separation is just a designation.

original: de bzhin nyid las gzhan na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te zhes bya ba ni btags pa don dam par stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las gzhan na'ang stong pa nyid ma mchis te zhes bya ba ni btags pa don dam par stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is emptiness found elsewhere than in suchness. This is because the ultimate of designation is empty.

original: de la gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i don gyis na de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i don gyis na de bzhin nyid do //
translated: There, suchness has the meaning of not changing into something else.

original: de lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po'i don gyis na stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas byas pa'i gnyen po'i don gyis na stong pa nyid do //
translated: Emptiness has the meaning of the antidote to that fabrication.

original: dbyer mi phyed pa'i don gyis na chos nyid ngo ;
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pa'i don gyis na chos nyid ngo ;
translated: Dharmatā has the meaning of inseparability.

original: / chos kyi dbyings ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: / chos kyi dbyings ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The dharma-dhātu is the same as before.

original: gcig tu nges par 'byung ba'i don gyis na chos nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par 'byung ba'i don gyis na chos nges pa nyid do //
translated: The dharma itself has the meaning of definite emergence.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The very limit of reality is the same as before.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gnas pa med pa dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i don gyis dmigs pa'i khyad @48a * //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gnas pa med pa dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i don gyis dmigs pa'i khyad @48a * //
translated: In terms of the truth of the path, the distinctive object is taught by the meaning of “without abiding” and “without manifest activity.”

original: par ni bcom ldan 'das gal te gzugs la gnas na de gzugs mngon par 'du bgyi ba la spyod kyi /
analyzed: par ni bcom ldan 'das gal te gzugs la gnas na de gzugs mngon par 'du bgyi ba la spyod kyi /
translated: Blessed One, if one abides in form, one engages in the manifest activity of form.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: One does not engage in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: mngon par 'du bgyi ba la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bgyi ba la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Blessed One, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who engages in manifest activity will not be embraced by the perfection of wisdom.”

original: rnam pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The distinctive aspect is taught by the following passage:

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni yong su gzung ba ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni yong su gzung ba ma mchis pa ste /
translated: “Blessed One, it is because form is ungraspable.

original: gzugs kyi yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de 'ang rang bzhin gyi stong pa'i slad du gzugs ma lags zhes zhes bya bas gzugs la sogs pa yongs su ma bzung ba la de'i ngo bo bkag pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de 'ang rang bzhin gyi stong pa'i slad du gzugs ma lags zhes zhes bya bas gzugs la sogs pa yongs su ma bzung ba la de'i ngo bo bkag pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That non-apprehension of form, etc. is also not form, etc. because of the emptiness of own-being.🔽This is the great bodhisattva's 'circle of concentration' called 'non-apprehension of all dharmas'.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bgyi ba ste zhes bya ba ni rtsi mor gyur pa'o / de'ang ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs gzhan dang gzhan thob par byed pas dkyil 'khor yangs
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bgyi ba ste zhes bya ba ni rtsi mor gyur pa'o / de'ang ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs gzhan dang gzhan thob par byed pas dkyil 'khor yangs
translated: It is a 'circle' because it brings about the attainment of other and other accumulations of concentration.

original: pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings yangs pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings yangs pa'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings yangs pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings yangs pa'o //
translated: 'Vast' means the vast expanse of dharmas.

original: mdun du byas pas zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag gis mdun du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdun du byas pas zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag gis mdun du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: 'Made manifest' means it becomes manifest through the special objects and aspects.

original: tshad med par nges pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med par nges pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Ascertained without measure” means ascertained individually for the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rgyu dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rgyu dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: “Not taken away by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas” means by the special object, aspect, cause, and possession as explained.

original: chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de'ang nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i slad du yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'o zhes de ma thag tu ji skad gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de'ang nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i slad du yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'o zhes de ma thag tu ji skad gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Not grasped at all by dharmas” means the knowledge of all aspects of the Blessed One is ungrasped because of inner emptiness and so on, as was just explained.

original: de ni re zhig rtse mor gyur pa chung du yin no //🔽'bring po ni de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ni re zhig rtse mor gyur pa chung du yin no // 'bring po ni de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: That is the small stage of the peak.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mtshan ma gzung bar bgyi ba ma lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mtshan ma gzung bar bgyi ba ma lags te /
translated: The medium stage is the passage beginning with “Why is that? Blessed One, the knowledge of all aspects is not to be grasped at by way of a causal sign.”

original: mtshan ma las ni nyon mongs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma las ni nyon mongs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The afflictions arise from signs.

original: mtshan ma @48b de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma @48b de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those signs?

original: gzugs ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: Form is a sign.🔽Feeling is a sign.

original: tshor ba ni mtshan ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba ni mtshan ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The statement that begins with these words is being quoted.

original: de la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzugs kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzugs kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Therein, the characteristic of form is called the sign of form.

original: de'ang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'ang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is impermanence, etc.

original: 'di gang la zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang la zhe na /
translated: What is this?

original: gang gi phyir gang gi tshe mi rtag pa'am rtag pa zhes gzungs kyi mtshan ma la spyod pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi tshe mi rtag pa'am rtag pa zhes gzungs kyi mtshan ma la spyod pa na /
translated: Because when one engages in the sign of form, thinking “impermanent” or “permanent,”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is explained that one does not engage in the perfection of wisdom.

original: mtshan ma ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yin pas mtshan ma med pa ni dmigs pa'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yin pas mtshan ma med pa ni dmigs pa'i khyad par yin te /
translated: Since signs are afflictions for bodhisattvas, signlessness is a specific object.

original: gal te yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan mar gzung ba zhig lags na ni kun tu rgyu phreng ba can bstan pa 'di la dad pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gal te yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan mar gzung ba zhig lags na ni kun tu rgyu phreng ba can bstan pa 'di la dad pa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom were something to be apprehended by a sign, then the wandering mendicant Upatiṣya would not have attained faith in this teaching.

original: des chos 'ga' yangs yongs su ma bzung ste mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des chos 'ga' yangs yongs su ma bzung ste mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because he did not fully grasp any dharma, due to attending to the signless.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par ni 'di ltar des ye shes de rtogs pa dang thob par bgyi ba'i tshul gyis nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par ni 'di ltar des ye shes de rtogs pa dang thob par bgyi ba'i tshul gyis nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The distinction of mode is as follows: “He did not see that wisdom internally, in the manner of realizing and attaining it.”🔽This is the other enumeration of the negation of seeing that wisdom internally and so on, which is the distinction of mode of the desire realm.

original: nang la sogs pa la ye shes de mthong ba bkag pa'i rnam grangs gzhan 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par dang // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: nang la sogs pa la ye shes de mthong ba bkag pa'i rnam grangs gzhan 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par dang // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad gzung du ma mchis pa dang btang du ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad gzung du ma mchis pa dang btang du ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That which is not apprehended and not released of all dharmas is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la phreng ba can dper byas pa ni de mu stegs pa dang 'brel pas na ma dad pa yin yang rtogs pa'i stobs 'ba' zhig kho nas don de mngon du byas la dbang nyid du shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de la phreng ba can dper byas pa ni de mu stegs pa dang 'brel pas na ma dad pa yin yang rtogs pa'i stobs 'ba' zhig kho nas don de mngon du byas la dbang nyid du shes par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: There, the example of the garland-maker is for the sake of understanding the meaning of mastery, since he, though lacking faith because of his connection with the tīrthikas, manifested that meaning through the power of realization alone.

original: chen po ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis zhig ste /
analyzed: chen po ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis zhig ste /
translated: The great one is the Blessed One. Moreover, that great bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom should know it thus.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases beginning with form.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang gi ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang gi ste /
translated: Whose is this perfection of wisdom?

original: bdag gam chos kyi yin zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽shes @49a * //
analyzed: bdag gam chos kyi yin zhes bya ba'i don to // shes @49a * //
translated: The meaning is: of a self or of a dharma.

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gang gi yin te /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gang gi yin te /
translated: This perfection of wisdom belongs to whom?

original: rdzas sam yon tan ni bya ba'am rigs yin zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rdzas sam yon tan ni bya ba'am rigs yin zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is: it is a substance, a quality, an action, or a class.🔽Thus, the perfection of wisdom should be investigated.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su brtag par bgyi ste zhes bya ba dang / ci chos gang zhig yod pa ma yin zhing mi dmigs pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su brtag par bgyi ste zhes bya ba dang / ci chos gang zhig yod pa ma yin zhing mi dmigs pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with: Is that dharma which does not exist and is not apprehended the perfection of wisdom?

original: thams cad mi dmigs par de'i rang bzhin nye bar bzhin nye bar brtag pa'i khyad par can dmigs pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mi dmigs par de'i rang bzhin nye bar bzhin nye bar brtag pa'i khyad par can dmigs pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Up to: The nature of that is non-apprehension. The special non-apprehension is said to be the very apprehension.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The special aspect is:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, because of the emptiness of internal phenomena and so forth, form is non-existent and not apprehended.

original: nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is non-existent and not apprehended, because of inner emptiness, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni 'di ltar rtog cing sems pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni 'di ltar rtog cing sems pa'i tshe /
translated: When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is thinking and reflecting in this way,

original: sems zhum pa med cing mi 'jigs mi dang skrag par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: sems zhum pa med cing mi 'jigs mi dang skrag par mi 'gyur na /
translated: if his mind is not timid, does not fear, and does not tremble,

original: shes rang gi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rang gi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: one should know that he is not separated from the perfection of wisdom.”

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo'o //
translated: The root of the wholesome is the moving peak.

original: rtse mor gyur pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa bshad zin to /
translated: The peak has been explained.

original: // / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis bzod pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: // / chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis bzod pa'i dmigs pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The distinctive object of acceptance is the observation of the absence of inherent nature of all phenomena,🔽as stated in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang zhin dang bral ba ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang zhin dang bral ba ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, form is separated from the nature of form.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The nature of form, Venerable Śāriputra, is non-existent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dang rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dag ni phan tshun de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid kyis rnam pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dang rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dag ni phan tshun de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid kyis rnam pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The nature of characteristics and the nature of the nature of characteristics are mutually the same nature. The difference in aspects is

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mtshan nyid la'ang mtshan nyid kyis rang bzhin med /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu mtshan nyid la'ang mtshan nyid kyis rang bzhin med /
translated: The characteristic itself, Venerable Śāriputra, has no nature of its own.

original: mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin la'ang mtshan nyid med do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin la'ang mtshan nyid med do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The nature of the characteristic also has no characteristic.

original: de la mtshan nyid ni spyin yin la /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ni spyin yin la /
translated: Here, the characteristic is the general,

original: rang bzhin ni khyad par gzhan yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni khyad par gzhan yin te /
translated: and the nature is the specific.

original: de dag ngo bo nyid phan tshun ldog par gyur na ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'ga' 'ang 'ga' zhi gi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid phan tshun ldog par gyur na ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'ga' 'ang 'ga' zhi gi mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If their natures were mutually exclusive, then because they would be unrelated, nothing would be the characteristic of anything.

original: @49b phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa yin na ni btags pa'i mtshan nyid gzhi dang mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: @49b phan tshun rjes su zhugs pa yin na ni btags pa'i mtshan nyid gzhi dang mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa 'thad pa yin no //
translated: If they were mutually dependent, then the definition of the designation and the definition of the basis would be tenable.

original: 'di ni re zhig bzod pa chung du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig bzod pa chung du'o //
translated: This is the lesser patience.

original: 'bring gi dmigs pa'i khyad par ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / nges par 'byung ba med pa ni ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: 'bring gi dmigs pa'i khyad par ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / nges par 'byung ba med pa ni ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: The distinctive object of the middling is all phenomena are non-arisen and non-departing. Why?🔽Venerable Śāriputra, it is because all phenomena are non-arisen and non-departing.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang nges par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzugs gzugs kyis stong ste /🔽de la skye ba yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang nges par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang / gzugs gzugs kyis stong ste / de la skye ba yang mi dmigs /
translated: Form is empty of form.🔽In that, arising is not apprehended.🔽Departing is not apprehended.

original: nges par 'byung ba yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said, and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rnam par dag pa thob pa nyid yin pas na rnam pa'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po de 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rnam par dag pa thob pa nyid yin pas na rnam pa'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po de 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Since he has attained the purity that arises from the evolution of his life, the distinctive feature of his life is that the great bodhisattva does not generate a mind that is associated with passion, and so on, up to

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa yongs su dag pa thob pa dang / rdzus te skya zhing gzhan du 'gro ba dang / de yongs su skye ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa yongs su dag pa thob pa dang / rdzus te skya zhing gzhan du 'gro ba dang / de yongs su skye ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral ba nyid kyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: he does not generate a mind that is associated with all the addictions. He has attained the purity of body, and so on, because he is not separated from the Buddha until he attains perfect enlightenment, by means of miraculous birth, going to other worlds, being reborn there, and developing living beings.

original: rnam par dag pa de yang yang dag par 'da' bas bsdus pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa de yang yang dag par 'da' bas bsdus pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This purity is threefold, included in the transcendences.

original: gzugs sogs ngo bo nyid med nyid //
analyzed: gzugs sogs ngo bo nyid med nyid //
translated: The nature of form and so on is essenceless.

original: de med pa yi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de med pa yi ngo bo nyid //
translated: Its nature is the absence of that.

original: de dag skye med nges 'byung med //
analyzed: de dag skye med nges 'byung med //
translated: They are unborn and do not emerge.

original: dag dang de dag mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: dag dang de dag mtshan nyid med //
translated: They are pure and lack characteristics.

original: de yi mtshan mar mi brten pas //
analyzed: de yi mtshan mar mi brten pas //
translated: Since they do not rely on their signs,

original: mos min 'du shes med pa yin //
analyzed: mos min 'du shes med pa yin //
translated: they are not objects of interest and are non-conceptual.

original: ting 'dzin de yi byed pa nyid //🔽lung bstan pa dang rlom pa zad //
analyzed: ting 'dzin de yi byed pa nyid // lung bstan pa dang rlom pa zad //
translated: That is the function of meditative concentration.🔽The three are the essence of one.

original: gsum po gcig gi ngo bo gcig / ting 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa //
analyzed: gsum po gcig gi ngo bo gcig / ting 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa //
translated: Meditative concentration is non-conceptual.

original: de ltar nges 'byed cha mthun ni //
analyzed: de ltar nges 'byed cha mthun ni //
translated: In that way, the factors conducive to penetrative insight

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po yin //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po yin //
translated: are small, medium, and great.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang / @51b mthun pa rnams kyi dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rgyu nyid kyi khyad par dang / chung dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag bshad zin to /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang / @51b mthun pa rnams kyi dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rgyu nyid kyi khyad par dang / chung dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag bshad zin to /
translated: The distinctive features of the object, aspect, and cause of the aids to penetration have been explained, as well as their distinctions as small, middling, and great.

original: // / yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinctive features of their retention will be explained later.

original: da ni rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag par ldan pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag par ldan pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the conceptualization that is associated with them should be explained.

original: de la mthong pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la mthong pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four types of conceptualization are the counteragents to the path of seeing.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of conceptualization that apprehend the object:

original: dngos po tsam la brten pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs la brten pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po tsam la brten pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs la brten pa'o //
translated: one that is based on mere things and one that is based on the side of the antidote.

original: tsam smos pa ni khyad par gsal ba'i don du yin no //
analyzed: tsam smos pa ni khyad par gsal ba'i don du yin no //
translated: The term “mere” is used to indicate a specific object.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of conceptualization that apprehend the subject:

original: gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can dang / skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can no //
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can dang / skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can no //
translated: one that is based on the substantial existence of the person and one that is based on the imputed existence of the individual.

original: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang po dang gnyis pa dag ni go rims bzhin du gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis su gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang po dang gnyis pa dag ni go rims bzhin du gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis su gyur pa yin la /
translated: The first and second of the factors conducive to penetrations are, respectively, the two kinds of discursive thought that grasp.

original: gsum dang bzhi pa dag kyang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gsum dang bzhi pa dag kyang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis yin no //
translated: The third and fourth are the two kinds of discursive thought that apprehend.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the statement in the sutra, “Subhuti, it is excellent, excellent that you have spoken thus,” is stated in terms of the characteristic of discursive thought.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar ngas khyod la nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bstan pa ltar ston pa ni legs so legs so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar ngas khyod la nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bstan pa ltar ston pa ni legs so legs so zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The statement, “Subhuti, just as I have taught you to be foremost among those who abide in the absence of affliction,” is stated in terms of the meaning of mastery.

original: de la nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa nyid kyi yon tan brjod pa ni bdag dang gzhan la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pa 'gog pa la mkhas pas na gsal bar byed de dbang du byas ba nyid du shes pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa nyid kyi yon tan brjod pa ni bdag dang gzhan la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pa 'gog pa la mkhas pas na gsal bar byed de dbang du byas ba nyid du shes pa'i don du'o //
translated: The statement, “The qualities of abiding in the absence of affliction are expressed by the cessation of the discursive thought that arises in regard to self and other,” is stated in terms of the meaning of knowledge.

original: de la dang po gzung ba'i rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa dgur 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: de la dang po gzung ba'i rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa dgur 'gyur ba las /
translated: The first of these is ninefold, in terms of the aspects of the apprehended.

original: ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma rig pa'i stobs kyis ji lta ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma rig pa'i stobs kyis ji lta ba ma yin par mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: The conceptualization of ignorance is the non-apprehension of things as they are through the power of ignorance.

original: de ni sh'a ri'i bu chos 'di dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ji ltar mngon par zhen pa de ltar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sh'a ri'i bu chos 'di dag ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ji ltar mngon par zhen pa de ltar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Śāriputra, these phenomena do not exist as they are apprehended by childish ordinary beings.

original: ji ltar med pa de ltar yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa de ltar yod pa yin te /
translated: They exist as they do not exist.

original: de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ma rig pa zhes bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because they do not exist in that way, they are called ignorance.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conceptualization of the aggregates of form and so on is

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzugs nang stong pa nyid @52a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzugs nang stong pa nyid @52a * //
translated: Śāriputra, form does not exist because of inner emptiness.

original: kyi phyir yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi phyir yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on, as stated.

original: ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conceptualization of clinging to name-and-form is

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ma rig pa dang sred pa dag gis mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ma rig pa dang sred pa dag gis mngon par zhen te /
translated: There, childish ordinary beings are attached by ignorance and craving.

original: ji lta ba bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams mi shes mi mthong ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams mi shes mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not know and do not see phenomena that do not exist as they are.

original: de dag chos rnams su btags nas mngon par zhen te zhes gnag gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag chos rnams su btags nas mngon par zhen te zhes gnag gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They impute phenomena and are attached to them.

original: mtha' gnyis la chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conception of attachment to the two extremes:

original: de dag chos rnams la mngon par zhen pas yod pa ma yin pa'i mtha' gnyis su rtog par byed do//
analyzed: de dag chos rnams la mngon par zhen pas yod pa ma yin pa'i mtha' gnyis su rtog par byed do//
translated: Because of their attachment to phenomena, they conceive of the two non-existent extremes.

original: de dag ni gzugs mi shes mi mthong ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de dag ni gzugs mi shes mi mthong ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They do not know and do not see form...

original: des na byis pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na byis pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are counted as childish.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conception of not knowing defilement and purification:

original: de dag gi ma rig pa sred pa'i rkyen mi shes mi mthon ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi ma rig pa sred pa'i rkyen mi shes mi mthon ngo //
translated: They do not know and do not see the condition of ignorance and craving.

original: ci zhig mi shes mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig mi shes mi mthong zhe na /
translated: What do they not know and not see?

original: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know or see that form is thoroughly afflicted.🔽Similarly, they do not know or see that form is purified.

original: de bzhin du gzugs rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar mi shes mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba dang / de dag 'dod pa'i khams nas 'byung ba ma yin pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar mi shes mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba dang / de dag 'dod pa'i khams nas 'byung ba ma yin pa nas /
translated: They do not emerge from the desire realm, up to

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams las 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: they do not emerge from the dharmas of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conceptions of not abiding in the ārya path are:

original: de dag ni yid mi ches pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni yid mi ches pa ste /
translated: They do not have confidence

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar yid mi ches so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar yid mi ches so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: that form is empty of form, up to🔽they do not have confidence that awakening is empty of awakening.

original: byang chub byang chub kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar yid mi ches so zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de dag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub byang chub kyis stong ngo zhes bya bar yid mi ches so zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de dag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They do not abide in the perfection of generosity, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la gnas pa ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar la gnas pa ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to the unshared qualities of the Buddha are not existent.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conceptualization of objects is

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Śāriputra, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not observe the perfection of wisdom, he does not see it.

original: de ltar slob na rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba yin no zhes @52b bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar slob na rnams pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba yin no zhes @52b bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he trains like this, the knowledge of all aspects will arise by way of non-observation.”

original: bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conceptualization of self and so on is

original: sh'a ri'i bu bdag mi dmigs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu bdag mi dmigs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Śāriputra, I do not observe a self, I do not see it.

original: shin tu rnams par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shin tu rnams par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Because of complete purity.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, up to the statement, “the knowledge of all aspects” and so on.

original: rnam par dag pa skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conceptions of origination and so on of purity are

original: sh'a ri'i bu rnam par dag pa ni skye ba med pa ma byung ba mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu rnam par dag pa ni skye ba med pa ma byung ba mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: as stated: “Śāriputra, purity is non-arisen, non-occurred, and unconditioned.”

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po bshad zin to /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po bshad zin to /
translated: The first conception of the object of purity has been explained.

original: // / gnyis pa rnam par byang ba tsam gyi yul can brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / gnyis pa rnam par byang ba tsam gyi yul can brjod par bya ste /
translated: The second conception of the object of purity is the conception of the object of mere purity.

original: de yang rnam par byang ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rnam par byang ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: It is ninefold, divided into the aggregates, constituents, sense spheres, dependent origination, and so on that are included in purity.

original: de la phung po'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: de la phung po'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conception of the object of purity that is the aggregates is

original: de thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: as stated: “That person, due to lack of skill in means, conceives of form and is attached to it.”

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to consciousness.

original: phung po'i don ni spungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i don ni spungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of the aggregates is a heap.

original: skye ba'i sgo'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni mig la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba nas /🔽yid kyi bar dang // zugs  la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni mig la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba nas / yid kyi bar dang // zugs  la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The conceptual thought that conceives of the meaning of the sense-spheres is the adherence to the eye,🔽up to the adherence to the mind, and the adherence to form,

original: de bzhin du chos la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to the adherence to mental objects.

original: skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rigs kyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don yin pa'i phyir ro // rigs kyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: Because the meaning of the sense-spheres is the meaning of the door of arising.🔽The conceptual thought that conceives of the meaning of the elements is the adherence to the element of the eye and form and the element of visual consciousness,

original: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams su rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams su rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: and so on.

original: sa bon gyi don gyis khams kyi don yin no //
analyzed: sa bon gyi don gyis khams kyi don yin no //
translated: Because the meaning of the elements is the meaning of seed.

original: skye ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma rig par rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma rig par rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The conception of the meaning of origination is the conception and notional attachment to ignorance, and so on up to “just that”.

original: ma byung ba las byung ba'i don ni skye ba'i don yin no //🔽stong pa nyid kyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni de nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po @53a * //
analyzed: ma byung ba las byung ba'i don ni skye ba'i don yin no // stong pa nyid kyi don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni de nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po @53a * //
translated: The meaning of origination is the origination of what did not exist before.

original: med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The conception of the meaning of emptiness is the conception and notional attachment to the emptiness of internal phenomena, and so on up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: med pa tsam ni lta bas byas pa'i gnyen por 'gyur bas 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa tsam ni lta bas byas pa'i gnyen por 'gyur bas 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since mere non-existence is not suitable as the antidote to the view,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The conception of the meaning of the perfections is the conception and notional attachment to the six perfections.

original: dngos po med pa tsam ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa tsam ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, mere non-existence of entities is not the perfection of the benefit of self and other.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conceptualization of the path of vision is

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la rtog tsam cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la rtog tsam cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the mere conceptualization and notional attachment to the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: yod pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams ni bral ba la nus par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams ni bral ba la nus par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the moments of acquiescence and knowledge of existence are capable of freedom.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The conceptualization of the path of cultivation is

original: de bsam gtan rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bsam gtan rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la rtog cing mngon par zhen pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the conceptualization and notional attachment to the meditative stabilizations, the superknowledges, the immeasurables, and the formless meditative stabilizations.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di rnams la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar 'du shes pa dang / kun shes pa dang / btags pa dang / tha snyad du 'gyur ram zhes bya ba dang / sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu kho nar bslab par bya'o zhes nges par gzung bar shes par byed pa dang /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di rnams la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar 'du shes pa dang / kun shes pa dang / btags pa dang / tha snyad du 'gyur ram zhes bya ba dang / sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu kho nar bslab par bya'o zhes nges par gzung bar shes par byed pa dang /
translated: The passage from “The bodhisattva” up to “the five appropriated aggregates” teaches that the designation, understanding, imputation, and convention of “bodhisattva” is in terms of the five appropriated aggregates.🔽The passage from “The bodhisattva should be ascertained as being like an illusory person” teaches that the bodhisattva is not established as the aggregates and so on.🔽The passage from “Blessed One, in that way, the imputation of bodhisattva to the aggregates and so on is like an illusory person” teaches the refutation of the imputation of bodhisattva to the aggregates and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar sgyu ma'i skyes bu de nyid ces bya ba phung po la sogs pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa' btags pa 'gog pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar sgyu ma lta bu'i gzugs la zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar sgyu ma'i skyes bu de nyid ces bya ba phung po la sogs pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa' btags pa 'gog pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar sgyu ma lta bu'i gzugs la zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The passage from “Blessed One, in that way, the bodhisattva should train in illusory form” teaches the refutation of the imputation of bodhisattva to the person.

original: nang stong pa nyid la phung po la sogs pa mi dmigs pas dpe'i don du mi 'thad pas phung po la sogs pa rnams rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa'i dpe rnams kyis dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas dpe'i don yin pa la gnod pa nyid kyis sems mi zhum pa nyid dang mi dngang ba la sogs pas thams cad shes pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la phung po la sogs pa mi dmigs pas dpe'i don du mi 'thad pas phung po la sogs pa rnams rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa'i dpe rnams kyis dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas dpe'i don yin pa la gnod pa nyid kyis sems mi zhum pa nyid dang mi dngang ba la sogs pas thams cad shes pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba dang /
translated: Since they are not discouraged by the meaning of the examples, they are not frightened and so on.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: They will attain the perfection of all knowledge, the perfection of the knowledge of the aspects of the path, and the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la dngos po mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du @55b shes so //
analyzed: de la dngos po mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du @55b shes so //
translated: In this regard, the apprehension of things as signs is the aggregate of perception.

original: dngos po dang lhan cig tu bdag ces bya ba ni kun shes pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang lhan cig tu bdag ces bya ba ni kun shes pa ste /
translated: The self that is together with things is the aggregate of understanding.

original: dper na bdag gi mig gi gzugs rnams blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na bdag gi mig gi gzugs rnams blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, “I will see visible forms with my eye” and so on.

original: shes pa dang / shes bya dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gdags pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / shes bya dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gdags pa'o //
translated: The designation is the consciousness that is attached to the appearance of the object of knowledge as subject and object.

original: gzhan zin pa dang ma zin pa'i dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs brjod pa ni tha snyad de /
analyzed: gzhan zin pa dang ma zin pa'i dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs brjod pa ni tha snyad de /
translated: The convention is the expression of various kinds of things, both those that are grasped and those that are not grasped.

original: dper na 'jig rten na 'di ni nas so //🔽'di ni chu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten na 'di ni nas so // 'di ni chu'o //
translated: For example, in the world, “This is barley,”🔽“This is water,”

original: 'di ni dri ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dri ma'o //
translated: “This is dirt,”

original: 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: “This is similar.”

original: mi zhum mi 'gong 'gyod par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba tshig gsum po 'de rnams kyi nges par bstan pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin mi dngang mi skrag skrag par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum por shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi zhum mi 'gong 'gyod par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba tshig gsum po 'de rnams kyi nges par bstan pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin mi dngang mi skrag skrag par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum por shes par bya'o //
translated: The three phrases “not discouraged, not frightened, not terrified” should be understood as the three phrases “not afraid, not terrified, not seized with terror,” respectively.

original: de la gnas ma yin pa la 'jigs pa ni dngang ba ste /
analyzed: de la gnas ma yin pa la 'jigs pa ni dngang ba ste /
translated: Therein, fear of what is impossible is being afraid.

original: lam log pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lam log pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a wrong path.

original: de med pas na mi zhum pa'o //
analyzed: de med pas na mi zhum pa'o //
translated: Since that does not exist, there is no discouragement.

original: rgyun du 'jigs pa ni skrag pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun du 'jigs pa ni skrag pa ste /
translated: Fear is terror.

original: 'jigs pa skyes pa slar ma log pas so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa skyes pa slar ma log pas so //
translated: It is the non-reversal of the arising of fear.

original: de med pa ni mi 'gong ba'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni mi 'gong ba'o //
translated: The absence of that is non-timidity.

original: 'jigs pa nges par gyur pa ni skrag par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa nges par gyur pa ni skrag par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Fearfulness is terror.

original: de med pa'i phyir 'gyod par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir 'gyod par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The absence of that is non-remorse.

original: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ni dngos po thams cad pa kho na yin la ;
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po ni dngos po thams cad pa kho na yin la ;
translated: Among them, the first conception of the apprehended is only all entities.

original: gnyis pa ni rnam par byang ba'i dngos po kho na yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rnam par byang ba'i dngos po kho na yin te /
translated: The second is only the entity of purification.

original: 'di ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di dag gi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di dag gi khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the distinction between these conceptions of the apprehended.

original: de ltar byas nas brjod pa gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas brjod pa gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Having done that, the first conception of the apprehended that is expressed is also the second, this is connected with the previous statement.

original: re zhig dang po ni gnyis pa yang yin pa ni dper na /
analyzed: re zhig dang po ni gnyis pa yang yin pa ni dper na /
translated: The first is also the second, for example,

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang por gyur pa dngos po thams cad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang por gyur pa dngos po thams cad pa bzhin no //
translated: like the first conception of the apprehended that is all entities.

original: gnyis pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: gnyis pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The second is the case, not the first.🔽The first is like the conception of the apprehended, which is based on the object of abandonment.

original: dang po ma yin pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog par gnyis pa rnam par byang ba'i dngos po la brten pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dang po ma yin pa ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog par gnyis pa rnam par byang ba'i dngos po la brten pa bzhin no //
translated: The second is like the conception of the apprehended, which is based on the object of purification.

original: yang dag par ldan pa'i khyad par bshad zin to /
analyzed: yang dag par ldan pa'i khyad par bshad zin to /
translated: The distinction of their possession has been explained.

original: // / ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbye bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa ni /🔽gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //
analyzed: // / ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbye bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa ni / gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //
translated: A verse on the classification of the conceptions according to the above explanation

original: gzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: gzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
translated: . The conception of the apprehended is twofold,🔽by way of the basis and its antidote.

original: rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis //🔽de ni so so @56a * //
analyzed: rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis // de ni so so @56a * //
translated: It is threefold by way of the aggregates, etc.

original: rnam pa dgu //🔽rdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyi //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu // rdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyi //
translated: It is ninefold by way of the individual.

original: 'dzin pa'ang rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'ang rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
translated: The conception of the apprehender is also considered twofold,🔽by way of substantial and imputed realities.

original: rang dbang bdag sogs ngo bo dang // phung sogs rten las de bzhin no //
analyzed: rang dbang bdag sogs ngo bo dang // phung sogs rten las de bzhin no //
translated: It is threefold by way of the aggregates, etc.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is ninefold by way of the individual.

original: thabs mkhas pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Skill in means and the spiritual teacher are the two supports of the bodhisattva.

original: zhes gsungs pa de la thabs mkhas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas sems mi zhum pa nyid dang mi dngang ba la sogs pa'i rgyu las brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de la thabs mkhas pa'i dbang du mdzad nas sems mi zhum pa nyid dang mi dngang ba la sogs pa'i rgyu las brtsams nas /
translated: In this verse, from the perspective of skill in means, the cause of not being discouraged, not being frightened, and so on is begun.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams la so sor mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa rnams su mi rtog pas so sor rtog pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams la so sor mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa rnams su mi rtog pas so sor rtog pa dang /
translated: With attention endowed with omniscience, one should individually discern the aggregates of form and so on as impermanent, suffering, empty, selfless, peaceful, and isolated, without conceptualizing them.

original: de dag nyid kyi mi dmigs pa dang ldan zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas de dag nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos ston pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi mi dmigs pa dang ldan zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas de dag nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos ston pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid dang /
translated: Endowed with the nonobservation of those very aggregates, with attention endowed with omniscience, one should teach the Dharma of impermanence and so on with regard to those very aggregates. This is the perfection of generosity.

original: de dag nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs par yid la byed pas mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang / de bzhin du sa'i khams la sogs pa drug po rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzod cing 'dong la so sor rtog pa bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de dag nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs par yid la byed pas mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang / de bzhin du sa'i khams la sogs pa drug po rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzod cing 'dong la so sor rtog pa bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid dang /
translated: The perfection of discipline is to not hold as supreme the mental states of impermanence and so on with regard to those very aggregates and so on.🔽The perfection of patience is to be patient with, to accept and to discern the impermanence and so on of the six elements such as the earth element and so on.

original: phung po la sogs pa rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs par so sor rtog cing mi dmigs pa dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa mi 'dor ba brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs par so sor rtog cing mi dmigs pa dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa mi 'dor ba brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid
translated: The perfection of effort is to possess the mental state endowed with the knowledge of all aspects that is associated with the discernment of the impermanence and so on of the aggregates and so on and to not discard it.

original: dang / theg pa dman pa dang ldan ba'i yid la byed pa'i skabs mi 'byed pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid dang / phung po la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar rnams de'i stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa bkag pa dang /
analyzed: dang / theg pa dman pa dang ldan ba'i yid la byed pa'i skabs mi 'byed pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid dang / phung po la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar rnams de'i stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa bkag pa dang /
translated: It is the perfection of meditative stabilization because it does not create an occasion for mental activity associated with the Hīnayāna, and it is the perfection of wisdom because it refutes the emptiness of those from the aggregates up to the unentangled qualities of the Buddha by the emptiness of that,🔽and it is the perfection of wisdom because it is the knowledge that those and their emptinesses are mutually the nature of that.

original: de rnams dang de'i stong pa nyid dag phan tshun de'i rang bzhin du rjes su shes pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas pha rol tu phyin pa @56b nas /
analyzed: de rnams dang de'i stong pa nyid dag phan tshun de'i rang bzhin du rjes su shes pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang bral bas pha rol tu phyin pa @56b nas /
translated: It is the perfection of skillful means because it is not separated from mental activity associated with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar rnams sgom par byed cing der dmigs te rlom pas ni dngang ba la sogs pa rnams 'gyur bas na thabs la mkhas pa yin par thabs la mkhas pa'i khyad par gyi don du bstan pas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar rnams sgom par byed cing der dmigs te rlom pas ni dngang ba la sogs pa rnams 'gyur bas na thabs la mkhas pa yin par thabs la mkhas pa'i khyad par gyi don du bstan pas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since one who cultivates the unentangled qualities of the Buddha and conceives of them as such becomes frightened, etc., it is taught for the purpose of the special meaning of skill in means.

original: thabs la mkhas pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa bshad zin to /
translated: Skill in means has been explained.

original: // / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su 'dzin pa ni phung po la sogs pa nas ma 'dres pa'i chos kyi bar rnams mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams su mi dmigs par ston zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang
analyzed: // / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su 'dzin pa ni phung po la sogs pa nas ma 'dres pa'i chos kyi bar rnams mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams su mi dmigs par ston zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang
translated: The holding of the spiritual friend is the teaching of the impermanence, etc. of the aggregates, etc. up to the unentangled qualities, without conceiving of them, and the planting of the roots of virtue in the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of the bodhisattvas.

original: chub tu yongs su bsngor 'jug pa rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang bral bar bya ba'i don du snyan dang gas mkhan gyi rang bzor byas pa'i snyan dang gas su rjod par byed pa 'di dang /
analyzed: chub tu yongs su bsngor 'jug pa rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang bral bar bya ba'i don du snyan dang gas mkhan gyi rang bzor byas pa'i snyan dang gas su rjod par byed pa 'di dang /
translated: Those who, for the sake of separating one from the perfections, give advice that is their own invention, saying, “This is advice,”🔽and those who, having come in the guise of a Buddha, say, “What is the use of the perfection of wisdom for you?” and so on, and who teach one’s own actions,

original: sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du 'ongs nas khyod la shes rab kyi pha rol tu byin pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rang gi las dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i mdo la sogs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du 'ongs nas khyod la shes rab kyi pha rol tu byin pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rang gi las dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i mdo la sogs pa rnams dang /
translated: the sūtras and so on that are associated with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,🔽and who demonstrate deception, saying, “You do not have even the slightest thought of enlightenment,” and so on,🔽and those who say, “The sense-spheres, from the eye up to the mental faculty, are empty of the mental faculty and of the phenomena element.”🔽“The sense-spheres, from the form element up to the phenomena element, are empty of the phenomena element and of the eye sense-faculty.”

original: khyod la ni byang chub kyi sems cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa slu ba nye bar ston pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams nas /
analyzed: khyod la ni byang chub kyi sems cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa slu ba nye bar ston pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams nas /
translated: “The sense-spheres, from the eye sense-faculty up to the body sense-faculty, are empty of the body sense-faculty and of the tactile object element.”🔽“The sense-spheres, from the tactile object element up to the phenomena element, are empty of the phenomena element and of the tactile object element.”🔽“The sense-spheres, from the ear sense-faculty up to the nose sense-faculty, are empty of the nose sense-faculty and of the olfactory object element.”🔽“The sense-spheres, from the olfactory object element up to the phenomena element, are empty of the phenomena element and of the olfactory object element.”🔽“The sense-spheres, from the tongue sense-faculty up to the mental faculty, are empty of the mental faculty and of the phenomena element.”🔽“The sense-spheres, from the phenomena element up to the mental faculty, are empty of the mental faculty and of the phenomena element.”🔽“The sense-spheres, from the eye sense-faculty up to the tactile object element, are empty of the tactile object element and of the eye sense-faculty.”🔽“The sense-spheres, from the eye sense-faculty up to the phenomena element, are empty of the phenomena element and of the eye sense-faculty.”🔽“The sense-spheres, from the form element up to the tactile object element, are empty of the tactile object element and of the form element.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar rnams bdag dang bdag bdag gis stong pa yin na /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas ci zhig bya zhes zer ba dang / de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i cha lugs la sogs par 'ongs ba'i bar la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: And likewise, up to those who come in the guise of pratyekabuddhas, śrāvakas, preceptors, instructors, and fellow practitioners of pure conduct.

original: de ltar nye bar ston pa po bdud kyi chos slu ba nye bar ston pa la /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar ston pa po bdud kyi chos slu ba nye bar ston pa la /
translated: Thus, in regard to the teaching of the deceptive Dharma of Māra,🔽the bodhisattva does not teach, “These are the works of Māra.”

analyzed: 'di dag ni bdud kyi las yin no zhes byang chub sems dpa' la mi ston pa 'di ni sdig pa'i grogs po yin no zhes rig par byas nas /

original: de yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par gyi don du mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mtshan nying bstan pas gsungs pa yin no //

translated: It is thorough grasping in every way.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po rnams kyi gnyen po mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi po rnams kyi gnyen po mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The factors conducive to penetration are so called because penetration is the discernment of the four aspects of the truths, and the factors conducive to that are the path of seeing, which is the antidote to the four misconceptions of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de'i cha ste phyogs gcig la skyed par byed pa nyid kyis phan pa'i phyir mthun pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: de'i cha ste phyogs gcig la skyed par byed pa nyid kyis phan pa'i phyir mthun pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are conducive to penetration because they are helpful to it by generating a part, a portion of it.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams bshad zin to /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams bshad zin to /
translated: The factors conducive to penetration have been explained.

original: // / sgrub pa'i rten brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / sgrub pa'i rten brjod par bya ste /
translated: The basis of the practice is to be stated.

original: rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is called gotra, which means “family.”

original: de ni sgrub pa'i chos kyi gnas skabs tha dad pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa'i chos kyi gnas skabs tha dad pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is threefold, because of the differences in the states of the practice of the Dharma.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

original: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug dang // zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug dang // zhes gsungs so //

original: de dag gi ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi ci yin zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
