analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam dag go ;
translated: the four stages conducive to penetration, and the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: / gang gi phyir sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir sems bskyed pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Because, beginning with the generation of the intention,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par rnams dang / mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam de dang der byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par rnams dang / mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam de dang der byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod pa /
translated: in those stages conducive to penetration, on the path of seeing, and on the path of cultivation, one is called a bodhisattva.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ci lags /🔽zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ci lags /🔽zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One, what is the meaning of the word bodhisattva?

original: rtogs pa'i chos de dang de'i rten gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos de dang de'i rten gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The Dharma of realization is the support of that and that.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don ni tshig gi don med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa'i tshig gi don ni tshig gi don med pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, the meaning of the word bodhisattva is the nonexistence of the meaning of the word.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽byang chub la ni skye ba'am yod pa nyid yod pa 'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub la ni skye ba'am yod pa nyid yod pa 'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs par ma yin no ;🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs par ma yin no ; zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Enlightenment is not produced, nor does it exist, nor is it apprehended.🔽This is the meaning of the word bodhisattva.

original: 'dis ni rten byang chub rdzas su med pa'i 'thad pas skye mched drug gi chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rigs ni byang chub sems dpa'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni rten byang chub rdzas su med pa'i 'thad pas skye mched drug gi chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rigs ni byang chub sems dpa'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: This shows the reason for the application of the term bodhisattva to the lineage that has the nature of the six sense spheres, by means of the logical argument that enlightenment is not a substantial reality.

original: dngos por gyur pa'i tshig gi don ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'i tshig gi don ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It shows that the meaning of the word is not a real entity.

original: de la dro bar gyur pa'i rten @57b ni ;
analyzed: de la dro bar gyur pa'i rten @57b ni ;
translated: The support of the state of heat is the six sense spheres.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is thus.

original: nam mkha' la bya'i rjes med ces bya ba dang / rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa la gnas med cing /
analyzed: nam mkha' la bya'i rjes med ces bya ba dang / rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa la gnas med cing /
translated: dreams, illusions, mirages, echoes, optical illusions, reflections, cities of gandharvas, and emanations have no location and are not observed.

original: dmigs su med pa'i dpes gsungs pa yin no //🔽dpe dgu po de dag gi don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i dpes gsungs pa yin no // dpe dgu po de dag gi don bstan pa ni /
translated: These examples are taught.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang po dang yang dag par ldan pa gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgur brjod pa gang yin pa de'i dbye ba dang bstun par bya ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang po dang yang dag par ldan pa gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgur brjod pa gang yin pa de'i dbye ba dang bstun par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of these nine examples should be correlated with the nine aspects of the first conception of apprehending that is associated with the first level of the factors conducive to penetrative insight that were mentioned above.

original: gzhung mngas pa spangs pa'i don du kho bo cag gis ni rnam par ma spros so //
analyzed: gzhung mngas pa spangs pa'i don du kho bo cag gis ni rnam par ma spros so //
translated: For the sake of brevity, I will not elaborate further.

original: de bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gzhan dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam dag la yang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dang / dpe'i don gyi khyad par rnams tshul bstun pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gzhan dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam dag la yang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dang / dpe'i don gyi khyad par rnams tshul bstun pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, one should state the distinctions of the examples and the meanings in accordance with the other factors conducive to penetrative insight, the path of seeing, and the path of cultivation.

original: rtse mor gyur pa'i rten ni yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang /
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa'i rten ni yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang /
translated: The support of the summit is the reality limit, suchness, unmistaken suchness, unaltered suchness, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the determination of dharmas, and the true nature of dharmas.

original: chos nges pa nyid dang / bden pa nyid kyi gnas med pa nyid dang ; dmigs su med pa nyid kyi dpes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos nges pa nyid dang / bden pa nyid kyi gnas med pa nyid dang ; dmigs su med pa nyid kyi dpes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is taught by the example of the absence of a basis and the absence of perception.

original: bzod par gyur pa'i rten ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i gnas dang / de nyid kyi mig la sogs pa'i tshig gi don dang / de nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig gi don dang /

analyzed: de nyid kyi mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig gi don med cing mi dmigs pa'i dpes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words eye and form, etc. of that very illusory person is non-existent and not observable.

original: chos kyi mig gi rten ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang / de nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / de nyid kyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / de nyid kyi stobs la sogs pa rnams dang /

original: de nyid kyi phung po rnams dang / de nyid kyi khams rnams dang / de nyid kyi skye mched rnams dang / de nyid kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams dang / de nyid kyi bsam gtan dang / @58a * //🔽gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa'i tshig gi don med cing mi dmigs pa'i dpes gsungs pa yin no //

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi rten ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i tshig gi don dang / de nyid mig nas yid kyi bar gyi tshig gi don dang / de nyid kyi nang la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid rnams nas stobs la sogs pa'i bar gyi tshig gi don dang /

translated: The basis of the antidote is taught by the example of the light of the rising sun, which has no location and is not observed.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i rten ni bskal pa'i me 'bar ba'i tshe 'du byed kyi gnas med cing rjes su @58b mi dmigs pa nyid kyi dpes bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spang ba'i don gyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i rten ni bskal pa'i me 'bar ba'i tshe 'du byed kyi gnas med cing rjes su @58b mi dmigs pa nyid kyi dpes bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spang ba'i don gyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The basis of the abandonment of the opposing factors is taught by the example of the non-substantiality and non-apprehension of conditioned things at the time of the blazing fire of the eon, in the sense of abandoning the connection with habitual tendencies.

original: de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // zhes bya ba de la /🔽gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba gang dag yin pa de dag yongs su gtugs pa'i rten zhes rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // zhes bya ba de la / gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba gang dag yin pa de dag yongs su gtugs pa'i rten zhes rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The basis of their thorough knowledge,🔽Here, thorough knowledge refers to the thorough knowledge of the antidotes and the abandonment of the opposing factors.

original: de la gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i rten ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i rten ni 'di yin te /
translated: The basis of the abandonment of the conceptual thoughts of the antidotes and opposing factors is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa'i phung po rnams la de dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnas med cing nye bar mi dmigs pa nyid kyi dpes shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i don gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa'i phung po rnams la de dang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnas med cing nye bar mi dmigs pa nyid kyi dpes shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i don gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The aggregates of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the awareness of liberation of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, are taught by the example of the absence of a basis and non-apprehension of their counteragents.

original: shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: shes rab snying brtser bcas pa dang // zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Wisdom and compassion,

original: shes rab dang snying brtse'i rten ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: shes rab dang snying brtse'i rten ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the basis of wisdom and compassion is this:

original: shes rab dang snying brtse 'bar ba dang 'dod pa dag gis 'khor ba ji srid bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos nyid du gnas pa nyid kyis gnyi gar mi gnas par shes par bya ba'i don gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying brtse 'bar ba dang 'dod pa dag gis 'khor ba ji srid bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos nyid du gnas pa nyid kyis gnyi gar mi gnas par shes par bya ba'i don gyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The non-abiding in both is taught by the meaning of the knowledge that, through wisdom and compassion, one abides in the nature of nirvana for as long as samsara exists, through the blazing and desire of wisdom and compassion.

original: slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // zhes bya ba de la /
translated: and the uncommon disciples.

original: thun mongs ma yin pa'i yon tan gyi rten ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: thun mongs ma yin pa'i yon tan gyi rten ni 'di yin te /
translated: The uncommon qualities are the basis of the uncommon qualities.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa gza' dang / nor bu rin po che dang / skar ma'i ye shes rnams dang / thun mong ma yin pa mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gzhan du 'phro ba'i ye shes kyi snang ba nyid kyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa gza' dang / nor bu rin po che dang / skar ma'i ye shes rnams dang / thun mong ma yin pa mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gzhan du 'phro ba'i ye shes kyi snang ba nyid kyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the planets, jewels, and stars, and the uncommon knowledge of the infinite transference of consciousness to other worlds, which is taught.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The order of benefit for others.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi go rims kyi rten ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi go rims kyi rten ni 'di yin te /
translated: The order of benefit for others is the basis of the order of benefit for others.

original: lha'i ris su rnam par gzhag pa dang 'dra bar 'jig rten gyi dge legs gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i ris su rnam par gzhag pa dang 'dra bar 'jig rten gyi dge legs gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it is the cause for the world's increasing goodness, like the arrangement of the celestial realms.

original: ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //
analyzed: ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //
translated: The effortless engagement of wisdom.

original: 'jug pa'o // de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa'o // de ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mthar go bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: mthar go bar byed pa ni /
translated: The final understanding is:

original: rten la rigs zhes brjod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten la rigs zhes brjod ces bya ba'o //
translated: The support is called the lineage.

original: de la ye shes lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i rten ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la ye shes lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i rten ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the support for the spontaneous engagement of intuition:

original: sems can thams cad kyi don @59a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don @59a * //
translated: the benefit of all sentient beings🔽and the spontaneous intuition of abiding in bliss in this life.

original: dang mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dang mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is called the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:🔽The light of the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, has no abode and is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'od la gnas med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de la gnas ni rten gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'od la gnas med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de la gnas ni rten gyi dngos po'o //
translated: Here, abode is the nature of support.

original: med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la med pa las bzlog pa 'di yod pa'i don yin pa'i phyir med pas mi dmigs pa stong pa yin no //
analyzed: med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la med pa las bzlog pa 'di yod pa'i don yin pa'i phyir med pas mi dmigs pa stong pa yin no //
translated: Not apprehended means not apprehended by non-existence, because this existence is the opposite of non-existence. Therefore, it is the emptiness of non-apprehension due to non-existence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub gang gis byang chub gang gis byang chub sems dpa' yin pa dang / gang byang chub sems dpa' yin pa'i tshig gi don gyis chos 'di dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub gang gis byang chub gang gis byang chub sems dpa' yin pa dang / gang byang chub sems dpa' yin pa'i tshig gi don gyis chos 'di dag thams cad ni ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the awakening by which a bodhisattva is a bodhisattva, and the words by which a bodhisattva is a bodhisattva, all these phenomena are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
translated: They are formless, cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /
translated: are not something that can be characterized,

original: mtshan nyid gcig pas te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pas te /
translated: and are of a single defining mark.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,🔽they are without defining marks.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gzhir byas nas bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gzhir byas nas bkod pa yin te /
translated: The words “are without defining marks” are set forth here based on the four aspects of the factors conducive to penetration and the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: de ni khyad par rtogs par byed pa dang / ma mthong ba mthong ba dang / mthong ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i gnas skabs rnams su rim pa ji lta ba bzhin dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i gnas skabs ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dag dang /
analyzed: de ni khyad par rtogs par byed pa dang / ma mthong ba mthong ba dang / mthong ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i gnas skabs rnams su rim pa ji lta ba bzhin dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i gnas skabs ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dag dang /
translated: They are the states of realizing the distinctive, seeing what was not seen, and being close to seeing what was seen. In these states, respectively, the states of being conjoined and not conjoined with entities and nonentities are eliminated.

original: blta bar bya ba dang / mthong ba dang / phan tshun 'brel ba snga na med bskyed pa dag dang / de yod pas gzhan mi 'jug pa'i rang bzhin dang / tha dad pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang / mthong ba dang / phan tshun 'brel ba snga na med bskyed pa dag dang / de yod pas gzhan mi 'jug pa'i rang bzhin dang / tha dad pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas 'di lta ste /
translated: The object of seeing, seeing, and their mutual relationship, the production of what did not exist before, the nature of not engaging in other due to the existence of that, and the absence of difference.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: In this way, it is said, “because of the absence of intrinsic reality.”

original: tshig gnyis dang / gsum dang / gcig dang / gcig yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gnyis dang / gsum dang / gcig dang / gcig yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that there are two phrases, three phrases, one phrase, and one phrase.

original: 'o na sgrub pa'i rten gyi mtshan nyid gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na sgrub pa'i rten gyi mtshan nyid gang yin snyam na /
translated: Now, if one wonders what is the characteristic of the basis of establishment,

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad kyi chags pa med pa nyid dang yod par ma gyur pa nyid la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad kyi chags pa med pa nyid dang yod par ma gyur pa nyid la bslab par bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, the great bodhisattva should train in the non-attachment to all phenomena and their non-existence.

original: rtog pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: By being without conceptualization and without discrimination.

original: de la @59b rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po dang de'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: de la @59b rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po dang de'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: Therein, conceptualization and discrimination are the clinging to things and their signs.

original: de med pa'i phyir chags pa med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir chags pa med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Since it does not exist, one should understand that there is no attachment.

original: yod par ma gyur pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: yod par ma gyur pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The non-existence of all dharmas is suchness.

original: des na 'dis ni chos kyi dbyings nyid 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs sgrub pa'i rten yin no zhes ston par byed do //🔽gal te rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs 'ga' zhig yod na ci'i phyir thog ma dang bral ba'i 'khor bar gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mya ngan las 'das kyang da dung du yang rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'i srog
analyzed: des na 'dis ni chos kyi dbyings nyid 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs sgrub pa'i rten yin no zhes ston par byed do // gal te rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs 'ga' zhig yod na ci'i phyir thog ma dang bral ba'i 'khor bar gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mya ngan las 'das kyang da dung du yang rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'i srog
translated: Thus, this shows that the dharma-dhātu itself is the support for the accomplishment of the naturally existing lineage, because it is the cause of the noble dharmas.

original: chags rnams mya ngan las 'das she na /
analyzed: chags rnams mya ngan las 'das she na /
translated: If there is some naturally existing lineage, why is it that in beginningless samsara, even though the Buddhas, who are as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, have entered nirvana, living beings who possess the naturally existing lineage have not yet attained nirvana?

original: de ni nyes dmigs rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni nyes dmigs rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it has four disadvantages.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / grogs ngan pa dang / phongs pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang rnams ni de'i nyes pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / grogs ngan pa dang / phongs pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang rnams ni de'i nyes pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The faults of the spiritual gene are the presence of afflictions, bad friends, poverty, and dependence on others.

original: 'dir ni bar chad med pa nyid la rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs su mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni bar chad med pa nyid la rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs su mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Here, the unobscured state of the gene is considered to be the natural state.

original: gzhan dag ni rigs ni skye mched drug gi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rigs ni skye mched drug gi khyad par yin no //
translated: Others say that the spiritual gene is a distinctive characteristic of the six sense spheres.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: rkyen gyis yang dag par blangs pa dang / rang bzhin du gnas pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rkyen gyis yang dag par blangs pa dang / rang bzhin du gnas pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: that which is acquired through conditions and that which is natural.

original: de dag gis ni rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs la rang bzhin du brjod pa'i don brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs la rang bzhin du brjod pa'i don brjod dgos so //
translated: But they must explain what is meant by the natural state of the natural gene.

original: rgyu'i rnam grangs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu'i rnam grangs yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is a synonym for cause,

original: rkyen gyis yang dag par blangs pa yang de yin pa des na don gyi khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: rkyen gyis yang dag par blangs pa yang de yin pa des na don gyi khyad par ci yod /
translated: then the acquired gene is also that, so what is the difference in meaning?

original: chos nyid kyi rnam gangs yin pa la ni nyes pa 'di med do //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rnam gangs yin pa la ni nyes pa 'di med do //
translated: But there is no fault if it is a synonym for reality.

original: yang na de dag gi rigs ni btags pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na de dag gi rigs ni btags pa yin la /
translated: Or, the gene of those is a nominal gene.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid pa yin te /
translated: This is the definition.

original: nges na de dang 'di dang 'grigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nges na de dang 'di dang 'grigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If you accept it, then it is not correct to say that the dharmadhatu is the lineage.

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings rigs nyid yin na thams cad rigs la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings rigs nyid yin na thams cad rigs la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: If the dharmadhatu itself is the lineage, then everyone would possess the lineage,

original: de ni spyir gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni spyir gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is generally accepted that the dharmadhatu exists in all beings.🔽But we say that the lineage is that which, when it is focused on, becomes the cause of the noble qualities.

original: ji ltar dmigs pa na 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyur 'gyur ba de ltar rigs yin par brjod pa de na 'dir ha cang thal ba ji ste tshol bar byed /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa na 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyur 'gyur ba de ltar rigs yin par brjod pa de na 'dir ha cang thal ba ji ste tshol bar byed /
translated: Why do you seek to create such an absurd consequence here?

original: de lta na'ang chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir /
analyzed: de lta na'ang chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir /
translated: Even though that is so, since the dharmadhatu is undifferentiated,🔽it is not possible to differentiate the lineages, saying,

original: 'di ni nyan thos kyi rigs so //🔽'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos kyi rigs so // 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
translated: This is the lineage of the sravakas,🔽this is the lineage of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: @60a * // sangs rgyas kyi rigs so zhes /🔽rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
analyzed: @60a * // sangs rgyas kyi rigs so zhes / rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
translated: and this is the lineage of the buddhas.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'jam dpal gal te chos kyi dbyings gcig dang / de bzhin nyid gcig dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gcig yin na de la ji ltar snod dang snod ma yin par gdags zhes gsungs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gal te chos kyi dbyings gcig dang / de bzhin nyid gcig dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' gcig yin na de la ji ltar snod dang snod ma yin par gdags zhes gsungs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if the expanse of reality is one, suchness is one, and the very limit of reality is one, how can it be designated as a vessel or non-vessel?

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: This is true,

original: de lta na yang 'jim pa'i rdzas gcig las mngon par grub cing me gcig gis so btang ba ni sbrang rtsi dang li kha ra la sogs pa'i snod tha dad pa yin pa'i dpes /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jim pa'i rdzas gcig las mngon par grub cing me gcig gis so btang ba ni sbrang rtsi dang li kha ra la sogs pa'i snod tha dad pa yin pa'i dpes /
translated: but the example of a single lump of clay, which is fashioned into different vessels by a single potter and fired by a single fire,

original: brten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //
analyzed: brten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //
translated: shows that the distinctions of the supported phenomena

original: de yi dbye bar rab tu brjod //
analyzed: de yi dbye bar rab tu brjod //
translated: are said to be the distinctions of the expanse of reality.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang la 'du byed cung zad kyang med pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa yin la /
analyzed: gang la 'du byed cung zad kyang med pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa yin la /
translated: That which is not the slightest bit compounded is uncompounded.

original: 'dus ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs yin te /
translated: That which is uncompounded is the family of the āryas.

original: rigs de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: rigs de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa'o //
translated: That family is undifferentiated, being equal to space.

original: rigs de ni thams cad kyi tshe chos kyi de bzhin nyid yin pas chos kyi ro gcig tu gyur pa nyid kyis rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs de ni thams cad kyi tshe chos kyi de bzhin nyid yin pas chos kyi ro gcig tu gyur pa nyid kyis rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: That lineage is the suchness of all dharmas, and is permanent because it is the one taste of all dharmas.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni yon tan sgrol ba'i don gyis na rigs te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni yon tan sgrol ba'i don gyis na rigs te /
translated: The verbal derivation is that it is a lineage because it liberates qualities,

original: de las yon tan de dang de dag skye zhing 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las yon tan de dang de dag skye zhing 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because those qualities arise and emerge from it.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, all noble persons are distinguished by the unconditioned.

original: yang gzhan dag na re go zhes bya ba ni sa yin la sa'ang gnas yin te /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re go zhes bya ba ni sa yin la sa'ang gnas yin te /
translated: Others say that go means earth, and earth is a place,

original: lhan cig spyod pas gnas pa srog chags rnams la go'i sgrar nye bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pas gnas pa srog chags rnams la go'i sgrar nye bar 'dogs so //
translated: because it is designated as the word go for living beings who live together.

original: de bas na sas bsdus pa rnams skyob par byed pas rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na sas bsdus pa rnams skyob par byed pas rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is a lineage because it protects those included in the earth.

original: yang na phyogs rnams go yin pa'i phyir phyogs na gnas pa'i srog chags rnams la go zhes gdags te /
analyzed: yang na phyogs rnams go yin pa'i phyir phyogs na gnas pa'i srog chags rnams la go zhes gdags te /
translated: Or, because the directions are go, living beings in the directions are designated as go.

original: des na gang skyob par byed pas rigs yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na gang skyob par byed pas rigs yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the family is that which protects.

original: sems bskyed pa dang thar pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang po kho nar rigs bshad par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang thar pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang po kho nar rigs bshad par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: But the generation of the thought of enlightenment, the aids to penetration, and liberation have the family as their antecedent.

original: de ni don gyi go rims yin la 'bras bus rgyu rtogs par byed pa yin pa 'di ni rtogs pa'i go ri mas yin no //
analyzed: de ni don gyi go rims yin la 'bras bus rgyu rtogs par byed pa yin pa 'di ni rtogs pa'i go ri mas yin no //
translated: The order of the meaning is the order of the cause and effect, while the order of the realization is the order of the effect and cause.

original: 'di ltar rigs nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams la 'khrul par mthong pa yin @60b no ;
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams la 'khrul par mthong pa yin @60b no ;
translated: Thus, the family is seen to be the antecedent of the aids to penetration.

original: / ji skad du /
analyzed: / ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mtshan nyid pa dag gis /
analyzed: mtshan nyid pa dag gis /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: gnyis slob rigs las bzlog nas ni //
analyzed: gnyis slob rigs las bzlog nas ni //
translated: The two learners, having turned away from the family,

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur gzhan gsum yang //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur gzhan gsum yang // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: become Buddhas, and the other three also.

original: sgrub pa'i rten bshad zin to /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rten bshad zin to /
translated: The basis of the practice has been explained.

original: // / sgrub pa'i dmigs pa bshad par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: // / sgrub pa'i dmigs pa bshad par bya ba yin pas /
translated: The object of the practice should now be explained.

original: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
translated: The object is all dharmas.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the purport of the verse.

original: de dag kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de yang dge la sogs pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang dge la sogs pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: They are virtue, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes nonvirtue and indeterminate states.

original: ci de dag kho na tsam du zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de dag kho na tsam du zad dam zhe na /
translated: Are they only those?🔽Mundane right conceptualization,🔽those which are asserted to be supramundane,

original: 'jig rten pa yi rtog pa dang // gang dag 'jig rten 'das 'dod dang // zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // gang dag 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi rtog pa dang // gang dag 'jig rten 'das 'dod dang // zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // gang dag 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
translated: defiled and undefiled phenomena,🔽compounded and uncompounded phenomena,🔽the phenomena common to disciples,

original: slob ma thun mong chos rnams dang // gang dag thub pa'i thun mong min //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: slob ma thun mong chos rnams dang // gang dag thub pa'i thun mong min // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and the uncommon phenomena of the Sage.

original: de la dge ba'i chos ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: Among them, virtue is as follows:

original: mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs rgya cher gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs rgya cher gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “Respect for mother, respect for father, respect for ascetics, respect for brahmins,” and so on.

original: dge sbyong nyid la dge sbyong du 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: dge sbyong nyid la dge sbyong du 'dzin pas so //
translated: Here, respect for ascetics is respect for the virtuous.

original: mi dge ba'i chos ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Nonvirtuous phenomena are the ten nonvirtuous karmic paths, such as

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: killing, stealing, and so on.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams ni mi dge ba kho na yi na pas so //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams ni mi dge ba kho na yi na pas so //
translated: Because killing and so on are nonvirtuous alone.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams ni /
translated: Neutral phenomena are

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: neutral karmic paths of body, speech, and mind.

original: lung du ma bstan pa nyid ces nges par gzung bar shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa nyid ces nges par gzung bar shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is understood that the term neutral is specified.

original: gzhan du na lus la sogs pa'i las dge ba 'am mi dge bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na lus la sogs pa'i las dge ba 'am mi dge bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, virtuous or nonvirtuous karmic paths of body and so on would not be established.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos ni phung po lnga dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyam par 'jug pa zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos ni phung po lnga dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyam par 'jug pa zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Mundane phenomena are the five aggregates, the sources, the elements, the ten virtuous karmic paths, the absorptions, the immeasurables, and the formless🔽absorptions.

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: These are mundane because they are not antidotes to the view of self.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ni bsam gtan bzhi dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽sangs rgyas kyi @61a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ni bsam gtan bzhi dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / sangs rgyas kyi @61a * //
translated: The supramundane dharmas are extensively taught, beginning with the four dhyanas,

original: chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad ces bya ba'i bar du rgya cher gsungs pa yin te /🔽'phags pa'i lam gyis bsdus pas na /
analyzed: chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad ces bya ba'i bar du rgya cher gsungs pa yin te / 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsdus pas na /
translated: up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: They are supramundane because they are included in the noble path.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni /
translated: The dharmas with outflows are taught, beginning with

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the five appropriated aggregates, up to

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ; mngon par shes pa drug dag ste /🔽zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ; mngon par shes pa drug dag ste / zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the four formless absorptions and the six supernormal knowledges.

original: de dag ni bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kho na yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kho na yin pas so //
translated: They are dharmas with outflows because they are not antidotes to the view of self.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni //
translated: The dharmas without outflows are

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad dag ste zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad dag ste zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'di dag ni bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po yin pas zag pa med pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po yin pas zag pa med pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: These are unconditioned because they are the antidote to the view of self.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos ni ;
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos ni ;
translated: Conditioned phenomena are

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / khams gsum par ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / khams gsum par ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the desire realm, the form realm, the formless realm, phenomena not included in the three realms, and the factors of enlightenment and so forth.

original: 'di dag ni rkyen rnams tshogs shing 'dus nas byas pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rkyen rnams tshogs shing 'dus nas byas pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas nyid yin pas so //
translated: These are conditioned because they are produced by the assembly and combination of conditions.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos ni /
translated: Unconditioned phenomena are

original: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du mi mngon pas te /
analyzed: gang la skye ba med cing 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du mi mngon pas te /
translated: those where arising, disintegration, and change from abiding are not evident.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “the extinction of desire and so on” refers to the above.

original: 'di dag ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis na 'dus ma byas pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis na 'dus ma byas pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are unconditioned because they do not depend on causes and conditions.

original: thun mong gi chos ni /
analyzed: thun mong gi chos ni /
translated: The common qualities are

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the four meditative states, the four formless states, and so on.

original: 'di dag ni rgyud gzhan la yang 'byung ba nyid kyis na thun mong gi chos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rgyud gzhan la yang 'byung ba nyid kyis na thun mong gi chos nyid kyis so //
translated: They are common qualities because they occur in the mindstreams of others.

original: thun mongs ma yin pa'i chos ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: thun mongs ma yin pa'i chos ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The uncommon qualities are the thirty-seven factors of awakening, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and so on.

original: 'di dag ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la 'byung ba nyid @61b kyis na thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la 'byung ba nyid @61b kyis na thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: They are uncommon qualities because they occur only in the mindstream of a perfect buddha.

original: gang dag chos kyi dbyings nyid dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems pa de dag gis dmigs pa'i dag pa gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba ji ltar yin zhes bya ba brjod dgos so //
analyzed: gang dag chos kyi dbyings nyid dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems pa de dag gis dmigs pa'i dag pa gong nas gong du khyad par du 'gro ba ji ltar yin zhes bya ba brjod dgos so //
translated: Those who think that the ultimate realm itself is the object should be asked how it is that the purity of the object becomes increasingly pure.

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
translated: The ultimate realm is like the elements of water, gold, and space,

original: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
analyzed: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
translated: and is accepted as pure.

original: ces bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that,

original: de lta na ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa spong ba med pas dag pa phyogs gcig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa spong ba med pas dag pa phyogs gcig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then since there is no abandonment of the conceptualizations of the side of purification and the side of the counteragent, it follows that there is only a partial purification.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ni dmigs pa med do zhes 'byung bas khyed kyi phyogs la yang dmigs pa dag pa'i mthar thug par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ni dmigs pa med do zhes 'byung bas khyed kyi phyogs la yang dmigs pa dag pa'i mthar thug par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: And since it is said, “Subhūti, in the knowledge of all aspects there is no object,” is it not the case that in your system the purity of the object does not reach its peak?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams 'khrul pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams 'khrul pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because phenomena are mere error.

original: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gnyis ni dngos po'o //
translated: Subhūti, duality is a thing.

original: gnyis su med pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Non-duality is non-entity.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur la /
translated: This will be explained.

original: gnyis kyang 'khrul pa las gzhan ci zhig yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis kyang 'khrul pa las gzhan ci zhig yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And what else could duality be but error?

original: mngon par zhen pa ni gnyis kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni gnyis kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Attachment is the characteristic of duality,

original: 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: but not error.

original: de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is not said to have the nature of the grasped and the grasper.

original: des na 'di la khyed 'khrul par zad do //
analyzed: des na 'di la khyed 'khrul par zad do //
translated: Therefore, you are simply mistaken about this.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin gtsor gyur pa ni rigs yin la rnam 'gyur gtsor gyur pa ni dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin gtsor gyur pa ni rigs yin la rnam 'gyur gtsor gyur pa ni dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the primary nature is the class, and the primary evolute is the object.

original: gnyi ga'ang gnyi gar ma bkag pa des na rten dang dmigs pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba dang dmigs pa dag pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'ang 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'ang gnyi gar ma bkag pa des na rten dang dmigs pa dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba dang dmigs pa dag pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'ang 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since both are not denied in both, the distinction of the characteristics of the basis and the object, and the ultimate object, are also tenable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad kyi ma chags pa nyid dang / yod par gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad kyi ma chags pa nyid dang / yod par gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattvas should train in the nonattachment of all phenomena and in their nonexistence.

original: don gang zhe na /
analyzed: don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of that?

original: rang bzhin dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rnam 'gyur ni dmigs pa yin gyi rnam par 'gyur ba tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rnam 'gyur ni dmigs pa yin gyi rnam par 'gyur ba tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The object is the intrinsic nature and the mode of relatedness of the transformations, not just the transformations themselves.

original: rtog pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pa'i tshul du chos thams cad khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba de la gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag go //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pa'i tshul du chos thams cad khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba de la gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag go //
translated: All phenomena should be understood in the manner of nonduality, because of the absence of conceptualization and the absence of discrimination. Therein, duality is the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: dmigs pa rnam par dag pa la brjod par bya ba mang du yod de /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par dag pa la brjod par bya ba mang du yod de /
translated: There is much to be said about the purity of the object.

original: de ltar @62a * //
analyzed: de ltar @62a * //
translated: Thus,

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough with the elaboration!

original: sgrub pa'i dmigs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dmigs pa bshad zin to /
translated: The object of accomplishment has been explained.

original: // / sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba brjod par bya ba yin pas sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang / spong dang rtogs dang gsum po la //
analyzed: // / sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba brjod par bya ba yin pas sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang / spong dang rtogs dang gsum po la //
translated: The three greatnesses of mind,🔽abandonment, and realization

original: chen po gsum gyi rang byung gi //
analyzed: chen po gsum gyi rang byung gi //
translated: are the three natural greatnesses

original: ched du bya ba 'di zhes bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ched du bya ba 'di zhes bya // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: of the purpose of practice.

original: de la sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba 'di ni rnam par gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba 'di ni rnam par gsum ste /
translated: The purpose of practice is threefold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: mchog nyid chen po nyid dang / spong ba chen po nyid dang / rtogs pa chen po nyid do //
analyzed: mchog nyid chen po nyid dang / spong ba chen po nyid dang / rtogs pa chen po nyid do //
translated: the greatness of supremacy, the greatness of abandonment, and the greatness of realization.

original: gang gi phyir mchog nyid chen po nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba ci'i slad du /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mchog nyid chen po nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba ci'i slad du /
translated: Because of the greatness of supremacy,🔽the Bhagavān was asked:🔽“Bhagavān, why is it called ‘bodhisattva mahāsattva’?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi zhes gsol pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu las brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi zhes gsol pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba'i sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu las brtsams te /
translated: Why is it called ‘bodhisattva mahāsattva’?”

original: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang sems can gyi sde chen po brgyad pa la sogs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i bar gyi mchog nyid du byed pas so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po chen po dang sems can gyi sde chen po brgyad pa la sogs pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i bar gyi mchog nyid du byed pas so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and those who are irreversible, into the foremost.

original: de la sems can gyi phung po chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: de la sems can gyi phung po chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi tshogs rnams so //
translated: Therein, the great mass of beings is the groups of beings.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Great means immeasurable.

original: gcig kyang 'khor ba thog ma med par 'jug pa na chen po nyid du 'gyur bas phung po zhes smos so //
analyzed: gcig kyang 'khor ba thog ma med par 'jug pa na chen po nyid du 'gyur bas phung po zhes smos so //
translated: Since even one person, when entering into beginningless cyclic existence, becomes great, he is called a mass.

original: sems can gyi sde zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa dang lam gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa'i sde'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: sems can gyi sde zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa dang lam gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa'i sde'i dbye bas so //
translated: The great group of beings is the division of those who have entered and those who abide in the result of the path.

original: gang dag gis sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid du byed par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gis sems can thams cad kyi mchog nyid du byed par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are those dharmas by which he becomes the foremost of all beings?

original: de la rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen pos rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed de /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' chen pos rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed de /
translated: There, Subhuti, the great being, the bodhisattva, should generate the vajra-like mind.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: I will become the best of all sentient beings.

original: de la rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The generation of the vajra-like thought is this:

original: gang 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi don du 'khor ba dpag tu med par go cha bgo bar bya'o snyam pas 'khor ba dpag tu med pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ste /
analyzed: gang 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi don du 'khor ba dpag tu med par go cha bgo bar bya'o snyam pas 'khor ba dpag tu med pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ste /
translated: Thinking, “For the sake of all sentient beings, I will don the armor for an immeasurable samsara,” one takes up an immeasurable samsara and gives away all one’s possessions.

original: bdag gis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong bar bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong bar bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said in the line, “I will give away all my possessions.”

original: sems @62b can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang de dag theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sems @62b can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang de dag theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med pa ste /
translated: It is the sameness of mind toward all sentient beings and the fact that, although they are completely liberated by the three vehicles, there is no complete liberation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par rtogs pa nyid kyis dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems ma 'dres pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya ba nyid kyis te /🔽ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa 'dod pa'i sems dang ma 'dres pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par rtogs pa nyid kyis dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems ma 'dres pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad par bya ba nyid kyis te / ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa 'dod pa'i sems dang ma 'dres pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By realizing that all phenomena are unborn and unceasing, and by practicing the six perfections with a mind of non-attachment to the Listeners' Vehicle, etc.🔽Non-attachment means not being attached to the thought of desiring the Listeners' Vehicle, etc.

original: thams cad rjes su spong bar rtogs pa yongs su grub pa la bslab par bya ba nyid kyis dang / chos thams cad tshul gcig tu mngon par sgrub pa rtogs par bya ba nyid kyis dang / sems can ngan 'gror skyes pa thams cad las /
