original: sems can re re'i don gyi phyir de rnams yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du rang nyid kyis de'i sdug bsngal rnams nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes khas blangs pas phyis rang gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can re re'i don gyi phyir de rnams yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du rang nyid kyis de'i sdug bsngal rnams nyams su myong bar bya'o zhes khas blangs pas phyis rang gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: Because of the vow to experience their sufferings oneself until they attain final nirvāṇa, for the sake of each and every being, later one perfects one’s own accumulations.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because of the very wish for unsurpassable perfect enlightenment.

original: sems dang po bskyed phyin chad 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems mi skyed pas sems rlabs po che dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i sems la rlom pa med pas mi sgul ba dang /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed phyin chad 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i sems mi skyed pas sems rlabs po che dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i sems la rlom pa med pas mi sgul ba dang /
translated: From the first production of the thought of enlightenment onward, one does not produce thoughts of attachment and so on, nor thoughts of śrāvakas and so on, so one has a vast mind. One has a mind of mental attention endowed with the knowledge of all modes, so one is unshakable.

original: sems can thams cad skyob cing yongs su mi gtong ba dag dang / des rlom sems su yang mi byed pas na phan pa dang bde ba'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad skyob cing yongs su mi gtong ba dag dang / des rlom sems su yang mi byed pas na phan pa dang bde ba'i sems kyis so //
translated: One does not abandon or forsake any being, and one does not become conceited about that, so one has a mind of benefit and happiness.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dbyer med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dbyer med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is the indivisibility of all phenomena.

original: de la dga' zhing mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de ni chos la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la dga' zhing mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa de ni chos la dga' ba'o //
translated: To delight in that and to take pleasure in it is to delight in the Dharma.

original: de la sgom zhing mang du byed pa gang yin pa de ni chos la kun du dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: de la sgom zhing mang du byed pa gang yin pa de ni chos la kun du dga' ba yin te /
translated: To cultivate and increase that is to take delight in the Dharma.

original: chos la dga' ba dang / kun dga' ba dang / kun dga' ba'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar dang /
analyzed: chos la dga' ba dang / kun dga' ba dang / kun dga' ba'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi bar dang /
translated: Taking delight in the Dharma, taking delight in the Dharma, and being devoted to the practice of taking delight in the Dharma, and all the aspects of emptiness, the factors of awakening, up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par @63a * //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par @63a * //
translated: the vajra-like absorption, and the absorption of liberation and freedom from defilement that is like space,

original: grol zhing gos pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas sems can gyi mchog nyid du byed pas te /
analyzed: grol zhing gos pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas sems can gyi mchog nyid du byed pas te /
translated: one should abide in all of them by way of the absence of apprehending anything, and one should become the most excellent of sentient beings.

original: de ni rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang dag la gnas nas sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog tu bya ba'i chos ni de dag yin te /
analyzed: de ni rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang dag la gnas nas sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog tu bya ba'i chos ni de dag yin te /
translated: Subhūti, those are the dharmas by which the bodhisattvas who abide in the perfection of wisdom are the best of the great mass of beings, the best of the great collection of beings.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes brjod do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes brjod do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are called bodhisattva mahāsattvas.”

original: spong ba chen po nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu spobs pa ston pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: spong ba chen po nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu spobs pa ston pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: With reference to their great abandonment, the passage that shows the eloquence of the elder Śāriputra is stated.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag tu lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: It begins with “Blessed One, the view of a self, the view of a sentient being,” and so on.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa lta ba dang / yod pa dang med par lta ba dang / phung por lta ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa lta ba dang / yod pa dang med par lta ba dang / phung por lta ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It continues with “the view of annihilation and permanence, the view of existence and nonexistence, the view of the aggregates,” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad dang sems can yongs su smin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / byang chub rnam par rtogs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar gyi lta ba rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa nyid kyis dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad dang sems can yongs su smin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / byang chub rnam par rtogs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar gyi lta ba rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos ston pa nyid kyis dang /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma by way of the method of nonapprehension in order to abandon the views from the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha through the complete ripening of sentient beings, the complete refinement of the buddhaverse, the realization of enlightenment, and the turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: thabs la mi mkhas pa dang ldan pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i lta ba'i tshogs bskyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa nyid kyis bshad ma thag pa mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa khyad par du byed pa 'di nyid kyis so //
analyzed: thabs la mi mkhas pa dang ldan pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i lta ba'i tshogs bskyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa nyid kyis bshad ma thag pa mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa khyad par du byed pa 'di nyid kyis so //
translated: The method of nonapprehension that has just been explained is distinguished by its skill in means, since it is the cause for the generation of the mass of views as they have been explained, which is possessed by one who is unskilled in means.

original: de la nga rgyal bskyed pa'i don gyis na bdag ste /
analyzed: de la nga rgyal bskyed pa'i don gyis na bdag ste /
translated: Here, the self is that which has the meaning of generating pride,

original: 'di las nga rgyal skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las nga rgyal skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because pride arises from it.

original: zhum pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na sems can no //
analyzed: zhum pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na sems can no //
translated: Sentient beings are those who have a nature of depression.

original: srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis skal pa mnyam pa'i ris yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du gnas pas na srog go //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis skal pa mnyam pa'i ris yongs su rdzogs kyi bar du gnas pas na srog go //
translated: Life force is that which causes the continuity of a sentient being to remain for as long as it does, due to the power of the life faculty.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis skye zhing mi rtag pa nyid kyis skye bar byed pas na skye ba pa'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis skye zhing mi rtag pa nyid kyis skye bar byed pas na skye ba pa'o //
translated: Birth is that which causes the continuity of a sentient being to arise due to the power of karma and affliction and due to impermanence.

original: kham du byas pa la sogs pa'i zas kyis rgyas par byed pas na gso ba'o //
analyzed: kham du byas pa la sogs pa'i zas kyis rgyas par byed pas na gso ba'o //
translated: Nourishment is that which causes the continuity of a sentient being to grow due to the nourishment of morsels and so on.

original: bu ni lus la bya bar bshad la de la brten pas na pu ru sha ste skyes bu'o //
analyzed: bu ni lus la bya bar bshad la de la brten pas na pu ru sha ste skyes bu'o //
translated: A son is explained as one who is born from the body. One who is born from the body is a puruṣa.

original: gzhan dag ni skyes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pas skyes bu yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni skyes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pas skyes bu yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: One who possesses the male faculty is a puruṣa.

original: de dag gi ltar na gzugs mkhas pa rnams skyes bu ma yin par 'gyur @63b bas mi rigs so //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na gzugs mkhas pa rnams skyes bu ma yin par 'gyur @63b bas mi rigs so //
translated: According to them, those who lack form would not be puruṣas.

original: 'gro ba rnams su yang dang yang du brten pas na gang zag go //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su yang dang yang du brten pas na gang zag go //
translated: A person is one who is born again and again in the various reincarnating beings.

original: gtsor yid kyi las las skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yid las skyes so //
analyzed: gtsor yid kyi las las skyes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yid las skyes so //
translated: A mental factor is one who is born from the mind because it is born primarily from mental karma.

original: nga rgyal srung bar byed pa yin pas na shes bdag go //
analyzed: nga rgyal srung bar byed pa yin pas na shes bdag go //
translated: A self of consciousness is one who protects the pride of “I am.”

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i las la brten pa nyid kyis na byed pa po'o//
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i las la brten pa nyid kyis na byed pa po'o//
translated: It is the agent because it is the basis of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: de'i rnam par smin pas so sor kun du myong bas na tshor ba po'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pas so sor kun du myong bas na tshor ba po'o //
translated: It is the experiencer because it experiences the results of those actions.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir shes pa po'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir shes pa po'o //
translated: It is the knower because it is the basis of mental consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mthong ba po'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mthong ba po'o //
translated: It is the seer because it is the basis of the five sense consciousnesses such as visual consciousness.

original: sngon byung ba da ltar med pas na chad pa'o //
analyzed: sngon byung ba da ltar med pas na chad pa'o //
translated: It is annihilation because what previously existed does not exist now.

original: rang bzhin gyis yod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa ma yin pas na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa ma yin pas na rtag pa'o //
translated: It is eternal because what exists by intrinsic nature does not become nonexistent.

original: yod pa gang yin pa de ni rtag tu yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: yod pa gang yin pa de ni rtag tu yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: What exists is always existent.🔽What does not exist is always nonexistent.

original: med pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: med pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: This is the view of existence and nonexistence,

original: dper na ser skya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ser skya ba lta bu'o //
translated: like the view of the Sāṃkhyas.

original: lta ba lhag ma ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: lta ba lhag ma ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The remaining views are easy to understand and so are not explained.

original: rtogs pa chen po nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rtogs pa chen po nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The following verse is stated from the perspective of the great realization.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi spobs pa ston pas /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi spobs pa ston pas /
translated: The elder Subhūti, through the power of his eloquence,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi sems /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi sems /
translated: said, “Blessed One, the thought of awakening,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sems /
translated: the thought equal to the unequaled,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma lags pa'i sems /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma lags pa'i sems /
translated: the thought not shared in common with all hearers and solitary buddhas,

original: zag pa ma mchis shing khams gsum du ma gtogs pa'i sems gang lags pa de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi slad du chags pa ma mchis te /
analyzed: zag pa ma mchis shing khams gsum du ma gtogs pa'i sems gang lags pa de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi slad du chags pa ma mchis te /
translated: the thought that is uncontaminated and not included in the three realms, is not attached because of the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba'i grangs su mchi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is counted as a bodhisattva great being.”

original: de la byang chub pa'i don gyi sems ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub pa'i don gyi sems ni /
translated: In that regard, the thought of awakening means

original: byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: the thought of awakening.

original: mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams yin la /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams yin la /
translated: “Unequaled” means the buddhas.

original: de rnams dang mnyam pas na mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang mnyam pas na mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Since it is equal to them, it is equal to the unequaled.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar sems de ni sems ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems de ni sems ma yin te /
translated: Because that thought is not a thought.

original: des na de de la chags pa med do //
analyzed: des na de de la chags pa med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not attached to that.

original: yang mnyam pa gang gis sems de mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas dang mnyam zhe na /
analyzed: yang mnyam pa gang gis sems de mi mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas dang mnyam zhe na /
translated: Moreover, by what equality is that mind equal to the unequaled Buddha?🔽Śāriputra, here the bodhisattva does not see any dharma as arising or ceasing, and so on, up to

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chos 'ga' yang skye ba'am 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽skye ba la sogs pa las rnam par grol ba thun mong ma yin pa'i sems kyi mtshan @64a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chos 'ga' yang skye ba'am 'gag par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / skye ba la sogs pa las rnam par grol ba thun mong ma yin pa'i sems kyi mtshan @64a * //
translated: he does not see any dharma as defiled or purified.

original: nyid kyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the nature of mind, liberated from arising and so on, taught by the uncommon characteristics.

original: de la sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste zhas bya ba ni brda las byung ba nas so //
analyzed: de la sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste zhas bya ba ni brda las byung ba nas so //
translated: There, from the first generation of the mind of enlightenment means from the stage of the outcome of resolve.

original: chos gang la'ang skye ba'am 'gag pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni drod kyi dus su snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs dang 'gag pa dang skye ba dmigs pa'i tshul du mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang skye ba'am 'gag pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni drod kyi dus su snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs dang 'gag pa dang skye ba dmigs pa'i tshul du mi mthong ba'o //
translated: He does not see any dharma as arising or ceasing means at the stage of heat, he does not see arising and ceasing in the manner of observing the prior and subsequent states.

original: 'grib pa dang 'phel ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'grib pa dang 'phel ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He does not see increase or decrease means

original: rtse mo'i dus su sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs dag zad pa dang khyad par du 'gro ba dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rtse mo'i dus su sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs dag zad pa dang khyad par du 'gro ba dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi mthong ba'o //
translated: At the time of the peak, one does not see the prior and subsequent states by way of observing their exhaustion and their progress.

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i dus su rtogs pa'i chos kyi nye ba dang ring ba dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba mi mthong zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i dus su rtogs pa'i chos kyi nye ba dang ring ba dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi mthong ba'o //
translated: One does not see coming and going means that at the time of acceptance, one does not see the Dharma that is realized as near or far by way of observing it.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi dus su mi mthun pa dang ; gnyen po'i phyogs dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi dus su mi mthun pa dang ; gnyen po'i phyogs dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi mthong ba'o //
translated: One does not see complete afflictions and complete purification means that at the time of the supreme mundane quality, one does not see the side of discordant classes and their antidotes by way of observing them.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gang gis mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gang gis mi mthong ba'o //
translated: With regard to what means with regard to the path of seeing.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang ; rnam par byang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni lugs las bzlog pa'i rim pas bsgom pa'i lam ston pa yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang ; rnam par byang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni lugs las bzlog pa'i rim pas bsgom pa'i lam ston pa yin te /
translated: The absence of complete afflictions and the absence of complete purification indicate the path of meditation in reverse order.

original: ji ltar mthong ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba la mngon du phyogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is directed toward the vision of that.

original: de la nyan thos kyi sems med do //
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi sems med do //
translated: There is no thought of the śrāvaka,🔽no thought of the pratyekabuddha.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems med do zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa'i thun mong ma yin pa nyid gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems med do zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa'i thun mong ma yin pa nyid gsal bar byed do //
translated: This clarifies the uniqueness of the generation of the thought.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs kyang chags pa med pa yin nam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs kyang chags pa med pa yin nam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, is form also unattached because of the emptiness of essential nature?”

original: chos thams cad chags pa med pa nyid du khas blangs pas ni rtogs pa'i yul ston pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad chags pa med pa nyid du khas blangs pas ni rtogs pa'i yul ston pa yin no //
translated: By accepting that all dharmas are unattached, the object of realization is taught.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gzugs med pa'ang gzugs la chags pa med dam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gzugs med pa'ang gzugs la chags pa med dam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, is the formless also unattached to form?”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du med pa'ang sangs rgyas kyi chos la chags pa med pa nyid du khas blangs pas sems de la mngon par zhen pa dang rlom sems bkag cing shes bya dang shes pa gnyis mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas rtogs
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du med pa'ang sangs rgyas kyi chos la chags pa med pa nyid du khas blangs pas sems de la mngon par zhen pa dang rlom sems bkag cing shes bya dang shes pa gnyis mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas rtogs
translated: Up to the unshared qualities of the Buddha are the absence of attachment to the qualities of the Buddha.

original: pa la brten pa'i chags pa bsal bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: pa la brten pa'i chags pa bsal bar ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the attachment based on the realization of the mind is eliminated by the application of the nonapprehension of the object of knowledge and the knower.

original: de la gzugs ni gzugs kyi chos nyid @64b do //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni gzugs kyi chos nyid @64b do //
translated: Form is the reality of form.

original: de la ma chags pa ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin du 'khrul pa rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ma chags pa ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin du 'khrul pa rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonattachment to it is because of the analysis of the error of the nature of form.

original: des na de ltar spangs pa dang rtogs pa'i khyad par can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog tu byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma rgyal ba la rgyal ba'i ched du bya ba dang chos mthun par byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par can nyid sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de ltar spangs pa dang rtogs pa'i khyad par can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi sde chen po'i mchog tu byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma rgyal ba la rgyal ba'i ched du bya ba dang chos mthun par byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par can nyid sgrub pa'i ched du bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the great collection of the special abandonment and realization, and the characteristic of being the supreme of the great group of sentient beings, should be known as the purpose for the special bodhisattva, in conformity with the purpose of the unconquered for the sake of victory.

original: dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the object and the purpose?

original: dmigs pa ni de'i che ba yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni de'i che ba yin la /
translated: The object is its greatness.

original: ched du bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa skal ba yin te /
analyzed: ched du bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa skal ba yin te /
translated: The purpose is the future fortune,

original: mda' ltong sbyor ba dang 'bem la phog pa dang chos mtshungs so //
analyzed: mda' ltong sbyor ba dang 'bem la phog pa dang chos mtshungs so //
translated: similar to the application of the bow and the striking of the target.

original: sgrub pa'i rten dang / dmigs pa dang / ched du bya ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rten dang / dmigs pa dang / ched du bya ba bshad zin to /
translated: The basis, object, and purpose of accomplishment have been explained.

original: // / da ni sgrub pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni sgrub pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, accomplishment should be stated.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la ni spyir dkar po'i chos kyi rten can gyi bya ba ni sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi yul la ni spyir dkar po'i chos kyi rten can gyi bya ba ni sgrub pa yin la /
translated: In general, the practice of the three objects of omniscience is the practice of the basis of virtuous dharmas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi la ni mngon par rtogs pa so so la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis thogs pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa gang yin pa de ni sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi la ni mngon par rtogs pa so so la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis thogs pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa gang yin pa de ni sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the four realizations such as the complete realization of all aspects and so on, the practice of each realization is the practice of the six perfections that are unobstructed and unattached.

original: gnas brtan gang po'i spobs pa gsal bar byed pas sgrub pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gnas brtan gang po'i spobs pa gsal bar byed pas sgrub pa'i don gsungs pa ni /
translated: The elder Pūrṇavardhana's Bright Lamp on the Compendium of Abhidharma explains the meaning of practice:🔽Bhagavān, that being is clad in great armor.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can de ni go cha chen po bgos pa lags so zhes bya ba nas brtsams pas 'di tsam zhes tshad yongs sum bcad pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi don du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa'i go
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can de ni go cha chen po bgos pa lags so zhes bya ba nas brtsams pas 'di tsam zhes tshad yongs sum bcad pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi don du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa'i go
translated: From this point on, the meaning of the phrase for the sake of the realm of sentient beings whose extent is not fully ascertained is that the practice of the perfections such as generosity is the armor of the bodhisattva.

original: cha sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba shes pa'i don dang / de nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod pas sgrub pa gzhan gyi don gtsor gyur pa yin pa'i khyad par shes par bya ba'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: cha sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba shes pa'i don dang / de nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod pas sgrub pa gzhan gyi don gtsor gyur pa yin pa'i khyad par shes par bya ba'i don gyis gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the knowledge of the activity that is in accord with the practice, and the meaning of the practice that is the foremost benefit for others, because it establishes in complete nirvana and perfect enlightenment.

original: de la sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, practice is fourfold:

original: go cha'i sgrub pa dang / 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang / tshogs kyi sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: go cha'i sgrub pa dang / 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang / tshogs kyi sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: armor-practice, engagement-practice, accumulation-practice, and definite-release-practice.

original: de la go cha'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug gi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la go cha'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug gi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therein, with reference to the six kinds of armor-practice,

original: gsungs pa ni /🔽de dag so sor sbyin pa sogs //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni / de dag so sor sbyin pa sogs //
translated: it is said:🔽Each of those is included in the six kinds

original: rnam pa drug tu bsdus @65a * //
analyzed: rnam pa drug tu bsdus @65a * //
translated: of generosity, etc.

original: pa yis // go cha'i sgrub pa gang yin te /
analyzed: pa yis // go cha'i sgrub pa gang yin te /
translated: That is the armor-practice,

original: drug tshan drug gis ji bzhin bshad //🔽ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: drug tshan drug gis ji bzhin bshad // ces bya ba yin no //
translated: explained by the six sets of six.

original: ji ltar na drug tshan drug gis yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na drug tshan drug gis yin zhe na /
translated: How is it by the six sets of six?
